title: Computer Science/Engineering - Firmware Co-Op (Spring 2018)
desc:
As a Computer Science/Engineering Co-op with Diebold Nixdorf you will have multiple opportunities to gain corporate experience by being involved in projects, staff meetings, and corporate events.  You will be trained on the appropriate tools, languages, and documentation required.  Diebold Nixdorf will provide a great learning experience, and you will be invited to participate in events with other Interns and Co-ops.   Your essential functions could include:  Working with team members to setup and debug development issues Evaluating requirements, creating designs, coding, debugging/creating installation packages and documenting developed software Putting together equipment racks for ATMs and circuit cards Assist with new firmware releases for ATMs Working under direction of senior level software engineers Writing test scripts   Complete research assignments on the latest software tools to handle various tasks Automation design for existing manual processes and data gathering Learning database systems and how to interface with them using code 


Must be currently attending a college or university pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering Must have and maintain a 3.0 GPA or higher Hands-on hardware exposure with basic knowledge of software Minimal programming skills Experience with Microsoft Office products Diebold Nixdorf, Incorporated is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, national origin, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Process Engineer - Materials Science
company: Image Associates Inc., pearl AT jobspot.com
desc:
Opportunity to join a global company which manufactures
powders used in industrial coating applications. This position requires a
degree in materials science, materials engineering, ceramics, metallurgy, or
similar. You will be responsible for developing and improving powder
manufacturing processes for an industrial materials manufacturer. Will lead new
product development projects, and oversee activities from initiation to
completion. 

This job is located on Long Island, New York. Please apply for this job if you are interested in living and working on Long Island.

To work in this manufacturing environment, you should have
familiarity with key process equipment such as spray drying, blending, plasma
densification, dust collection, particle size classification, rotary equipment,
piping, and electrical equipment. You will develop and maintain SOP’s for
equipment operation and manufacturing. Explore ways of improving the R&D
powder manufacturing process to improve yield, reduce costs and increase
efficiency. Explore new powder manufacturing technologies, equipment or
upgrades. Assist with equipment trouble shooting. Generate and update equipment
manuals and processing procedures. Prepare engineering reports, status reviews,
and presentations.
 
You will also be responsible for scale up and new
qualification projects. Work with people in Production to improve processes,
and address safety concerns. Will also interface with R&D and Quality to
address product quality concerns. Generate, maintain, and update engineering
documents, and maintain data in SAP.


Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science, Materials
Engineering, Metallurgy, or Ceramics required, Master’s degree preferred.
Should have at least two years of paid, post-graduation, paid experience
working in materials engineering and powders at a manufacturing company. Should
have familiarity with key process equipment such as spray drying, blending,
plasma densification, dust collection, particle size classification, rotary
equipment, piping, and electrical equipment. Experience with software including
MS Office, MS Project, and SAP is expected.

title: High School Science Teacher
desc:
Hamadeh Educational Services is seeking to hire a certified High School Science Teacher (DI or DX) to join our team! Candidate must be data driven and able to meet the needs of all learners through differentiated instruction. Strength in the area of building rapport with students and positive parent relationships is a must. Candidates need to work in a professional learning community and be a part of teacher based team meetings.

Academy Mission: 
The Academies mission is to provide their students with a quality education that focuses on a core curriculum and international cultures including the study of language. The academies provide an education of the whole child by integrating different diverse cultural and ethnic backgrounds to their college-preparatory program serving families in the Greater Detroit area.  

Responsibilities:
Prepares for classes assigned and shows written evidence of preparation upon request of supervisor(s)
Creates a classroom environment that is conducive to learning and appropriate to the maturity and interests of the students.
Prepares and implements lesson plans that are aligned with curriculum maps for the grade level/subject area, & include activities for differentiated instruction to meet the varied learning styles , abilities, and needs of students in a culturally attentive environment
Plans activities and projects that are relevant to students’ needs.
Performs other duties as may be assigned by the Principal or Superintendent or their designee.


Requirements:
Must possess a Bachelor’s Degree in the study of Education
Must have a Michigan Teacher Certification with a 6-12 Integrated Science Endorsement
Thorough knowledge of Michigan Core Curriculum
Must be computer literate and proficient in the use of Microsoft Office software
Must possess excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Experience working in culturally diverse setting.
Ability to work independently and within a team environment
Flexible open minded, self driven team member
Must be authorized to work in the US

title: Life Science Sr Project Manager
desc:
Together we can make a differenceAt Getinge we are dedicated and passionate about helping our customers save lives and ensure excellent care. We provide innovations for operating rooms, intensive-care units, sterilization departments and for life science companies and institutions. Our portfolio combines well-known product brands such as Maquet, Pulsion, Atrium, Lancer and Datascope – just to name a few.A career at Getinge will provide career opportunities that both inspire and challenge. Here, you can make a difference every day.Ideal candidate resides in or around Lake Mary, FLJOB SUMMARY:The Sr. Project Manager’s responsibilities will cover planning, organizing and supervising all aspects of projects for supplying capital equipment to research facilities, and pharmaceutical companies. Additional responsibilities include being the direct liaison between the customer, sales, factory and operational personnel. Provide pre-order consultation and support for Requests for Quotations, (RFQs), bid documents and contracts. Coordinate dissemination of all information and assure that project is built to customer specifications and within budget. Prepare, issue, and gain approval of submittals and final manuals. Overall responsibility for start-up and follow through to sign off. Resolve issues as they develop. Initiate and maintain project records, files, databases and schedules. Visit customers and field installations when required. It is expected that the Senior Project Manager has mastered project management skills and has demonstrated above average understanding of the project life cycle concept, exceptional multi-tasking skills and ability to offer guidance and direction to the project management team as a leader by driving, supporting, and contributing to developing strategies processes.JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:Provide pre-order consulting and support to Sales Operations. Among other duties, this may include consultation and responses to RFQs, bid documents and contracts technical review, equipment layout, and pricing and proposal preparation for the full product line. Perform project related functions, as related to respective process equipment, comprising of coordination of all phases required to effectively execute a project, inclusive of  kick-off meetings, submittal preparation, issue, tracking and acceptance, project documentations and status updates while acting as customer liaison.  Also responsible for coordinating Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT), shipping/delivery and installation, start-up and commissioning, final documentation, and resolution of  closeout issues. Work independently with little or no supervision making decisions as related to proper project execution, included but not limited to specification compliance and system design efficacy. Interact directly with project stakeholders including customers, architects/engineers, vendors and internal personal to assure successful completion of project deliverables and scope within time, budgetary and quality constraints. Senior Project Managers may be called upon to mentor new hires. Engage in implementation of new and or changed processes, and assess internal processes for improvements. This will include evaluation and implementation of PM software and future upgrades. Review contract for scope and deliverable acceptability and resolve implementation concerns. Support field sales personnel with multi-product proposals and work with applications engineers to coordinate room layouts and utility information, pre-order to assure consistency post order. Support PM team as consultant and liaison between Sales and SSC on high-end/complex projects. Participate in weekly project opps calls encompassing all related products. Participate and contribute in bi-weekly Project Resources staff meetings. Maintain accurate schedules and archives in project management tool and backlog. Prepare and track and gain approvals for submittals, coordinate changes, manage issues, identify and mitigate risks, plan and update activities through project management tool. Accompany customers on factory visits, sometimes requiring trips abroad. Execute FAT when necessary. Visit job-sites and attend job-site meetings as technical and logistical representative of the company. Prepare final manuals and assure proper distribution. Track internal and external closeout of projects and authorize archiving. Validate project order documentation at project initiation. Assist customers, sales reps, department managers, and field personnel as needed with technical documentation and or information for current and past projects. When applicable, manage company and strategy related projects apart from “project” order business. Perform other related duties as required.
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor of Science degree in related technical or business field PMI certification  required Or equivalent combination of education and experience
RELATED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:Knowledge of process equipment and operation of LS product lines. Minimum 5 years of project management experience and/or field sales experience in related field. Familiarity in preparation of proposals and bid documents. Ability to read and interpret architectural drawings, piping and instrumentation drawings, electrical schematics, utility demands, and functional specifications Must be able to interpret and manipulate data from computer-generated reports, software programs, technical manuals and written correspondence. Must have demonstrated experience with, MS Office Suite, MS Project and other related desktop computing competencies. Participation in industry associations, i.e.; PMI, AALAS., AAMI
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:Moderate travel requirements, Up to 75% field time. Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport. Must have a high capacity to effectively and professionally communicate with others in writing, telephone and in person. Extensive time on computer and telephone.  4-6 hours per day.
Getinge Group is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. #CBA##LI-AL1We look forward to receiving your application. If you share our passion and believe that saving lives is the greatest job in the world, then we look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired medtech company.

title: Life Sciences Sales Executive - Raleigh, NC
desc:
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES•Identify and pursue business opportunities with current and new clients in assigned territory•Promote SGS’ image and service listings in a way which will further the company’s objectives•Participate and prepare sales goals each fiscal year and track the progress to ensure that the objectives are met•Create territory plan based on LSS business strategyREPORTING LINE•Vice President, AFL North America / Director of SalesSPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES•Visit new prospects and new customers to sell and support SGS Life Science Services small molecule and / or biopharmaceutical suite of services•Grow market share by wining new customers within defined geographic territory•Identify prospects, perform need analysis, identify opportunities and follow up to close•Promote North American network and expertise to prospects and customers•Maintain up to date knowledge of SGS’s analytical capacity and capabilities•Participate in strategic and business decisions regarding new service opportunities with biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device companies•Execute sales activities, including sales planning, visits, reports and results•Maintain current and accurate data in the Sales Pipeline tool on all sales activities within assigned territory accounts and their opportunities•Adhere to Customer Centric selling methodologies•Use internet, phone, tradeshow, market intelligence database and other lead sources to generate new opportunities•Ensure communication and coordination with the labs to facilitate the successful handover and execution of the new and current business•Participate in arranging and hosting prospective client visits to all North American locations•Network with key players and maintain an understanding of external market developments to ensure SGS becomes the service provider of choice to a greater share of the market•React upon business opportunities forwarded by Operations and inform them on progress•Assist in decision involving price structure and price negotiations with all final decisions to be made by laboratory Business Manager•Ensure that any client complaints are forwarded to the appropriate individual(s) and ultimately resolved in a prompt and professional manner•Review and/or prepare contracts as required (Master Service Agreements, etc)•Report on developments in the market place and competitor activities•Forward potential opportunities to other Business Lines as appropriate•At all times, adopt a safe behavior by exercising due regard for the health and safety of SGS employees and clients, in line with SGS policies and procedures•At all times, comply with SGS Code of Integrity and Professional ConductKPIsIn order to achieve annually assigned revenue and new business targets, a Sales Executive is expected to maintain the following KPIs•15 face to face meetings per month•Create $400,000 in new opportunities per month•Create 20 new opportunities per month•Create $200,000 in new quotes per month•Create 10 new quotes per month•Obtain sales from 40 new clients a year

PROFILE•Four year degree in relevant field (e.g. Business, marketing, life science). Advance degree preferred 9MBA, MS)•Five years of business development experience in sales/marketing required•Business development experience with pharmaceutical and medical device companies•High level of written and verbal EnglishREQUIRED SKILLS•Professional, high standards in personal presentation•Background in pharm / biopharm preferred•Ability to manage relationships under stress•Ability to work and think independently and coordinate several activities simultaneously•Good communication, interpersonal and listening skills•Self-motivated and able to achieve shared objectives•Ability to achieve and carryout effective selling techniques•Ability to maintain service oriented mindset•Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines•Maintain enthusiasm and perseverance•Effective negotiation and persuasion skills•Must have an understanding of microbiology and analytical chemistry•Must possess solid critical thinking skills; must be able to anticipate and solve problems in a systematic mannerOTHER INFORMATION•Travel is required, sometimes at short notice•Safety is a top priority within SGS. Every employee within the organization has defined HSE Duties and Responsibilities to ensure that the organization meets its objectives of no harm to personnel, damage to equipment, or harm to the environment.•To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Nothing contained herein restricts the company’s rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. •SGS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Environmental Chemist/ Metals Analyst
desc:
Apex Life Sciences is seeking qualified candidates for an Environmental Chemist position in Fayetteville, NC!

Job Description
We are currently seeking an Environmental Chemist for Metals Analyst position within our Fayetteville, NC laboratory. Our ideal candidate will be familiar with ICP, HPLC, and GC instrumentation, and have experience preparing and analyzing water and soil samples. This is a full-time position, offering a full suite of company benefits.
 
POSITION OVERVIEW:
Under limited supervision of the Department Supervisor, Analysts, working in an accredited commercial laboratory, conduct basic and advanced chemical and/or biological tests and analyze results to determine composition, reactions, and chemical and/or physical properties of a variety of sample types. They may also review processes and perform data review to ensure alignment with established SOPs and accuracy.

MAJOR/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Following established SOP’s and adhering to state, federal and other accrediting body requirements, Analysts prepare and process samples, and collect information about the composition of substances to support the analytical testing needs of clients, for such purposes as quantitative analysis, product development, and improvement of analytical methodologies.
Perform peer review and work with the QA team to maintain up to date SOPs.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Prepare necessary standards, solutions, reagents, media, and samples for sample analyses.
Utilize specialized laboratory equipment and instrumentation to process and analyze samples; Perform advance level sample analysis.
Perform equipment and instrumentation set up.
Troubleshoot laboratory instrumentation issues.
Investigate and address inconsistencies with data output.
Involved in test method development.
Accurately record observations and data, and interpret results.
Maintain the integrity of procedures.
Create data reports; Review data and reports for accuracy; Perform peer reviews.
Monitor and address sample backlog issues.
Maintain accurate, up to date logs, notebooks and equipment records.
Perform necessary laboratory administrative functions such as filing paperwork, photocopying, reviewing of data, and entering data into computerized LIMS.
Comply with and promote Personnel, Safety, and Quality Program.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Job Requirements:
Strong understanding of principles, terminology, practices, techniques and instrumentation commonly used in a laboratory setting.
Ability to interpret data, record observations, prepare reports, and perform peer review.
Ability to effectively prioritize work and manage time to meet deadlines and rush orders.
Computer literacy.
Ability to work with delicate laboratory equipment.
Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal formats.
Ability to understand and adhere to established SOPs.
Education and Experience: 
Bachelor’s degree with a major in an applied science.
Familiarity with ICP, GC, HPLC required.
Prior water and soil testing experience.

If interested in this position please send a copy of your updated resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

title: Data Warehouse Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau)
desc:
Data Warehouse Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau): Lombard, IL, Long-Term Contract 
My direct client in the commercial real-estate space is seeking a Data Warehouse Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau) who has worked with reporting tools like Tableau and is familiar with data warehousing and cubes. They are looking for someone who has experience with a wide range of client-facing applications to help with data integration, reporting, and analysis efforts as needed across many projects nationwide. You will work with development teams, business leaders, and SME's to dig deep into data and help influence strategic business decisions. 

What the right person will enjoy: 
Competitive compensation and benefits!
You will be taking a lead role in strategy and architecture for the platform

Work for an Industry leader in real-estate services 
Long-Term contract where if you are a STELLAR employee they will keep you long-term and potentially convert you!
Very casual/laid-back environment with one day per week work from home and flex hour opportunities!


 
Apply today if your background includes: 
4+ years of relevant experience
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in information systems, computer science, or relevant field
Knowledge of database design practices
SQL Server and TSQL Fundamentals; Knowledge of SQL performance tuning; Knowledge of database features such as views, stored procedures, data types
Reporting/Analysis tools like:  Tableau, Microsoft Reporting Services, Power Pivot
Experience with data warehouse techniques, cubes, MDX

Maintain contacts with technical application teams as needed to be able to research data issues

Coordinate with data management, developer, and business intelligence teams on data related tasks
Identify gaps in business requirements vs data available and document those issues
Documentation of data related requirements or definition
Troubleshoot data related problems/inconsistencies

title: Big Data Engineer/ Architect
desc:
Unlock Your Career Potential: Technology at ADP. Do you enjoy exploring, identifying and inspiring the future of the workplace and the lives of millions of people? At ADP, the world’s largest B2B cloud company, our Technology team is comprised of brilliant engineers, architects, data scientists, infrastructure experts, and more. We were first in our industry to offer a SaaS solution and continue to push the envelope utilizing the latest operating platforms to deliver the highly automated, intelligent and predictive solutions that are redefining what is possible. Named one of Forbes’ “Most Innovative Companies” and one of Computerworld’s “100 Best Places to Work in IT”, we are committed to leading the way in product development and research, empowering you to bring to life the latest innovations that will forever change the way businesses manage their most vital asset, employees.
POSITION SUMMARY 
We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. 
Because we work on the cutting edge of a lot of technologies, we need someone who is a creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively. 
Role:
Design and develop meta-data driven data models, data pipeline, data ingestion strategy, data manipulation and data transformation
Design, develop and maintain high-throughput, ultra-low latency products, leveraging technologies such as MongoDB, ElasticSearch, etc .
Work closely with our engineering team to integrate your amazing innovations and algorithms into our production systems.
Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed.
Requirements:
8+ years of experience with Advanced degree in Computer Science with significant exposure to data architecture, data mining and distributed systems.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, good understanding of different data structures, algorithms and their usage in solving business problems
In-dept hands-on expertise of NoSQL technologies (document, key value, columnar etc) – MongoDb, CouchDB, Cassandra, Redis, etc
Fundamental knowledge of parallel processing, cloud computing and map reduce programming paradigm
Experience evaluating and implementing best practices tools and techniques for software development.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
ADPTECH #LITECH 
Software in the Cloud. Experts on the Ground: ADP powers the working world with comprehensive solutions that drive business success. Consistently named one of the “Most Admired Companies” by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by Forbes® as one of “The World’s Most Innovative Companies,” ADP has over a half-million clients around the globe and 65 years of experience as one of the largest providers of human capital management solutions world-wide.
At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

title: Data Assistant
desc:
ChildNet Youth and Family Services, Inc is currently seeking a Data Assistant for our Behavioral Health Services division in Long Beach, CA.
Behavioral Health Services (BHS) provides comprehensive services including individual/group therapy for at-risk children and their families.POSITION SUMMARY
The Outcome Measures Data Assistant will be responsible for data entry of outcome measures for Evidence Based Practices and other treatment modalities that require data collection. In addition, the Outcome Measures Data Assistant will assist in developing and maintaining systematic processes for collecting, tracking and coding outcome measures for all clinical staff.The Outcome Measures Data Assistant will be responsible for, but not necessarily limited to, the following:

Score and enter mental health outcome measures data and complete auto-summary reports for clinicians
Assist with tracking completed pre/post and follow-up outcome measures for mental health services including at least six different evidence-based mental health practices
Assist with entering outcome measures summary data into database system
Communicate with 70+ clinicians to request and follow-up on measures
Identify data issues and assist with data cleaning and training projects
Ensure clinicians have access to the electronic and paper outcome measures documents
Participate in special outcome data projects
Assist the  Data and Outcomes Director as needed to ensure outcome measures compliance for the organization, LA County Department of Mental Health requirements and Evidence Based Practices model specific requirements
Any other duties as assigned




The Outcome Measures Data Assistant shall possess:Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Behavioral Sciences or Public Health Field, AND one (1) year experience with data collection and entry.
Prior experience using databases is preferred. 
One (1) year of experience working within the mental health field is desirable.
Strong organization and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to work within a team or independently.
Ability to read, write and speak English.
Ability to communicate effectively both written and verbally.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, is required.

EOE M/F/V/DWHO WE AREChildNet Youth & Family Services, a nonprofit corporation headquartered in Long Beach, CA. We provide Counseling, Education, Foster Care and Residential Services to at-risk children. ChildNet has been at the forefront of providing innovative and quality care to thousands of deserving children and their families for over 40 years.MISSIONTo provide safe homes, education and counseling to vulnerable children and families.OUR EMPLOYEESAre a diverse group of professionals who create a culture of caring with our clients and within the organization.WHAT WE OFFERStability, Career Advancement, Tuition Reimbursement, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and 403b with discretionary employer match after 2 yrs.WE MAKE A DIFFERENCE! COME AND MAKE A DIFFERENCE WITH US!

title: Data Architect
desc:

title: Sr. Data Architect
company: Do You Dream Data? We are seeking a Senior-level Data Architect to be a strategic member of the Data Solutions team and lead the design and development of new applications. You will be responsible for everything data – establishing standards, policies and...
location: Los Angeles / Orange County, CA, CA
desc:
Do You Dream Data?
We are seeking a Senior-level Data Architect to be a strategic member of the Data Solutions team and lead the design and development of new applications. You will be responsible for everything data – establishing standards, policies and procedures company-wide on a global scale. You are responsible for keeping our data clean, secure, governed and within compliance. This will include dealing with data from the architectural level down: the physical structure / internal operations and interaction with all other systems. You will be continuously analyzing and looking for opportunity to improve the following: data processes, capacity, time, costs and effectiveness. You will also be a partner to the business and offer technical guidance for the short-term and long-term strategies as it relates to data. 
In this global organization, you will have the ability to make an impact while being supported in your career growth. Excellent compensation and benefits package offered. 



The ideal candidate will have a BS degree in a related field, along with at least 5 years experience with data warehouse design and analysis (additional experience can substitute for the degree). Experience with data quality and data integration technologies, and SQL Server required. Highly prefer working knowledge of Informatica (either Data Quality or Powercenter), along with advanced skills with XML and HTML. Proven track record of establishing global governance and MDM (Master Data Management) policies and procedures also needed. Experience with Atlas 6.0 Reporting tool a major plus. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills necessary, along with the ability to work as part of a team, or independently as needed. 
Required:
Data Warehouse Analysis / Design
Data Quality Technologies
Data Integration
MS SQL Server
Informatica Powercenter
Informatica Data Quality
HTML, XML
Atlas 6.0 preferred

**IMPORTANT: If offered employment, applicant must be able to show proof of eligibility to work in the United States as required by Federal Law.  Ashley Ellis will not sponsor applicants for work visas, nor do we offer corp-to-corp contract opportunities. We do not accept resumes from 3rd parties.

title: Sr. Account Executive - Data Center/Colocation
desc:
The Senior Account Executive is responsible for delivering sales results within his/her assigned geography.  This individual will leverage Internap’s suite of Public Cloud services via Data Center and Colocation client acquisition to attain his/her assigned sales quota. 
A successful Sr. AE has exceptional organizational skills; written and verbal communication skills; a demonstrated ability to multi-task; and strong desire to prospect and close New Logo business. He/she is a high-intensity, ‘hunter’ with a demonstrated track record of aggressively building a funnel and translating opportunities into orders.  Industry related selling experience and/or technical competency are strongly preferred.    
Responsibilities: 
Include, but are not limited to the following: 
Complete all company required training, but pro-actively seek and obtain the knowledge/capabilities to enable sales success in your market.
Understand and articulate (orally, written, PowerPoint presentation) the company value proposition into specific customer benefits
Build the sales funnel:
“Cold" lead development – tele sales, hosted industry events (open-houses, product demos, etc), cold-calling, follow-up marketing lead generated opportunities, etc.
“Warm" lead development – existing account expansion, RFP response, former account recovery, etc.
Meet/exceed sales quotas
Identify and develop partners to accelerate sales (agents, datacenter partners, etc)
Attend training on sales techniques, technology, presentation skills.
Develop familiarity with Salesforce.com and utilize as basis for: contact management database, sales opportunity tracking, sales forecast and report generation.


Qualifications: 

BA/BS degree required or Associates Degree with 5+ years of relevant work and industry experience. 

5 yr+ outside sales experience with consistent > 100% quota attainment. 
5 years+ Selling Data Center Services and/or Colocation

Outside sales experience in telecommunications, data or Internet industry. 

KEY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES 
Ability to solve problems quickly and completely.
Ability to overcome customers’ objections.
Effective stand up presentation skills
Effective listening skills.
Excellent written and electronic communication skills.
Maintains professional appearance and demeanor.
Ability to work collaboratively with all departments on sales issues.
Demonstrates high standards of ethical conduct.

title: Sr. Account Executive - Data Center/Colocation
desc:
The Senior Account Executive is responsible for delivering sales results within his/her assigned geography.  This individual will leverage Internap’s suite of Public Cloud services via Data Center and Colocation client acquisition to attain his/her assigned sales quota. 
A successful Sr. AE has exceptional organizational skills; written and verbal communication skills; a demonstrated ability to multi-task; and strong desire to prospect and close New Logo business. He/she is a high-intensity, ‘hunter’ with a demonstrated track record of aggressively building a funnel and translating opportunities into orders.  Industry related selling experience and/or technical competency are strongly preferred.

Complete all company required training, but pro-actively seek and obtain the knowledge/capabilities to enable sales success in your market.
Understand and articulate (orally, written, PowerPoint presentation) the company value proposition into specific customer benefits
Build the sales funnel:
“Cold" lead development – tele sales, hosted industry events (open-houses, product demos, etc), cold-calling, follow-up marketing lead generated opportunities, etc.
“Warm" lead development – existing account expansion, RFP response, former account recovery, etc.
Meet/exceed sales quotas
Identify and develop partners to accelerate sales (agents, datacenter partners, etc)

BA/BS degree required or Associates Degree with 5+ years of relevant work and industry experience. 

5 yr+ outside sales experience with consistent > 100% quota attainment.

Outside sales experience in telecommunications, data or Internet industry.

Ability to overcome customers’ objections.

Effective listening skills.
Excellent written and electronic communication skills.

title: Data Analyst (Adobe Analytics - Marketing)
desc:
Kinetic Personnel Group is hiring a Sr. Data Analyst (Marketing Division) for a client near San Bernardino, CA. This client is an industry leader is software development related to mapping, and data technology. Ideal candidates will have technical and statistical know-how. This role combines a data-driven approach and expertise with an entrepreneurial eye for spotting new opportunities to test and experiment. You should also have a nose for compelling content and analysis with data at its core, as well as reporting and data visualization. In short, you are a “hacker" who loves data and optimization. 

You are part of a team responsible for gathering and analyzing data, managing the marketing database (over 100 million records), making recommendations, data modeling, and ensuring appropriate adjustments are made to improve our marketing performance. 

Responsibilities: 
Monitor and maintain the data quality within the marketing database.
Create and maintain metrics reports on marketing activities that detail their effectiveness and business impact.
Analyze marketing and sales data to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization.
Inform marketing about our customer behaviors and buying preferences and patterns.
Create scalable, innovative approaches to extracting, managing, and analyzing data from customers.
Develop various predictive models across marketing data.
Collaborate with and enable marketing teammates, product managers, and other key stakeholders to implement what you learn.
Document all research and findings. You will build the client’s Marketing’s institutional knowledge by unlocking new opportunities for growth and recommending ways to operate more effectively.
Seek out problems and experiment with the best approach to solve them.
Develop and improve the client’s data steward program. 


Requirements: 
BA/BS with an emphasis in data, computer science or applicable degree
Minimum of three years working in a data analyst role 
Experience with analytic techniques, statistical modeling, and web analytics technologies.
Experience with adobe analytics.
Ability to extract meaning and suggest action items from data, not just report on metrics.
Strong analytical skills and experience with reporting and data analysis.
Experience conducting research, including designing the methodology, writing the survey, and writing and presenting reports.
Knowledge of Salesforce, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Marketing Solutions, Pardot or other marketing automation solutions, SQL, R, Python, IDQ (informatica)
Experience with Marketing, Sales and Customer data
Experience with adobe marketing cloud products (nice to have)








Keywords: marketing, pardot, Salesforce, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Marketing Solutions, SQL, R, Python, IDQ, Informatica, data, analyst, analysis, modeling, statistics, statistical, adobe, analytics, adobe cloud

You will also take over the MDM (Master Data Management) initiatives through collaboration with IT and the business. 
You will be offered the opportunity to affect change within a global organization as it relates to data, while being supported in your career growth. A top-notch compensation package, and a close-knit environment are some of the benefits of working here!

title: Data Analyst
desc:
Career Now Brands is one of the fastest growing teams in Metro-Detroit and we are hiring! If you are a motivated, smart and resourceful team player that wants to get in on the ground floor of our growing high-performance team, please read on.
Career Now Brands is a data and metrics driven company and as such, strong candidates will excel at developing, executing, and leveraging business intelligence tools to mine out marketing insights for our internal and external clients. The methodology for these tools will likely take multiple forms including: adhoc analysis, dashboards, infographics, interactive ‘what if’ calculators. This role will work closely with the subject matter experts, peers and clients to develop customer and campaign insights using a variety of analysis tools including but not limited to: SQL, Hadoop, Tableau, Alteryx, Google Analytics and Facebook.
Candidates will be expected to consult with users to define metrics, use cases and viz needs, document the analysis needs and then execute the analysis and/or dashboard creation using Tableau and supporting data tools. Successful candidates will become the analytic subject matter experts over their business unit by consistently providing insights to drive business decisions and proactively identifying opportunities for deeper analysis.
Training on our business and services is provided. We are looking to fill this position with a positive, team-minded individual looking to grow with us!
CANDIDATES NEED TO BE LOCAL. NO C2C. NO 3RD PARTY STAFFING FIRMS. WE DO NOT UTILIZE RECRUITING SERVICES.

Description of Responsibilities:

Serve a multitude of functions including but not limited to: marketing insights, business analysis, data stewardship, data analysis, data architecture, report/dashboard design/creation


Consult with other team members in regards to data analysis and data management questions


Gather requirements for reports/dashboards, proof-of-concepts


Work with development team to enhance/create new data models for dashboard consumption


Create light-weight code in Tableau to drive metrics/functions


Manage portfolio of BI apps ensuring peers and client’s needs are met


Run a combination of semi-automated and automated reports and identify outliers, reconciling as necessary


Develop and evangelize ‘bleeding edge’ visualization techniques


Develop methodologies for aggregating results from various programs and campaigns


Confirm data integrity and perform analysis to identify trends


Reconcile disjointed data sources as needed


Forecast and track key account metrics










Education and Experience:

2+ years of developing SQL queries for analysis purposes (Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, SAS… are all acceptable)


BA/BS degree in a math, computer science or related analytical degree is preferred but not required. Relevant experience in lieu of a degree will be considered.


Highly accountable self-starter with the ability to work well within a group, as well as independently


Must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written


Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail


Must demonstrate strong analytical skills and an ability to perform deep QA and reconciliation activities.


Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and business requirements; programming experience


Must show a strong understanding of data and data relationships and be knowledgeable of various database structures


Must be able to handle multiple clients and projects simultaneously.


Must be proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).


Priority will be given to candidates with front-end design experience in one or more BI/analysis software packages such as COGNOS, SQL Server Analysis Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, Tableau, QlikView, Spot Fire, OLAP, Google Viz, etc.


Career Now is an innovative digital resource that empowers educators by capturing their target audience. To learn more about Career Now Brands, visit www.careernowbrands.com.
Career Now Brands is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria.

With oversight from other senior staff and/or management the data scientist  is responsible for processing, cleaning, and analyzing large volumes of data to assist with addressing business line problems or the completion of research initiatives. Data Scientist
Kansas City, MO
Contract

Broad but shallow competency in technical skills related to computing (operating systems, databases, networking, high performance computing, and related). 
Fluent in at least one programming language common in data science. 
Demonstrated aptitude for scientific research and publication.

I am located here in  Ohio and am heavily invested in the State and community.  I know the companies, have direct access to the decision makers/hiring authorities, and can provide top-notch guidance to help you navigate throughout the hiring process!  Why wouldn't you call me about the market and opportunities if it wasn't in your best interest to do so?

Do you have a Bachelor's Degree with a Master's or PhD being better? Do you love statistics and the manipulation of data? Do you have a minimum 4+ years of demonstrated Predictive Data analysis and statistical modeling experience?   Do you have a solid experience with Python and "R" or SAS development background?  Are you experienced with enterprise level process and procedures?  Can you help mentor junior team members and help build what is soon to be the coolest team in the organization?  Do you love solving problems with large amounts of data and consider it to be the vertical you seek? You will be working on a truly collaborative team and helping to strategically mentor and provide expertise to their organization.  There are no individuals.  Teamwork is tantamount to success in this environment.   The Big Data environment and infrastructure has been built out over the last 18 mos. and they are ready to start analyzing and  reporting!    Culture on this team is one of kindness and compassion.  They are looking to add very smart and confident people to the team that know when to seek advice.  This is a very important and rewarding role which opened up due to growth.    Is this you?

desc:

Address many challenging use cases in cloud and virtualization

title: Sr Mng, Data Scientist
desc:
Sr. Manager, Data Scientist - Artificial Intelligence

Are you a Data Scientist that is passionate about working with massive sets of data? Then this is the position for you! You will have the opportunity to showcase your innate ability and passion for data with  the 6th largest, e-commerce company in the world!
We are targeting a motivated, self-starter, who revels in the opportunity to make sense of business data. This position will impact conversion in real-time! The projects you will focus on will be natural language, visual analytics, and machine learning. The ideal candidate will be eager for the opportunity to have access to massive data sets to create greenfield algorithms and models from scratch! You will lead a team of 3-4 Data Scientist. This position will entail 60% hands-on strategy, 30% leading and providing technical guidance to the team, and 10% presentations to business partners.
Your input will be a key factor in deciding business direction and initiatives within this growing organization! This is a direct hire position location in Atlanta, GA. Enjoy a casual dress code, flexible work hours, with a well-funded company that has a start-up feel. Relocation assistance is available for out of town candidates.
Responsibilities:

Prototype and develop scalable and robust algorithms using massive data sets to power data-driven products and decisions. 


Perform advanced data/predictive modeling, text mining, data mining, regression, cluster analysis, customer segmentation, forecasting, A/B testing, hypothesis testing, etc to unearth key metrics that define success.


Build, create, model, analyze, and present data and statistical findings to generate insights and recommendations. 


Collaborate with other engineers, data scientists, and product/business stakeholders. 







Required Skills:

4+ years of experience with statistics, data models, data mining, and data analysis


1+ year of data science and hands-on machine learning (personalization) experience


1+ year experience managing and leading a team of Data Scientist 


Experience working with Natural language or visual analytics (image processing)


Experience with R or Python


Experience utilizing a big data platform such as Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc. 


Ability to define problems and translate findings into a business message 


Master's in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Economics/Econometrics, Physics, or related. 

Preferred Skills:

Experience working in a cloud environment


eCommerce or Retail industry experience


PhD

title: Data Warehouse Analyst
desc:
The Data Warehouse Analyst works closely with the business areas and department team members to implement reporting metrics for Interim HealthCare. The role will focus on enhancing our existing reporting tools and exploring new tools for our future reporting needs.




 Essential Functions: 

The Data Warehouse Analyst will support existing SQL, Excel, Access and VBA applications and reporting tools that address specific business problems or that automate processes as specified by business users.


Create a Master database using; data models, tables and nuances across business functions, such as revenue, operations shift work, customer service and sales in each service line. 


Provide consultative support and coaching to other data users across all business functions. This to include data model and SQL/VBA knowledge sharing.


Simulate operational "what if" scenarios through data modeling to test proposed operational strategies. 


Analyze existing business processes and logic through personal observation and user interaction, recommending workable procedural improvements.


Conduct training classes in coding languages and applications, specifically SQL, Access and VBA to other IT Professionals. 


The Data Warehouse Analyst must author custom IT program specifications to support user system requirements as needed.








 



Minimum Education & Experience Requirements:
Bachelor's degree.

Aptitude for correlating our data models to actual business processes and operations


Microsoft Excel experience with an understanding of advanced functions and pivot tables a must.


Proficient in SQL and Oracle Reporting (Hyperion)  Experience in spreadsheet automation using Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).


Excellent analytical and numerical skills. 

Ability to write, speak and interact clearly and professionally.

Ability to communicate technical concepts in understandable language.


Extremely organized with strong time-management skills.


Proficient in mapping of data sources into one master database. 


Ability to write queries, identify requirements from vendor’s so they understand the metrics and the intent of the data for continuous improvement.


Ability to create a starting point for master database with populating fields and creating new unique identifiers.  

Ability to influence multiple levels on highly technical issues and challenges.

Manage key relationships with stakeholders: absorbing and understanding internal customer needs and business environment; interaction with carriers, vendors, 3rd party providers, and various internal support teams.  

Primary relationship holder between operations and analytics ensuring analytical and reporting needs are met. 

 
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Required:  

Demonstrates effective written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate with all levels within and outside the company.


Demonstrates proficiency in current software programs. 

Demonstrates excellent organizational and detail skills.

Demonstrates the ability to accomplish goals under short deadlines, changing priorities and minimal resources. 

Demonstrates the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


 
Working Conditions & Physical Effort:  


Ability to work flexible schedule and/or evening hours as needed.




 Interested Data Warehouse Analyst candidates, please forward your resume by email to:
 Don Dimick, Director Talent Acquisition, Human Resources 
 Email: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]


 Closing Date: The Data Warehouse Analyst will remain open until filled 
 EOE

title: Data Modeler/Analyst
desc:
***ONLY GC AND US CITIZEN CANDIDATES APPLY TO THIS POSITION***



***CLIENT REQUIRES CANDIDATES TO BE AVAILABLE FOR AN IN-PERSON INTERVIEW***



Job Description: 

JOB SUMMARY This position is for Data Modeler. Develop, maintain, and support the company’s logical data environment. Participate in projects relative to the requirements and design of the logical data environment. Provide guidance to developers, database administration, and data administration concerning design and transition to the physical data environment. Propose ways to improve the environment and help set data administration direction. Advocate the development and use of an enterprise data model and metadata management. Participate in large, cross-enterprise projects requiring strong analysis, design, and leadership skills.
REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Management Information systems, or Computer Science or related job experience. Erwin data Modeler or equivalent tool 2 years’ relational database administration in Oracle/SQL Server/DB2 etc. 5 years as data modeler involved in mid- to large-scale system development projects Exposure to all System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) phases, with experience directly contributing to design, development, validation, implementation and operational support activities Data analysis/profiling and reverse engineering of data. Strong knowledge of relational and multi-dimensional database architectures. 



***ONLY GC AND US CITIZEN CANDIDATES APPLY TO THIS POSITION***


***CLIENT REQUIRES CANDIDATES TO BE AVAILABLE FOR AN IN-PERSON INTERVIEW***




Responsibilities: ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct sessions and interviews to gather data requirements. Understand and apply logical entity-relational design concepts. Perform enterprise and project data modeling, including model consolidation and integration. Document, develop, and maintain data models in Erwin or equivalent modeling tools. Participate in business process modeling, working with the developers, with respect to data mapping and validation of the data’s life cycle. Safeguard the integrity of the logical design in true third-normal form as a reflection of the business not a system. Manage and establish standards for naming and abbreviation conventions, data definitions, ownership, documentation, procedures, and techniques. Market and educate on the data administration role to facilitate its advocacy and reinstitution. Consult with DBAs on the translation of logical models into physical models. Demonstrate clear, concise, accurate, and timely communication to management, peers, and customers; in written and oral form. Adopt, support, and participate in the implementation of the Enterprise Data Management Strategy. Possess a good understanding of the company and the transportation industry. Deal with vendor-related issues concerning the support, implementation, upgrade and impact analysis, evaluation, and selection of third-party products.

title: Big Data Platform Engineer
desc:

In this role, you will be responsible for the health of a high volume, highly available data platform as well as critical components of machine learning and context engine cloud platforms. Additionally, you will work on a highly dynamic agile software development team and will be involved in the solution design from the conceptual stages through the development cycle and deployments.

7+ years of relevant IT experience

Experience with databases and data-driven applications
Experience with replication, backup and restore and disaster recovery

AWS certifications are a big plus
Advanced knowledge of Unix/Linux

title: Data Entry Specialist
desc:
We have an excellent opportunity for a Data Entry Specialist in our Huntsville, AL office. This role will support Arrow’s Quote Services department. This is an hourly, non-exempt position.



This position will enter part numbers into Arrow systems using Excel or other applications, verify part numbers for accuracy, review input for accuracy before reformatting data to send back to customer, monitor process and communicate with Sales and Product Management team and ensure timely responses to meet customer deadlines.





Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Data entry of customer quotes (does not create quotes, only enters and prepared the data).


Scrubbing of part numbers for accuracy


Monitor quote process daily.


Communicate quote status on customer due date and advise sales to markup quote for customer.


Monitor pending quote items for completion, notify sales for markup, download into customer format and prepare for sending.



BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
High School Diploma with equivalent 2-4 years’ experience and technical training.


Experience entering data quickly with a high degree of accuracy.


Excel is the primary entry and reporting tool; intermediate to advanced Excel skills including proficiency with VLOOKUP and pivot tables is required.


Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Outlook.


Experience multitasking in different systems and applications and the ability to change gears quickly and work on multiple projects at once.


Ability to learn part number formats.


Excellent attention to detail, ability to follow through and keep process on track is a must.


Excellent customer service and/or sales support skills, relationship building required.


Ability to work closely with a team both in person and by phone.




PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Associate’s Degree with equivalent experience and technical training


Previous experience in data management, analysis and reporting

title: Lead Data Architect - Healthcare
desc:
GoAhead Solutions has an immediate need for a Lead Data Architect in Rochester, NY.  This would be a Six plus month contract to start out.

Job Description:
-The Lead Data Architect position requires expert knowledge and technical skills in the Big Data technology and associated tools. The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience with enterprise scale applications and systems. This role requires a passion for leveraging emerging technologies and next generation architectures to solve business problems. Success in this role means having the ability to teach, mentor and take charge of a hands-on delivery team, as well as the ability to support engagement of clients on potential business opportunities.
-The position is responsible for the overall design of the data architecture, across all data types (structured, semi-structured and unstructured), balancing the need for access against security and performance requirements. This role will drive enterprise information requirements: strategy, design, access, usage and stewardship and promote Data Management & Governance practices.
-Hands on experience in using MPP platforms like Teradatas unified data platform and Healthcare payer industry experience is a major plus for this position. 




Essential Responsibilities/Accountabilities:
-Design highly-available data hub architectures for large scale, mission critical applications and high-performance-computing (HPC) workloads
-Provide guidance to the organization in the form of reference architectures, guidance principles, and proof of concept and reference implementations for advance analytics tools and technologies
-Work in conjunction with Infrastructure, Dev Ops, Security and Engineering groups to drive the strategy to provide stable, secure and enterprise-class data-hub and real-time analytics systems
-Work closely with other architects to align the projects' architectural direction with domain roadmaps, standards and reference architectures
-Work with cross-functional departments and delivery teams to ensure that they understand the prescribed direction. Oversee the execution of key architectural initiatives within this domain
-Hands-on in the delivery of enterprise data-hub to meet enterprise analytic and business intelligence needs. Utilizing hands-on technical skills in architecting, designing, developing and implementing large scale Big Data solutions
-Provide guidance to other architects and engineers in the technologies being assessed and used
-Assist Management with the training and mentoring of the team members
-Collaborate with other teams to address upstream and downstream integration dependencies via services and SLA's
-Demonstrate technical leadership and ability to contribute to establishing the overall solution direction
-Be self-starter with the initiative and enthusiasm to learn new tools & technologies within the Hadoop eco system
-Maintain a working knowledge of Excellus's applications and system integration

Minimum Qualifications:
-BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field required
-8+ years of experience in architecture or relevant Technology discipline required, including 4 years software development, system architecture, and/or system administration
-Certification from one of the Big Data vendors - Cloudera, Hortonworks, IBM, Databricks, Teradata
-1 year of hands-on experience with the technologies in the Hadoop ecosystem
-2 year of hands-on experience with MPP platforms like Teradata
-Experience working directly with business clients to design a solution that meets business requirements; ability to clearly articulate pros and cons of various technologies and platforms and architectural options, as well as being able to document use cases, solutions and recommendations.
-Experience data governance concepts and tools
-Experience in designing solutions for multiple large data warehouses with a good understanding of cluster and parallel architecture as well as high-scale or distributed RDBMS and/or knowledge on NoSQL platforms
-Architecture experience in defining the outline for a team-wide development
-Experience with Architecture patterns and practices (ex. Web architectures, cloud computing, data architecture)
-Understand DevOps principles and work with the team to implement automation and continuous integration
-Event-based/reactive architectures and message passing (e.g. message based patterns for orchestration and integration)
-Technical computing (optimization, statistics and machine learning).
-Previous experience in reporting and predictive modeling is preferred
-Perform analysis of vast data stores and uncover insights
-Business process modeling (BPM) experience
-Advanced understanding of open source software development tools and solutions. Strong analytical skills with open source solutions
-Experience with a variety of Hadoop tools such as Hive, Presto, Flume, Storm, Kafka, Spark
-Demonstrated proficiency in one or more of Java, JSP, Javascript, Python, R, NodeJS
-Hands on relational database experience (MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server) is beneficial
-Hands on experience in working with Hadoop ecosystems
-Experience using Metadata tools and practices
-Familiarity with Master Data Management
-Familiarity with run on premise and cloud based architecture
-Familiarity with security tools such as Kerberos, Ranger, LDAP, Active Directory
-Familiarity with the Linux operating system
-Familiarity with Data virtualization
-Familiarity with ETL tools such as Informatica, Talend and/or Pentaho.
-Experience with agile techniques or methods
-Educational background in Data science is preferred
-Ability to manage multiple priorities in a quickly changing environment
-Ability to work in a team environment
-Ability to manage multiple priorities in a quickly changing environment
-Ability to research, plan, organize, lead, and implement new processes or technology
-Effective verbal and written communication and influencing skills.

title: Data Analyst - Entry Level
desc:
We are representing a new opportunity with one of our top clients.  This is a great chance to work for a diversified company in the Pharmaceutical industry. 
 The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree and will be comfortable working in a fast-paced, detail oriented, analytical environment. 
This is a great opportunity to join a well-established corporate team where you will have the opportunity to make an impact and start on a dynamic and strong carer path.Reviews, analyzes and processes appeals in accordance with external accreditation and regulatory requirements, internal policies and claims events requiring adaptation of written response in clear, understandable language.
Utilizes guidelines and review tools to conduct extensive research and analyze the grievance and appeal issue(s) and pertinent claims and records to either approve or summarize and route to  staff for review.
The grievance and appeal work is subject to applicable accreditation and regulatory standards and requirements.
As such, the analyst will strictly follow department guidelines and tools to conduct their reviews.
Responsibilities exclude conducting any utilization or medical management review activities which require the interpretation of clinical information.
The analyst may serve as a liaison between grievances & appeals and /or medical management, legal, and/or service operations and other internal departments.





Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree needed
Previous work experience or internship experience handling data, analysis or processing a plus
Entry level candidates with no experience will be considered - indepth training provided
Demonstrate excelled written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-take under pressure

title: Data Integrity Specialist
desc:
There is a Data Integrity Specialist Opportunity available with one of our top clients.  This is a contract role with our company that MUST be worked on a W2 ONLY, visa sponsorship and C2C are not eligible at this time.  The details are below

The Data Integrity Specialist uses established data mining and validation tools within multiple data sources to research and make a determination concerning potential duplicates; remediate duplicate medical record numbers (MRN) and works with the Chart Correction Team to identify potential patient overlays/overlap and potential risks to patient safety; collaborates with the EMPI Specialist to notify downstream systems/departments and supplemental software support staff of MRN changes. 







Minimum of 3-5 years in Health Information Management or demonstrated knowledge of analysis methodology; and project and work planning preferred
Attention to details, advanced problem solving and high analytical skills required. 
Ability to analyze complex information and use problem solving skills to determine appropriate outcomes. 
Ability to make effective, timely decisions based upon sound judgment and data analytics, considering implications and consequences. 
Advanced computing skills required; Microsoft windows and web applications.
Knowledge of the medical record content and patient care flow strongly recommended. 
Knowledge of hospital computer systems and EMRs preferred. 
Demonstrates consistency, accuracy, reliability in data analytics. 
Communicates issues and processes barriers to leadership and the HIM Technical Team. 
Analyzes records for potential patient integrity issues 
Reviews potential duplicates identified by the duplicate configuration record and users of the system through varied modalities; verbal communication, email, Service Now tickets, marked for merge report, active by weight report and the duplicate patients report.
Reference insurance, guarantor history, demographics, personal contacts, document images and clinical data to appropriately validate a duplicate pair. 
Reviews complex cases with other Identity team members prior to merging or marking Known-Non Duplicate (KND). 
Remediate confirmed duplicate patient records. 
Remediate confirmed duplicate patient records by reviewing duplicate pair assignment to identify most appropriate number to utilize.
Notifies Patient Access to update deceased patient flag after a patient merge.
Collaborate with Access/ Registration and Enterprise Information Systems (IT) department to identify and correct MRN-related errors resulting in an unmerge. 
Remediate overlay patient records
Assist in the ongoing training and development of other Data Integrity staff through collaborative review of data integrity examples.

title: Data Management Analyst
desc:
SHR Talent is looking for a Data Management Analyst for a growing healthcare company in Nashville, TN. This role will be working on the Data Sciences team.  This person will be working with generating, processing and manipulating data.  The ideal candidate will have experience with data systems, complex SQL, working with R/Python, and Analytical tools (like SAS or Tableau).  Strong communication and analytical skills are key in this role.  This is a great opportunity to learn and grow in the Data Sciences with a cutting-edge company.  This is a Full-Time role.


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Sciences, or Mathematics
3 + years of experience in Data Science
SQL experience
Strong written, verbal, and visual communication
 
SHR Talent is an equal opportunity employer.
See a complete list of opportunities at www.shrtalent.com

title: Data Modeler III
desc:
Data Modeler III
Overland Park, KS
$67.50/Hour
Contract- 4/29/2018- Potential Temp to Hire



Data Modeler III acts as a liaison between the Database Administrator (DBA) and the rest of the requirements team for a medium complexity IT project.  The candidate performs business data flow analysis, design data model/business entity, data dictionary and database authorization during the IT project development cycle.  Works with DBA to generate the database table structure, indexes and user authorization design for database creation








This position will be the lead architect, process, and strategy owner for the clients Enterprise Master Data Management (MDM) rollout across its Hadoop, Teradata, and Oracle big-data platforms. 

This position will own the strategy, planning,  implementation and ongoing support of clients MDM and Data Governance (DG) processes and procedures. 


This position will work with client business unit data experts to establish best-practice MDM/DG processes, identify and develop data stewards, and serve as the primary point of contact for all MDM/DG activities.

Strong SQL skills are a plus.

US Citizenship is required.

Familiarity with Master Data Management and Data Governance best practices.  Familiarity with IBM Information Analyzer and Data Governance catalog are a big plus.

title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
desc:
Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer


Job Description:As an experienced Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer you will:
Design, implement, and deploy full-stack solutions from small scale PoCs to serving millions of customers. 
Investigate and solve exciting and difficult challenges in image recognition, classification, content analysis, and deep learning. 
Research and develop scalable and dynamic computer vision / machine learning solutions to hard problems.
Use the latest advances in neural networks and deep learning to enhance our products and create new experiences.
Be a valued contributor in shaping the future of our products and services.
Collaborate with a cross-functional agile team of software & hardware engineers, data scientists, ML experts, and others to address challenges head on.
Help drive optimization, testing and tooling to improve data quality.
Care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation.

You are going to love this job because you will:   
Be immersed in a "special operations team" of innovative and top caliber computer scientists, engineers and machine intelligence experts in a collegial and fun environment.
Work on incredibly hard problems in computer vision & artificial intelligence that are of value in the real world.
Create world-class products and cutting edge concepts.
Help drive optimization, testing and tooling to improve data & video quality
Build on our tools, platforms and vast technical resources.
Work in a highly visible, dynamic team that provides continuous opportunities for learning and growth.
Join a company with a strong commitment to our teams maintaining a healthy work life balance and providing a top tier benefits program.
Basic Qualifications:   
Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field, or a Master's degree with equivalent industry experience.
A minimum of 4 years of experience in computer vision or machine intelligence.
Publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals or a proven track record of industry innovation in creating novel algorithms and advancing the state of the art.
At least 3 years of experience in Java or Scala.
Highly proficient in data engineering 
Strong mathematics, statistics, and data analytics abilities
Skilled work with stream & batch data, extremely large data sets and data visualization 

Preferred Qualifications:  
Track record of successful projects in algorithm design and product development.
Deep learning, machine learning, information retrieval, or data mining experience.
Experience developing / implementing anomaly detection or self-healing solutions.
Experience with content management and streaming, linear or IP video 
Advanced computer vision skills in object detection, recognition, 3D computer vision, and/or tracking.
Some experience in HW development / prototyping.  
Experience in complex networks, big data, mobile and /or wireless environments
Familiarity with spectrum analysis and low level machine data   
Experience with data processing and storage frameworks like Hadoop, Scala, Spark, Storm, Cassandra, Kafka, etc.
Excellent communication skills, solid work ethic, and a strong desire to write production-quality code.


About Us 
At CEI, we maintain long-term business relationships with a wide variety of clients ranging from early stage, venture-backed firms to Fortune 500 companies. Our dedicated recruiters will work with you every step of the way, learning about your skills, your abilities, and your future goals, and matching you with opportunities that will challenge and excite you. We will provide you with valuable feedback and advice—from resume assistance to preparation for interviews—to ensure that you are at your competitive best.

Let CEI find your next great opportunity!
Apply now!

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Job Description:


Statistical
Analysis: Use machine learning methods (Deep Neural Network, Markov Models,
etc…) to run optimization experiments within the robotics process automation
space to refine and adjust bots to achieve maximum efficiency. 


Business
Analysis: Interface with ESC business units to analyze current robotic process
automation processes and machine learning algorithms and document analytics
requirements for strategic recommendations 


Data
Modeling: Design and build efficient, flexible and sustainable data and statistical
models within statistical scripting language (R, Python, SAS) to run necessary
machine learning experiments and optimization research 


Data
Analysis: Understand strengths and weakness of the data and have the ability to
operate in the “grey" and make logically sound decisions to support data modeling



Visualizations:
Develop comprehensive visualizations that supports and grow a data culture
within the organization. Bring to the forefront process and expense
opportunities to assist with strategic conversations through compelling
visualizations

Provide analytic insights on model performance and enhancement, model training
performance and enhancement and cross country, cross process optimization
through modeling, financial and supply chain experience

statistical background with supervised and un-supervised machine learning
algorithms

coding skills with a statistical scripting language such as R, Python and or
SAS

problem solving acumen with the ability to breakdown complex problems into
manageable concepts

experience with large data sets and querying enterprise data warehouses

experience working in a global team environment preferred, but not required
