Risk and Operational knowledge preferred, but not required

title: Big Data Tester
desc:
QA Data Test Manager
Contract- April, 2018
Brooklyn, OH 44144
W2 Pay Rate- $63.50/Hour• Intimate understanding of the domain, the user community, and shares the vision to improve outcomes and can work with the other members of the project team to drive delivery 
• Specifically, experience managing a data supply chain QA team. Should be knowledgeable and experienced with Big data platforms like Hadoop, Teradata or Big Insights. 
ABOUT THE JOB (JOB BRIEF) 
This role drives the planning, delivering and execution of quality testing for specific large scale programs and/or managing multiple projects within a domain. Provides testing strategic oversight for a program or domain by introducing enhancements for testing execution & coverage. Manages and mentors the testing resources supporting the program or domain. Drives Testing Planning & Delivery Phases for a program or domain for multiple projects, including program/releases by ensuring the necessary testing deliverables and tasks are completed on Schedule within Budget. Have the ability to understand and to promote automation, test case enhancement, performance and security testing, test data and test environment opportunities while not being a technical expert in the field of testing. 
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS 
• Leads a program or multiple projects within a domain in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, which may include directing global sourcing resources as well as virtual teams. Projects are of a scope and complexity that usually impact multiple Lines of Business as well as functional areas, may have executive sponsorship and in some cases a steering or advisory committee and may span several years. 
• Defines and manages testing in these areas: scope, scope changes, objectives, requirements, deliverables, and value proposition that support the diverse business goals and interests of multiple stakeholders. 
• Develops integrated testing plan; identifies and manages testing dependencies and critical paths; and tracks/reports testing milestones as well as status. 
• Estimates resources needed to achieve testing goals; tracks utilization; determines and assesses need for additional staff and/or vendors; manages transition of on/off-boarding; and monitors/manages vendor performance as it relates to supporting testing.. 
• Drafts and submits testing budget proposals and recommends subsequent budget changes where necessary; conducts cost forecasting and actual tracking as well as variance reporting. 
• Identifies tracks, escalates and resolves testing issue conflicts; performs impact analysis and prioritization; manages dependencies and track/monitors; and escalates testing risk with corrective/ mitigating actions. 
• Tailors testing methods and metrics; adheres to project lifecycle & QAS standards & processes, performs testing assessments/retrospectives; coach/ mentors teams; and manages testing deliverable reviews and testing sign-offs. 
• Leads testing communication plan and drives the testing planning, execution and reporting with team members; liaises with key stakeholders. 
• Reviews all the test deliverables, ownership of the quality assurance process for testing, responsibility for the integration of testing into release management and change management within the ITIL/ ITSM process framework, 
• Communicates accurate status/health information to delivery Project managers and Delivery managers including escalation along with risks & mitigations in summary level. 
• Ensures quality milestones/reviews are done on timely manner and making sure the that Key performance indicators and service level agreements are being met and enforced. 








REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
Education/Certifications: 
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience required. 
Experience: 
• 2+ years of leadership experience or 5+ years of quality assurance experience 
• Knowledge and experience in the financial services industry a plus. 
• Knowledge and experience with standard project development/management methodologies and tools required with a focus in managing testing efforts a plus. 
Competencies and Skills: 
• Credible leader with established reputation for presenting and gaining support for ideas/solutions. 
• Proven demonstration of Key leadership competencies. 
• Highly polished and confident communication ability; possess written, verbal and stand-up presentation skills. Adjusts communications to audience. 
• Assesses and coaches to strengths and developmental needs of project team members and direct reports. Shares knowledge, insights, and experiences to help others develop. 
• Thinks, plans and executes on multiple levels. 
• Demonstrates critical thinking, problem solving and conflict management skills; ability to “connect the dots". 
• Ability to drive and execute change. 
• Demonstrates a strong technical aptitude. 
• Organized, self-disciplined, and leads others towards common outcomes. 
• Can clearly articulate vision for future state; provide big-picture view/ enterprise view; decisive and directive when necessary. 
• Fosters and encourages frequent, open and honest feedback; learns from setbacks and mistakes to drive improvements; independently seeks out learning opportunities.

title: Data Specialist
desc:
Position Overview: Individuals in this position share a collaborative responsibility to accurately and efficiently enter and plan work orders as well as produce certification and shipping documentation for the work being performed at MIL. 
 
Primary Job Responsibilities: 
 
Order Entry- 1st of 2 front-end data stages in which general information from the customer contract/PO is entered into MIL’s production software application. 
Perform initial contract and flow down review and input order basics such as PO#, part number, reference codes, quantity etc. 
Generate work order cover page, create container label(s) and complete receiving checklist.
 
Planning – 2nd of 2 front-end data stages in which processing requirements are qualified and inputted.  
Through a heightened level of contract and flow down review, verify that information needed for order planning is available and accurate.
Identify, input and sequence specifications, processes and customer specific requirements.
Qualify order lead-time and due date against quoted and archived information, MIL standards and customer requirements. 
Ensure MIL possesses applicable approvals towards specification and revision levels being called out. 
Interface with customers and across all levels of personnel to troubleshoot and/or qualify information necessary in assembling a work order. 
 
Final Documentation – Generate post-processing documentation of which includes certification and shipping documentation.
Review work order package for the inclusion and accuracy of all necessary information.
Generate final certification in which processes performed are verified against applicable customer, industry standard and internal requirements. 
Generate shipping ticket and/or bill of lading based on customer’s shipping needs.
 
Customer Service- Provide hands-on, cross-functional support across various Customer Service, Administrative and project-based responsibilities.  
 
Continuous Improvement: Take part in applicable on-going training sessions and continuous process improvement programs and participate in periodic testing and performance evaluations.
 
Requirements and Qualifications:
Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of MIL’s processing capabilities, general procedures and quality standards. 

Must be detail oriented with strong oral and written communication skills.
Possess strong analytical and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously. 
Ability to complete work projects with speed and accuracy, often under pressure and/or short deadlines.
PC literate with a comprehensive understanding of Microsoft Office applications. 

 
 
Compensation: $18-$20/hr.+ dependent on qualifications & with opportunity for advancement. 
 
            As a permanent, full-time MIL employee, benefits include: 
o    Annual performance and compensation review, with eligibility for up to 2 annual bonuses 
o    MIL Inc. 401(k) plan with employer matching and profit sharing 
o    Premium health insurance as well as supplemental vision and dental insurance plans  
o    Company paid and supplemental life insurance and AD&D 
o    Company paid holidays and personal paid time-off accrual 
o    Please do not hesitate to ask for additional details on any of our benefits & policies 


 Minimum Job Requirements: 
Individual ideally has 2+ years of experience in a data entry, data analytics or contract review position, preferably in an aerospace, manufacturing or industrial setting.
College degree preferred, must have a high school degree at a minimum.
Hours: Approximately 7am-430pm. Some overtime work will be required

title: Salesforce-CRM Data Entry Operator
desc:
CFS has been retained to find an Accounts Payable Analyst for a nationally recognized client in San Antonio The company is known for cultivating the best talent, providing a positive work environment, and offering a competitive compensation and benefits. We are actively looking for a data-driven guru who has great attention to detail and looking to thrive in a rewarding, growing environment. You will be expected to have intermediate experience in Excel and proficiency in database management. Do you have quick and accurate typing skills and impeccable organization? Then this is the position for you. This short term temporary Data Entry Specialist role. 
Your responsibilities in this role Retain detailed accounts of tasks, files, and progress
Correct, verify, and delete non-required data and combine data from several different sources prior to entering into a file
Methodically review completed work, checking for computation errors or duplicate values before submitting the final product
Inspect reports and sheets of data
Categorize information into specific fields in Salesforce Database
Request further information for documents that are deemed incomplete
Search the internet for information - Excellent computer skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills (verbal, written, and listening)
Can work independently with minimal supervision
Strong time management and organizational skills





Perform a data entry speed of 8,000 keystrokes per hour with 100% accuracy
Document production experience
Expert Microsoft Excel skills required
High school diploma or comparable degree
Salesforce Database or other CRM experience

title: Junior Data Scientist (R, SQL) - Denver, CO
desc:
Optomi, in partnership with an industry-leading technology company, is seeking a Junior Data Scientist for their Denver, CO, location. The ideal candidate is an up and comer in the data science space with a passion for technology and excited about advancement within an organization! 


What the right professional will enjoy:
Fun and collaborative environment with a work hard, play hard culture! 
Opportunity to work with a team of Senior Data Scientist that will mentor and groom the ideal candidate for promotion! 
Working with cutting-edge tools and solutions.
Have a major impact on this organization's growth, product offering, and marketing strategies! 



Apply today if your background includes:
1-3 years of experience with predictive analytic projects, especially classification problems going beyond simple logistic regression.
Experience programming in R., SAS, or SPSS.
Experience with data exploration, profiling, and cleaning (statistics, visualization, correlation)
Data mining, cleaning, munging, and visualization experience 
SQL databases and database querying languages, Python (most common), C/C++ Java, Perl, and Big data platforms like Hadoop, Hive & Pig 
 Key responsibilities:
Ability to structure and develop recommendations to solve complex problems leveraging advanced analytics (data mining, predictive modeling, and machine learning)
Develop deep analysis on how sales activities, advisor trends, and marketplace events, impact sales of different products. The focus of the output should be to provide senior management an understanding of the “why” sales trends are occurring and to equip management teams with information and insights to develop the “how” to respond.
Develop models such as lifetime value to understand profitability of different customer segments and influence service and support offerings.
Partner with Product Management and the Sales team to develop ideas for further exploration and modeling.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses as appropriate to support priority business projects.
Collaborate and build effective relationships with business partners across the company.

title: Big Data Team Lead
desc:
The Big Data Team Lead will lead team of developers and provide expertise in a wide range of technical areas, including but not limited to: Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem, Java, collaboration toolsets integration using SSO, configuration management, hardware and software configuration and tuning, software design and development, and application of new technologies and languages which are aligned with other internal projects.
Responsibilities:
Lead team of Big Data Developers
Design and development solutions as needed by Big data projects
Build data ingestion pipelines and Perform data migration and conversion activities
Develop and integrate software applications using suitable development methodologies and standards, applying standard architectural patterns, taking into account critical performance characteristics and security measures
Collaborate with Business Analysts, Architects and Senior Developers to establish the physical application framework (e.g. libraries, modules, execution environments)
Perform end to end automation of ETL process for various datasets that are being ingested into the big data platform
Document and maintain project artifacts
Suggest best practices, and implementation strategies using Hadoop, Java,
ETL tools
Maintain comprehensive knowledge of industry standards, methodologies,
processes, and best practices
Other duties as assigned


Required Qualifications:Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related IT discipline
Must have at least 10 years of IT development experience
Must have 5+ years relevant professional experience working with Hadoop (HBase, Hive, MapReduce, Sqoop, Flume) Java, JavaScript, .Net, SQL, PERL, Python or equivalent scripting language
Must have 2 to 3 years of team lead experience
Must have experience integrating web services
Knowledge of standard software development methodologies such as Agile
and Waterfall
Strong communication skills
Must be willing to flex work hours accordingly to support application launches and manage production outages if necessary

Technical skills:
 Hadoop (preferably Cloudera (CDH)) , HDFS, Hive, Impala, Spark, Oozie, Hbase, Zookeeper, Yarn, Kafka
Java (core, io, concurrency, jdbc, utils)
J2EE, Web Applications, Tomcat (or any equivalent App server) , Restful Services,
Spring (core, boot, mvc, web, jdbc, security, batch)
SQL, NOSQL, Database Design , ORM
Linux (CentOS), Shell scripting, Kerberos
Batch Processing & ETL
Agile software development, JIRA, Wiki, Crucible
Continuous Integration, Jenkins or HudsonSwagger, JSON

 *Candidates must be local and have authorization to work in the U.S. for any employer. No third parties.

title: Data Analyst - Operations
desc:
Data Analyst - Operations
Are you looking for your next challenging and rewarding opportunity? Then this is the position for you!
This position serves as the primary item data management lead for our operations team. You will be specifically focused on partnering with internal teams to identify and address data issues and needs. You will also serve as the primary point of contact to troubleshoot issues for the vendor community and work beyond tactical support to analyze issues and identify opportunities for process improvements. The systems you are supporting have a massive impact on the company's sales as all data flows through this system! Strong Excel and Access skills are needed in this position. 
This is a role for someone that loves all things data, from building reports to conducting the analysis and research with this data. This could be technology related or it could be vendor related, it is your job to uncover why this data might be lost or if the system isn't working properly.
This is a perm opportunity in Vinings, Ga. This is a great opportunity to be part of a larger organization that believes in promoting talent from within. This is an exciting role that will definitely advance your career!












2+ years of data analyst role - experience with data management


Experience with process analysis and improvement


Strong Excel skills - ability to create Pivot tables, V-LookUps, Charts, Graphs, Formulas


Strong Access skills - ability to write, pull, and modify queries


Supply Chain experience


Outstanding written and verbal communication skills


Effective interpersonal and problem solving skills


Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks


PREFERRED SKILLS:

SQL - ability to write from scratch and pull reports


Experience with E-Commerce

Must be eligible to work in the US without Visa sponsorship or transfer.

title: Data Modeler
company: Job Description We are seeking an Associate to join its IT Advisory service line and take an active role in engagement execution, project management and key business development activities. Our Public Sector helps executives and managers at all levels of...
desc:
Job Description
We are seeking an Associate to join its IT Advisory service line and take an active role in engagement execution, project management and key business development activities. Our Public Sector helps executives and managers at all levels of government maximize their performance and efficiency in the face of ever tightening budgets and increased demand for services. We give clients creative, cost-effective solutions that enhance their acquisition, financial, human capital, information technology, data analytics, and performance management. Our professional staff applies traditional, cutting-edge approaches and methods to a variety of analyses. As part of our team, the Associate will utilize various methodologies and models to execute client projects.


Essential Duties
Develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models.
Map logical entities to the conceptual data model.
Ensures data objects adhere to defined enterprise standards and best practices.
Creates various data models using Erwin data modeler, exercising tight control of consistency and standardization.
Works with others to model data interfaces and identify candidates for master data management.
Meet or exceed targeted billing hours (utilization).
Assist with business development activities, such as proposals, capture, account teams, whitepapers, conferences, and/or other thought leadership materials.Qualifications
Conceptual data modeling experience.
Logical data modeling experience.
Physical data modeling experience.
ERwin modeling tool experience.
Data analysis experience.
Workshop and interview experience.
NACI Clearance.
Bachelor's Degree required from an accredited college or university in a related field.
Ability to obtain and maintain certain job-related certifications if no job-related advanced degrees.
Travel may be required.
Ability to work overtime required on occasion.
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.
Ability to communicate clearly in writing and verbally.
Ability to obtain and maintain firm independence and abide by firm ethics requirements.
Meet or exceed continuing professional education (CPE) requirements.

title: PRINCIPAL DATA SCIENTIST
desc:
Role: PRINCIPAL DATA SCIENTIST
Location: Seattle, WA 
Duration: 6 months contract to hire


Job Description:    
MINIMUM of 12 – 15 years of IT Experience is MANDATORY 
This role requires an experienced Data Scientist who can provide leadership and guidance for new projects.  Additionally, you need to be able to recognize when other projects can be complemented by data science or machine learning techniques. This role requires you to be self-sufficient and highly-motivated with a bias toward action.    



ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
•             Work with business owners to turn business requirements into analytical solutions.
•             Willingness and ability to work with business stakeholders to generate data science use cases.
•             Ability to speak at conferences, publish white papers
•             Participate in sales meetings to sell the Data Science practice
•             Provide guidance, direction and thought leadership to other data scientists and analysts.
•             Work closely with engineering and product teams to gather and process data as well as providing analysis and feedback on core products.
•             Verify validity and correctness of analysis and modeling efforts.
•             Design and implement controlled experiments to determine efficacy of deployed models.
•             Present results of analyses to business units, explain technical and statistical concepts to technical and non-technical clients and co-workers.
•             Perform data extraction and transformation on a variety of data storage systems (SQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, Hbase, Cassandra, etc).
•             Deliver code and show results of progress to clients on a weekly and bi-weekly basis
•             Willing to travel (around 20%)

title: Data Management Analyst
desc:
The Quest Group is seeking a full time  Data Analyst for one of Atlanta’s fastest growing specialty e-retailers. The position sits in their trendy Midtown office. The selected candidate will support client data integration across the company’s global enterprise and should be able to manage the retrieval, transformation, delivery, and exchange of data between both internal and external business systems across all business units and client base. Provide daily operational production support. This role requires a strong understanding of discipline and should be able to apply knowledge and experience to complex problems and develop recommendations. We are looking for leaders that makes decisions within broad parameters.This person also acts as an informal resource for others with less experience. Someone who works with team members to provide operational support, documentation, and knowledge sharing of best practices.
 
JOB DUTIES: 
Develops strong working relationships with Client Services, Underwriting, Accounting and IT.
Owns operational client data integration
Manages file retrieval and delivery for all client data exchanges using file transfer software—including account administration, host configurations, and job scheduling.
Manages data integration using ETL technology
Understands and conforms to corporate IT data and security standards
Provides feedback from ongoing administration experience to continuously improve the client experience
Responds to eligibility, remittance and deduction questions from various business partners throughout the company
Communicates regarding the impacts and implications of client data integration break points
Performs client platform monitoring and root cause analysis of production incidents.
Leverages tools like Excel or IT-related applications so that operational processing and business targets may be achieved
Manages client file reports for distribution to leaders, team members and business partners
Responds to client inquiries as an additional input to daily workflow for timely resolution
Understands data flows across multiple systems—including storefront, underwriting, billing and financial systems


QUALIFICATIONS: 
Bachelor's or Technical degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics) – 5 plus years of experience required.
Demonstrated problem solving ability with experience in client/customer data management
Hands-on data mining / analytics experience with a service or technology company
Experience in a related operational business process required
Strong Excel and statistical skills required
Experience with at least 1 scripting language is a plus
Experience with Voluntary Benefits Administration is a plus
Experience with Payroll Deduction is a plus
 
COMPENTENCIES: 
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work with a sense of urgency and independence, displaying innovative skills to solve complex problems
Experience with Data Management
Willingness to learn new software applications and workflows related to data management
Demonstrated effective teamwork ability to perform cross-functional operational support
Generates effective solutions based on available information and makes timely decisions
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with IT teams and business users
Understanding of file transfer and ETL technologies
Demonstrates a strong commitment to delivering results while maintaining a secure environment
Strong writing skills to proactively maintain/create documentation

title: Data Analyst
desc:
Start-up client seeking a strong Data Analyst to join them in Greensboro, NC. In this role, you will act as a conversion specialist and convert new customer's data to the company's full-featured SaaS billing solution. Ideal candidates for this role will have a proven track record of successfully converting complex relational data and analyze data across multiple formats. 
This is a direct-hire opportunity with an open target salary as client wants to see all qualified candidates. Local candidates strongly preferred. No sponsorship or C2C arrangements available. If this sounds like a good fit for you, submit a resume today!

Strong Microsoft Excel skills required.
Must be able to communicate effectively and work efficiently and carefully in the process of on-boarding new customers.
Microsoft Access skills preferred.
Familiarity with SQL and databases desired.

Apply for this position now through CareerBuilder, or by clicking here to apply through our web site. You may also send a Word resume to Kat Tarsa at ktarsa AT hirenetworks.com. To help ensure a timely response, include the reference code CBKT-6332 in the subject heading of your email message.

title: Data Entry Clerk
desc:
Data Entry Clerk
 

Are you looking for great opportunity to grow your career with an industry-leading company? Let the Onin Group help you to put your best foot forward! We currently have great opportunities for a Data Entry Clerk with one of our top clients.

Job Responsibilities
As Data Entry Clerk, you will make a genuine impact on new customers and clients. Your specific duties as a Data Entry Clerk will include: 
Contact  internal/external parties in order to verify information.
Verify the integrity and accuracy of information against source documents and make corrections and adjustments when necessary.
Input data from various sources into existing computer systems.
Confirm, edit and/or proofread information.
Frequently check and/or use the sytem and ensure that results match expectations
Work closely with other internal organizations to maintain integrity of data. Notify appropriate parties if more detailed follow-up is required. 
Filing
Other general clerical duties and support functions as requested/needed




 
Data Entry Clerk
 


Specific qualifications for the Receptionist role include:
3 months of data entry experience
Strong customer service skills
Detail oriented
Excellent computer and phone skills
Business professional attitude
Computer proficiency, particularly with Excel, Microsoft Word, and Outlook 

Here at the Onin Group we don’t define you by the length of your assignment. People are our business, so we need each other to survive and thrive. Whether you have worked with us for two days or two years, you are part of the team. In order to attract and retain the best talent there must be a win-win relationship—therefore, we offer a liberal vacation and holiday pay plan, robust healthcare benefits, bonus programs and even a scholarship for continuing education. But the true difference is in how we view our workforce. We believe that people are a responsibility, not a commodity. With Onin you are not a “temp"—you are a teammate. Contact us today!

title: Data Center Technician
desc:
Data Center Technician contract opening (1 year+) with our client in Pittsburgh, PA.
This position reports to the manager responsible for Data Center Infrastructure Operations with an additional reporting line to the Data Center Facilities Team lead.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Processing cable installation requests, including ensuring requirements are correct such as number and type of connections, port assignments and timing of activity
Interfacing with server, storage and network teams as needed to gather and validate/clarify cabling requirements
Quality testing of all patch cables being used
Supporting troubleshooting issues involving cabling components
Maintaining sufficient inventory of patch cables as described in our DC Standards document
Validating/updating all related work instructions for cabling activities
Participating in the data center oncall rotation which includes; completing daily walk through checklists, incident ticket monitoring, incident resolution monitoring 7x24 for 7 days (current rotation is one week out of every five weeks)
Secondary responsibility is to be fully cross trained for server installations, de-installations and end of lease processing
Take ownership of the inventory management processes; Coordinate efforts of inventory specialists
Coordinates installation/removal of all hardware to/from the data center.
Shipping and receiving duties: Inspects all received hardware shipments; Identifies missing or damaged components; Reports shipment discrepancies to Purchasing or the Lease Administrator


REQUIREMENTS 
5 – 10 years of telecommunications experience within a Data Center environment
Working knowledge of copper (UTP, Cat6, Cat6a) and fiber optic media types, (MMF, SMF, 50 micron, 62.5 micron), industry standards and applications, and use cases (e.g., Ethernet, Fibre Channel)
Significant hands-on experience with the installation of both copper and fiber media types
Expert working knowledge with cable testing systems to ensure operational integrity (pre/post installation)
Expert working knowledge of troubleshooting both copper and fiber cable media. (e.g., dB loss, Attenuation, Breaks, Termination Problems, Transmission Characteristics)
Working knowledge of Fluke test equipment
Understanding of network layouts, Cisco hardware and layer 1 topologies
Working knowledge of Data Center Network Hardware (Ethernet, Fibre Channel interfaces)
Working knowledge of pertinent ISO Standards (ANSI-942, ANSI-568)
Expert working knowledge with Cable Management Systems (e.g., Cabinet, Aerial, Under Floor).
Working knowledge of Visio Software
Excellent customer service skills are a must
PREFERENCES
BICSI Certification strongly preferred
Understanding of RFID technology in a Data Center environment
Experience in server lease end process
Experience using Hardware/Software Request System
Experience using HP Asset Manager software application

Data Center Technician - 15218

title: Data Quality Specialist
desc:
Mental Health Outcomes, a
component of Horizon Health, is the leading company in the design and
implementation of custom outcomes measurement focused solely on behavioral
health programs. Our mission is to support behavioral health care quality for
recipients and providers through clinical outcomes benchmarking.  Mental
Health Outcomes works with a large number of freestanding psychiatric hospitals
and acute care hospital programs nationwide. We achieve our mission through
providing processes, data and analytics/research designed to improve clinical
practice and provide decision makers with the ability to assess the impact of
system changes on outcomes and quality of care. 

Mental Health Outcomes is seeking
a full-time Data Quality Specialist with excellent organization, auditing, and
communication skills. The Data Quality Specialist is responsible for the overall
management of incoming data from customers and monitoring of data
integrity. Primary tasks include tracking incoming data for completeness,
auditing/monitoring/cleaning data to maintain integrity, producing recurring customer
reports as part of a report team, and providing customer support.

The Data Quality Specialist will:


Monitor completeness of incoming data
and timely communicate problems to customers. 


Identify, investigate, and resolve
data discrepancies.


Use SPSS to conduct internal audits
of existing data to maintain integrity.


Audit reports produced by other team
members for anomalies and trends. 


Communicate data concepts and
requirements to customers in user-friendly terms.


Produce and distribute recurring
reports.


Design customer reports, as needed.




Education, Certification/Licensure, and/or Experience








Bachelor’s degree in psychology or data related fields. 



Five or more years in maintenance of data.




Knowledge, skills, and abilities required








Strong organizational skills, problem solving, and critical thinking are required



Significant attention to detail required 



Understanding of relational data



Proficient in independently auditing, cleaning, mining, and interpreting data



Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience with Power Point, Access and SPSS 



Excellent interpersonal/communication skills

title: Data Centers Project Manager
desc:
Our client has recently been awarded
structured cabling and infrastructure build-out of multiple Data Centers with a
major technology and social media giant based in Menlo Park, CA. The location
of the first Data Center implementation is New Albany, OH. The Data Center Project Manager will work onsite at the New Albany data
center location and will be responsible for managing all onsite day to day
activities of the data center cabling and infrastructure build. This position
reports directly to the Data Center Program Director, and will be the key
onsite leader to establish and run the New Albany location Data Center project.


The Project Manager’s primary responsibility are:

a) overall leadership,
direction-setting, delegation, and decision making for the onsite Data Center
team, 
b) to be the onsite point of contact to lead the data center project, 
c)
to ensure success of the project by making key decisions and balancing workload,

d) to develop and execute consistent and repeatable runbooks, processes, and
tools, 
e) to be able to track to a Balanced Scorecard with critical KPIs, and

f) to establish and maintain strong relationships with the client leadership
team. This role will include duties for spend reporting, budgeting, strategic
planning, staff development, and business partner relationships.
 
Responsibilities:
Primary Roles & Responsibilities:
Execute North America Commercial Services
(NACS) PMO standards, processes and methodologies in a consistent manner
for project planning and execution activities including: scope definition
and management; task and resource scheduling; cost and price budgeting;
quality review and assurance; client relationship management; project team
management; and overall change management.
Mentor and manage the delivery and
execution of data center project through a balance of best-in-class and
pragmatic project methodologies and practices that achieve KPIs and meet
or exceed business results, client satisfaction and SLAs.
Direct all phases of project from
inception through completion. 
Develop and administer the budgets,
schedules, and technical performance standards. 
Participate in the negotiation of contract
and contract changes. 
Oversee the preparation of proposals,
business plans, proposal work statements and specifications, operating
budgets, and financial terms/conditions of contract. 
Act as primary customer contact for
project activities, leading project review sessions with clients to
discuss overall performance. 
Establish milestones and monitor adherence
to master plans and schedules, identify problems and obtain solutions,
such as allocation of resources or changing contractual
specifications. 
Direct the work of employees assigned to
the project from technical, professional, or administrative areas.
Issue and communicate project status to
leadership, steering committee and other stakeholders as appropriate.
Onboard team members to the program,
facilitating orientation and training on key processes and tools.
Manage project issues/risks in a timely
manner, escalating when necessary.
Foster collaborative working relationships
within NACS operations and across all levels and departments of the
organization to execute program management activities and company
priorities.
Promote continuous growth of project
management practices within the PMO and organization to achieve client and
organizational objectives.
Achieve performance targets established by
leadership for applicable Key Performance Indicators. 
Act as point-of-escalation for the
project.
Manage change control process and scope in
accordance with mutually agreed Change Management process.
Manage Project control fundamentals: 
monitoring, anticipating potential problems, identifying project
conflicts, taking corrective action, resolving issues, managing scope,
schedule, cost, profit and budget, project reporting, quality review and
assurance. Issue and communicate program status to leadership, steering
committee and other stakeholders as appropriate.

Skills & Abilities:
Strong working knowledge of large-scale
(i.e. > 500,000 sq. ft.) data center infrastructure
Strong leadership, decision-making, and
delegation skills are a must.  
Minimum of 10 years Project Management
experience within the technology services industry
Strong working knowledge of both Waterfall
and Agile project management philosophies and the ability to incorporate
both into the project as needed. 
Strong understanding of Earned Value
Management (EVM) and experience in EVM tools, particularly Primavera P6.
Strong decision making and delegation
skills. 
Superior collaboration and communication
skills: team building, conflict resolution, stakeholder management, risk
management, product management, negotiation & decision making, ability
to work and motivate in a team environment and overall change management.
Self-motivated with a strong ability to
plan/organize workloads.
Excellent professional service philosophy
and understanding the challenges in providing superior customer experience
at a national level while controlling costs.
 


Required Education Level:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent, relevant experience

Area of Study / Degree:
BA, Project Management, Engineering, IT or business is desired but not required

Certifications (Required or Preferred):
PMP, RCDD, DCDC desired but not required

Minimum Total Work Experience:
10 years minimum work experience

Minimum Specialized Work Experience:
7+ years’ experience managing large-scale data center implementations
5+ years’ experience working with General Contractors and other trades.
Consulting experience a plus.

title: Product Data Analyst
desc:
We are seeking a Product Data Analyst to look at the life cycle of our home textile and Lifestyle products.  This data will be presented to help inform key individuals on the performace of different product lines in order to help plan future product lines.  

Primary Responsibility:  
Collect, organize, and analyze product lifecycle data, in order to make data-driven recommendations to drive revenue and profitability. 
Analyze business procedures and recommend specific requirements that will allow product data to be more accurate and accessible.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities: 
Gather, format, and analyze data throughout the product lifecycle.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns using statistical techniques.
Format reports in charts, graphs and tables that easily translate into actionable items.
Monitor product performance, identify improvements, and provide ongoing reports.
Conduct full lifecycle analysis to include data requirements, structure, and design.
Maintain the highest level of accuracy of product data by filtering and cleaning data.
Provide quality assurance of imported data by monitoring master data including creation and updates.

Evaluated On:  
Accuracy and reliability of data reports.
Consistency of product data.
Quality, validity, and credibility of analysis.
Ability to produce actionable recommendations based on data.







Requirements:
Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.
Ability to number crunch large amounts of data using Excel pivot tables and other database applications.
Understanding of basic statistical methods.

This is a full time, on-site position located in Pittsfield, Massachusetts in the beautiful Berkshire Hills and includes an excellent benefit package.  


All interested applicants should forward a cover letter including desired salary level and your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]. 


Why us?  The Annie Selke Companies offers a creative, collaborative work environment in an entrepreneurial company.  Our fresh, fun home textiles have been making waves in the home design industry since 1993, when Annie Selke started the business with an industrial sewing machine on her dining room table. From the very beginning, Annie’s creations have consistently wowed the home décor industry. Each month, her innovative designs and interiors are splashed liberally throughout the pages of top shelter magazines.  Annie’s vibrant, imaginative creations have made the brand synonymous with quality and easy sophistication. An infectious blend of affordability, practicality and terrific design, the product lines are tailor-made for refined, relaxed living.


Learn more about The Annie Selke Companies at www.annieselke.com.

title: Data Architect
desc:

Interested candidates should send resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] and then call David for next step at 507-250-4420

Overview: This Data Architect position is for a Personalization and Campaign Management project. This role will drive the data architecture for this project to integrate multiple sources and targets supporting a variety of operational as well as analytical and reporting deliverables. The role will take direction from the project management team but will also work in partnership with the Enterprise Information Management team to ensure the project architecture is in line with broader Health Care client  enterprise data architecture.

Ability to analyze and specify complex database design and architecture.
Ability to understand and navigate system architecture and its relationship to database needs
Understanding of Extract transformation load (ETL), Enterprise Application Integration (EAI), Enterprise Information Integration (EII), and Enterprise Service Bus (ESB).
Integration and application design patterns and the ability to define enterprise-wide components.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience level.
10+ years of experience in database design and development (OLTP, DSS (Kimball methodology), ODS, Cubes).
Excellent technical project planning skills with demonstrated experience in technical designs and documentation.
Experience in application software development methodologies, techniques, processes and tools.
Exceptional leadership, mentoring, listening and communication skills.

Strong ability to influence without having direct authority.
Ability to translate business strategy into technical terms and technology strategy into business terms.

Knowledge and of Health Plan data, specifically claims and membership
Knowledge of Care Delivery data including diagnosis codes
Knowledge of Campaign management systems
Knowledge of and experience with Oracle, Cache, and Microsoft SQL Server database technologies.
Knowledge of and experience with Embarcadero Data Modeler tool (or equivalent).
Knowledge of IBM InfoSphere (DataStage ETL) suite a plus.
Knowledge of and experience with implementation / support of complex systems.
Knowledge of emerging technologies and implications for their usage.

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Responsibilities 

 ●  Help to create and deliver project proposals and guide our strategic thinking on offering analytics consulting services to our clients 
 ●  Consult with clients to gain an understanding of the current state of the business area(s), their immediate and long term needs, any KPI goals, and to determine what success looks like 
 ●  Consult heavily with business users and stakeholders to 1) identify, capture and leverage appropriate data sources across areas of the business, and 2) ensure that analytical solutions are tailored to business needs and will support or result in actionable customer strategies, and 3) determine delivery & implementation options 
 ●  Develop & help implement strategic analytical and data mining solutions to understand key business behaviors such as: customer acquisition, product up-sell, customer retention, lifetime value, channel preferences, customer satisfaction and loyalty drivers, etc. 
 ●  Lead analytics and strategy engagements; Provide project-specific guidance to our team members in performing analyses and delivering strategic recommendations; Create and maintain project plans, project schedules, and other project documentation 
 ●  Provide statistical methodology and project management support for commercial deliverables as well as custom studies 






Qualifications:  
●  5+ years experience in any of the following areas:
●  Marketing & Marketing Analysis
●  Statistical Model development in SAS
●  Data Mining/Financial Analysis
●  At least 2 years of experience overseeing the work of other quantitative analysts (managing them either directly or indirectly).
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:  
●  Strong written / verbal communication and presentation skills 
●  The ability to work with all levels of staff & leadership 
●  Ability to self-motivate, adapt, and multi-task in a fast-paced environment 
●  Regression (linear, multiplicative, logistic, censored, Cox, etc)
●  Test Design/Design of Experiments
●  Segmentation and clustering
●  Decision tree analysis
●  Neural networks, genetic algorithms and other computational methods
●  Mathematical programming and optimization
●  Structural equations modeling
●  Conjoint analysis
●  Time series analysis and forecasting, smoothing techniques
●  Information design, info-graphics, scorecard/dashboard/presentation development
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:
●  BA or BS required; MS, MBA or PhD preferred
●  Preferred disciplines include Business Administration, Strategy, Marketing or Management with strong quantitative focus;
●  Formal training Economics/Econometrics, Statistics, Operations Research, Finance or Mathematics is a plus, familiarity is necessary.

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Immediate need for a talented Data Scientist with experience in the Biotechnology Industry. This is a 12 Months Contract opportunity with long-term potential located in Creve Coeur (St. Louis), MO.  Please review the job description below: 

 
Job ID: 17-18610 


Key Responsibilities: 
 This position is for a Data Scientist to work on operations research and predictive analytics within our client’s Global Supply Chain Analytics team. The responsibilities of this position are the analysis of agricultural data to maximize production quantity and quality, while managing cost, risk and logistics through the development of mathematical optimization, simulation solutions, and scenario modelling. As a Data Scientist, you will also develop strategies to identify new opportunities, expand existing analytical methods, provide insights, and build practical solutions to complex business problems. 

 
Key Requirements and Technology Experience: 
·  M.S (required) or Ph.D. (preferred) in Operations Research, Operations Management, Engineering, Management Science, Mathematics, or another related quantitative discipline. ·  3-5 year's relevant experience delivering stochastic/analytical solutions to complex business problems. ·  Theoretical and practical experience in deterministic optimization and algorithm development related to operations management is a requirement, including experience with commercial optimization software (ex. OPL, GAMS, IBM DOC). ·  Experience with software development and architecture related to operations research, machine learning, geospatial analysis, and artificial intelligence. ·  Expertise in programming and database languages (ex. Python, R, Scala, SQL). ·  Demonstrated experience in optimizing demand, supply, and network flow challenges related to planning, scheduling, space utilization, and customer service levels. ·  Demonstrated problem solving experience analyzing complex data using statistical and advanced analytical methods to deliver predictive and prescriptive insights. ·  Exceptional organizational, interpersonal, and written communication skills. ·  Ability to work in a matrix environment and influence people at varying levels of responsibility. ·  Candidates must demonstrate business aptitude, the ability to rapidly learn new problem domains and become conversant in the domain with business users. 







Must haves:
 ●  Operations Research 70% and Machine Learning 
 ●  Python, R, Scala, SQL 
 ●  Familiar with the Cloud Computing. 
 ●  Must be able to show that they completed a project from beginning to end. 
 ●  Master's degree is required. PhD is preferred. 

 
Desired skills/experience: 
·  Experience in supply chain management, agriculture, and/or laboratory science. ·  Background in big data technologies including Apache Hadoop, Spark and IaaS such as AWS and Google Cloud is highly desirable.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of this innovative company!

Job Details:
Job Title : Hadoop / Big Data Developer
Location : Beaverton, Oregon

Job Description:
Customer is embracing Big Data technologies to enable data-driven decisions. We’re looking to expand our Hadoop Engineering team to keep pace.  As a Sr. Hadoop developer you will work with a variety of talented Nike teammates and be a driving force for building solutions.  You will be working on development projects related to commerce and web analytics.

Design and implement distributed data processing pipelines using Spark, Hive, Pig, Python, Scala, and other tools and languages prevalent in the Hadoop ecosystem. Ability to design and implement end to end solution.

title: Business Analyst/Data Analyst Banking
desc:
GoAhead Solutions has a great opportunity for a Business Analyst Banking in San Francisco, CA.  This would be a Nine month contract to start out.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
-Document business and functional requirements to cater towards short term and long term management reporting, regulatory reporting, dashboards and analytical needs of the business units
-Performing data analysis and design activities at the operational and organizational level to build a single source of truth (central repository) for loan originations
-Develop reporting proto-types with the goal of industrialization in a controlled environment
-Engage and direct business partners and subject matter experts to identify priorities, scope, and requirements for complex business problems
-Engage technical development team members to transition requirements to design, and to determine appropriate design approach
-Plan and execute QA and UAT testing 
-Act as the Business and Data analyst that liaisons between business units and the project team
-Document the reference data and meta data for each release of the data mart

Additional Duties and Responsibilities:
-Following the bank’s standard practices of requirements documentation, production releases and user training manuals 
-Attends meetings as required
-Perform other duties when assigned
-Adhering to and complying with the applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-money laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, US Patriot Act etc.)
-Adhering to Bank policies and procedures




Experience/Skills Required:
-10+ years of business and data analysis experience in the implementation of data related solutions
-5+ years of banking or financial services industry experience in the domain of loans is required
-Experience with Loan Origination within banking environment
-Excellent SQL skills to analyze, profile data and build report prototypes before handing over to ETL team
-Ability to communicate complex ideas as simple, easy to understand concepts; ability to present effectively to both business and technical audiences at all levels of the organization
-Must possess excellent written and oral communications skills and the ability to clearly define projects, objectives, goals, schedules and assignments
Nice to Have:
-Work with onsite and offshore vendor partners in the execution of data projects
-UAT Test Cases and Scripts experience to test the roll out of different phases of the data mart
-Ability to look and think outside the box to identify solutions that furthers the initiative and/or improves the effectiveness of the data usage for analytics and reporting

title: Data Entry Customer Service Clerk
desc:
Data Entry and Customer Service Clerk- Temp to hire with a solid company in the greater Rochester Area. 

We are recruiting for a Data Entry and Customer Service Clerk to work for a very busy company offering an excellent career opportunity, stability and good benefits.

As a member of the Customer Service and Sales Team, Data Entry and Customer Service Clerk will support the team with entering customer information, sales orders, quotes, and other pertinent data pertaining to customers and sales information.

Data Entry and Customer Service Clerk will send out correspondence to current and potential customers, prepare mailings and other materials, file documents, and maintain computer database.
Also will support national and international clients.

If you are customer focused and like helping people, you will have an opportunity to advance and grow with this very stable company.

Seeking a minimum of 1 year experience in a data entry / customer service role.To be considered for Data Entry and Customer Service Clerk, you would need to have previous data entry and customer service experience with any inside sales experience, a plus.

To be considered, Data Entry and Customer Service Clerk must have excellent communication skills, good computer skills, typing and keyboarding skills with accuracy, and good math skills.
Customer Service and Data Entry Clerk must have the ability to achieve and maintain rapport with customers by providing excellent service.

Must have top notch communication skills and desire to help customers, and ability to work in a team environment.
Must have good verbal and written communication skills, good data entry skills, good phone skills, and have a strong business acumen.

Must have good math skills.
Associates degree is a plus or equivalent experience and/or training is acceptable with a High School Diploma.

Hours are full time, Monday through Friday.
To be considered, please submit your resume for immediate consideration.


We offer best in class placement services, resume review and optimization, confidential employment and career evaluation, all in strict confidence.

title: Data Processing Assistant
desc:
COME GROW WITH US!
Northland Group LLC, a subsidiary of Radius Global Solutions, is currently looking to hire a Data Operations Assistant for our Edina, MN location.
The Data Operations Assistant is responsible for loading client data into processing software, filtering and culling data per client request and search terms, and exporting documents and metadata for review. They are responsible for ensuring the quality of the processed data as well as for making sure that processing resources are utilized effectively and that turnaround requests and deadlines are either met or exceeded.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Process documents and data in adherence to company standards and client specific technical specifications
Create and prepare load files and deliverables for review by peers / other departments
Format data for importing into review software, using internal tools, scripts, review software to manipulate and normalize data to conform to client request and internal standards
Extract and stage all data to be processed from original files.
Maintain a sense of urgency on all processing deliverables and internal requests
Independently work on job requests from a queue as well as by assignment to ensure that jobs progress with minimal delay
Effectively communicate job status and potential issues with Shift Supervisor/Manager and provide detailed hand off instructions during shift/job turnover
Perform thorough quality checks on client data and work product at multiple stages of processing to eliminate rework and ensure 100% compliance of data and deliverable to client specification
Make recommendations for improved workflow, quality, internal documentation and processes to maximize system resources and efficiencies as applicable
Assist with training junior team members on department processes and applications, and assist with troubleshooting requests and fixes to deliverables





Requirements:
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to use critical thinking and troubleshooting skills to effectively identify solutions to non-standard requests and issue resolution
Effective verbal and written communication
Strong organization skills and ability to multitask
Demonstrates a sense of urgency and ownership
Efficient work-style, with an eye for process improvement
Strong Microsoft Office skills
Ability to effectively work independently and as part of a team
Ability to quickly learn and master new applications and processes
Strong initiative and desire to learn and excel.
HS Diploma or equivalent required.




**Background checks and drug screens are performed.
 


EOE Disabled/Veterans

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
Looking for a full time Senior Data Analyst to sit on the Enterprise Data & Analytics Team, working very closely with the Business Intelligence Team. This person will be doing power BI work and focus on building the new data warehouse for this company. They will also be doing some machine learning work and helping to build dashboards. This person should have some power BI experience but needs to have the ability to utilize Excel to combine and manipulate data. The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years experience. Full time role, does not offer sponsorship, no Third Parties accepted; must be a US Citizen or Green Card holder. 
Title: Senior Enterprise Data AnalystPosition Type: Full TimeLocation: Naperville, IL, United StatesDescription: 
The Senior Enterprise Data Analyst is responsible for providing data and analytical services in support of the Enterprise Data team. The Senior Analyst's primary objective will be to gather and assemble data from multiple internal and external data sources; then providing output in the form of traditional business intelligence or action oriented business insights. The Senior Analyst will provide services primarily to the Merchandising Solutions group; delivering product assortment, vendor, and customer analysis and insights.Essential Functions:

Ability to translate software requirement's document and develop associated database data models
Ability to gather/query data from Excel, AS 400, SQL Server, Cognos, or other external data sources

Effectively present findings, insights, and recommendations
Employee must be able to work independently and prioritize workload based on project plans and time lines

Microsoft Excel – Intermediate Excel skills. Requires knowledge of Pivot Tables and Vlookup required
Microsoft Power BI & DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) required

title: Director of Data Science
company: ABOUT NEXT COLLEGE STUDENT ATHLETE (NCSA) NCSA is the world’s largest and most successful collegiate athletic recruiting network. A wholly-owned subsidiary of Reigning Champs ( www.reigningchamps.com ), NCSA’s team of more than 600 former collegiate and p...
desc:
ABOUT NEXT COLLEGE STUDENT ATHLETE (NCSA)
NCSA is the world’s largest and most successful collegiate athletic recruiting network. A wholly-owned subsidiary of Reigning Champs (www.reigningchamps.com), NCSA’s team of more than 600 former collegiate and professional athletes leverages 16 years of exclusive data, proprietary matching algorithms, and personal relationships to connect tens of thousands of college-bound student-athletes to more than 41,000 college coaches nationwide across 31 sports every year. You can learn more about NCSA at www.ncsasports.org.
 
Director of Data Science Job Details
We’re looking for someone to lead our Data Science and Analyst team and take our business analytics capabilities to the next level. We need someone who wants to wade in and find the insights even when they might challenge established business patterns and the status quo.  We’re looking for a hands-on leader and innovator who can apply advanced analytics strategically, meet our ever-growing demand for data-driven insights, and help build a stronger product vision along the way.
 
You understand and can implement data processes from collection to modeling to insights. You’re well versed in leading edge practices and technologies including, artificial intelligence, machine learning and deep learning. Ideally, you’ll be as comfortable diving in and getting your hands dirty as leading a strategic initiative and building the team.  You are a self-motivated, organized go-getter who loves taking problems and developing solutions that drive business outcomes.
 
You’ll be working with a collaborative team of analysts and data scientists as well as product managers, designers, developers and business stakeholders across the entire organization. You’ll need to be able to articulate your decisions and take feedback into the next iteration. Want to work with a great team to make students’ lives better? Great!
 
Responsibilities
Establish and improve data collection, engineering, analysis and modeling practices and processes
Support senior management with integrating data science, analytics into decision making and the portfolio of products and services
Provide internal and external thought leadership in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics and visualization
Architect and deliver an enterprise data platform strategy that results in availability of high quality data that satisfies requirements and priorities to achieve business goals
Define and implement strategies for adopting Artificial Intelligence methods across the organization
Participate in strategy and execution for Global Roadmap projects as appropriate
Attract, mentor, manage, and develop data analyst and data scientist talent
Understand and prioritize the data requirements while managing the expectations of stakeholders
Develop, articulate and communicate solutions appropriate to varied business stakeholder audiences


Requirements
3-5 years of relevant experience in similar role with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact
Creation/deployment of models & algorithms to analyze unstructured data
Ability to generate relevant insights using data analytics and visualization solutions
Solid understanding of the principles of data management and business process workflow
Experience managing teams of 5 or more people
Experience prioritizing and leading concurrent projects and initiatives
Top notch written and verbal communication skills
 
Preferred Qualifications
Hands-on experience with Artificial Intelligence methods and technologies
Working knowledge of statistics and stats packages like R or Matlab
A scripting language (Python, Ruby, etc.)
SQL and working knowledge of relational databases
Experience with Amazon RedShift and Apache Spark or similar
Self-starter able to make an impact with little guidance 
Extra Credit: former athlete or familiarity with college athletics
 
 
Benefits
Medical, Dental, & Life Insurance
Pre-Tax Flexible Spending Account
401(k) Match Up to 3%
Parental Leave
Wellness Reimbursement Program
Online Health Assessments
 
National Collegiate Scouting Association LLC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, age, disability, sexual and gender orientation, genetic information or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.

desc:

custom outcomes measurement focused solely on behavioral health programs. Our
mission is to support behavioral health care quality for recipients and
providers through clinical outcomes benchmarking.

works with a large number of freestanding psychiatric hospitals and acute care
hospital programs nationwide. We achieve our mission through providing
processes, data and analytics/research designed to improve clinical practice
and provide decision makers with the ability to assess the impact of system
changes on outcomes and quality of care. 



Mental
Health Outcomes is seeking a Data Coordinator with excellent data entry and
customer service skills. 



This is a full-time temporary entry-level position
expected to last several months, with the potential to convert to a permanent
position.
 
The
Data Coordinator's duties consist of, but not limited to, the following:




1.
Verifying: Imports and verifies documents using Teleform software to ensure
accuracy of data.


2. Quality Review - Review patient satisfaction data and transfer data to
corporate office as scheduled 

3.
Serves as back-up to Customer Service Representative for answering main phone
line as scheduled








Education,
Certification/Licensure, and/or Experience


High school diploma with some college preferred

  
    


 Knowledge,
skills, and abilities required


Organizational skills and significant attention to detail
required


Proficiency in Data Entry


Competency in Microsoft Excel


Familiarity with Power Point helpful


Excellent interpersonal/customer service skills






Do Not Call - please submit resume through CareerBuilder

title: Sales, Data, Business Analyst

title: Medical Data Entry *Continuing Education*
desc:
**Medical Data Entry** 
Do you love the healthcare field  but are tired of Medical Data Entry roles?

Do you want to stay in healthcare, but would rather work over the phone to assist patients and practitioners instead of performing medical data entry?
If you’re looking for stable hours and higher wages ranging from $13-$15 per hour, consider a career as a pharmacy technician were you can use your previous medical data entry experience? 
Medix is looking to sponsor individuals with healthcare experience to become pharmacy technicians through our Pharm Tech Direct (PTD) program! Pharm Tech Direct is a cost-free, 8 week program which allows individuals to become Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhTs) with the overarching goal of job placement in the pharmacy field upon completion of the program. 
As a national healthcare recruiting company, Medix partners with some of the top pharmacy companies and is looking to help individuals get their foot in the door in the pharmacy field through our Pharm Tech Direct program.
 
What exactly does Medix’s Pharm Tech Direct program consist of?
- Pharm Tech Direct (PTD) Career Coach             
- Online Learning Course: Platform consists of 10 online learning modules, quizzes, and study resources
            *All education is delivered by a PTCB Advocate Educator
            *Proctor & peer support available
- PTCB Practice Exam
- PTCE Pharmacy Technician Certification Exam
- Organizational Calendar Guide & Weekly To-Do List
 
Interested in learning more about Medix’s Pharm Tech Direct (PTD) Program? 
Visit http://www.medixteam.com/pharm-tech-direct/
**Medical Data Entry**  





In order to qualify, participants of the PTD program must meet the following requirements/expectations: 
Must be 18 years of age or older
Must possess a minimum of High School Diploma/GED
Must be able to pass a criminal background check conducted by Medix for employment purposes
Must be able to pass a drug screening conducted by Medix for employment purposes
Must sign an Enrollment Acknowledgment Letter and Syllabus
Must be able to pay the enrollment fee of $50* upon notification of acceptance into the Pharm Tech Direct program.

title: Clinical Data Associate (SPSS Exp.)
desc:
The Defense & Veterans Brain Injury Center (DVBIC) is seeking a Data Associate to participate in TBI research in both the military and veteran population.DVBIC supports a multi-center network of military treatment facilities and Department of Veterans Affairs medical centers. The mission of the Research Division at DVBIC is to support researchers in this network in developing and conducting clinical investigations in traumatic brain injury (TBI). DVBIC’s extensive internal and external collaborations allow for clinical innovation and research along the entire continuum of care of TBI: from initial injury, whether in-theatre or outside of theater, through medical evacuation to acute and post-acute medical settings, rehabilitation, and ultimately a return to family, community and work or continued duty.Position Summary:S/he will plan, conduct, and complete investigations under the supervision of the lead of the project. S/he will participate in all aspects of research including data collection, organization, literature reviews, structured interviews, analysis and interpretation of basic data and will assist with the preparation of technical reports, summaries, and protocols. Primary Responsibilities:Plans, conducts, and completes investigations under the supervision of the head of the project. 
Participates in data collection and organization, literature reviews, structured interviews, provides basic data analysis and interpretation. 
Assists with the preparation of technical reports, summaries, and protocols. 
Maintains clear and accurate records, inventories and logbooks. 
Verifies and corrects data entry for research projects, supports senior staff in quality control and provides trouble shooting. 
Provides written updates to senior staff. 
Additional Responsibilities:                                                                                                                  Understand, update, and instruct staff on Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for hard copy quality assurance (QA), data entry, and data QA, per guidance of the Research Data Coordinator (RDC) and Scientific Directors.
Prepare and improve training materials for hard copy QA, data entry, and data QA and complete secondary QA checks of staff’s finished tasks. 
Assist RDC with cleaning of data and detection of missing data, including identifying, removing, and resolving errors encountered.
Update dataset properties across multiple databases and maintain database merging capability
Construct and QA syntax (under supervision of RDC) written for dataset creation, dataset updates/revision, and data cleaning.
Assist RDC with data export process for data collected electronically, including QA of syntax for import and recoding and troubleshooting PDF/web based errors.
QA of electronic data capture programming (e.g., format design, usability, testing skip patterns, checking data coding, etc.).
Complete checks of existing tracking systems (for recruitment, consent, and questionnaire completion), resolve discrepancies/errors, and create/update formulas for tracking
Note: All DVBIC contract staff working in VA Centers will work as NON-Personal Service contractors.


Knowledge of standard qualitative and quantitative data collection techniques. Ability to follow general instructions; work in a team; good communication, writing and analytical skills; familiarity with social science research methodology is required. Ability to follow detailed instructions. Excellent communication and analytical skills required. S/he must adhere to legal, professional and ethical codes with respect to confidentiality and privacy.
2-4 years’ experience in research required.
Prior experience within the DoD/VA systems of care strongly preferred.
As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors. With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.#CJPOST#CB#DICE#HS

title: Senior Data Scientist
desc:
This position is open as of 10/8/2017.Senior Data Scientist - 50% remote!This is a very unique Data Science opportunity! In this role your time would be split as follows: 2 quarters - teaching at our data science bootcamp in SF, 1 quarter - working on business projects, 1 quarter - you'd get paid to work on data science passion projects of your choice! The latter 2 quarters are REMOTE work.We are a highly successful data science boot-camp with locations in NYC, Chicago, Seattle and San Francisco and we're looking for dynamic Data Scientists with a passion for teaching.Top Reasons to Work with Us- Work remote 2 quarters of each year (with some travel) & get paid to work on passion projects of your choice for 1 quarter!- We are a startup company owned by a global giant so you get the best of both worlds - that startup vibe but with security.- Competitive annual salary and full benefits.What You Will Be DoingSENIOR DATA SCIENTISTWe are looking for Data Scientists to be part of the our Data Science Instructional Team. We seek individuals who love and excel at analyzing and visualizing data to solve important problems, are passionate about teaching others to be premier data scientists, and are fun to be around and work with. An ideal candidate should be quick to learn and adapt, care about design of simple, powerful, beautiful interfaces and visuals, love writing code, thrive in creative team efforts, and also have interests and passions beyond data science.ResponsibilitiesOur Senior Data Scientists provide incredible and inspiring Data Science instruction; support the design and teaching of new products and courses and infuse their expertise into our business operations; and continually sharpen their skills through consulting and passion project explorations. We call this approach our 2-1-1 Instructor Model. Teaching the Data Science Bootcamp (2 quarters of the year)Senior Data Scientists spend half the year co-teaching two 12-week bootcamps (20-24 students). On any given day, the amount of lecture time is 1-2 hours, and the remainder of the day is spent directly engaging with and coaching individually the students.•Leading course discussions•Providing personalized support to students•Improving the quality of our curriculum •Offering career guidance and interview supportDeveloping and Teaching New Courses and Supporting Business Operations (1 quarter of the year)Senior Data Scientists spend about one-quarter of the year helping to create and teach new course offerings, as well as infusing our functional areas – admissions, marketing, careers, instructor recruitment – with their domain expertise.•Creating new courses and/or enhancing existing courses•Providing data science training to corporations•Interviewing and providing feedback on applicants•Speaking at events and conferences•Writing articles and blogs•Assisting with instructor recruitmentSharpening Skills and Pursuing Data Science Passion Projects (1 quarter of the year)Senior Data Scientists spend about one-quarter of the year focused entirely on enhancing their skill set and building their data science knowledge in whatever way they choose. These three months are intended to be self-driven. Some ideas include:•Consulting on pro bono data science projects (e.g., with DataKind)•Providing in-house data science project expertise to specific companies•Authoring a book related to data science•Enrolling in data science classes•Working on open source passion projectsWhat You Need for this PositionMust haves:Machine Learning AlgorithmsSolid Python experience 2+ years INDUSTRY experience of data science A passion for teachingPreferred (NOT essential):Ideally Masters or PhD in quantitative fieldPrior teaching experienceWhat's In It for YouPerks of the Role•Part of a team that is transforming education•Three paid months per year to sharpen skills and pursue passion projects•Competitive compensation package•Opportunity to network and develop, both among our internal Data Science speaker community, as well as through our parent company which is a global organization•Opportunity to work in different geographic locations if desiredSo, if you are a Data Scientist who wants to teach, get involved in the business AND get paid to spend 3 months a year working on a data science project of your choice, please apply today!Required SkillsData Science, Python, scikit.learn, Virtual Environments, Bayesian Inference, Machine Learning Algorithms, teaching experienceIf you are a good fit for the Senior Data Scientist - 50% remote! position, and have a background that includes:Data Science, Python, scikit.learn, Virtual Environments, Bayesian Inference, Machine Learning Algorithms, teaching experience and you are interested in working the following job types:Information Technology, Engineering, Professional ServicesWithin the following industries:Computer SoftwareOur privacy policy: Your resume and information will be kept completely confidential.Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the job in more detail with you!CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
