title: Data Architect
location: 270 E Kilbourn Ave, Milwaukee, WI, USA
desc: About Us:We are a private mortgage insurer with $184.3 billion primary insurance in force covering approximately one million mortgages (as of April 30, 2017.) MGIC provides a critical component of our country’s residential mortgage finance system, protecting mortgage investors from credit losses. Mortgage insurance from MGIC also benefits consumers by making affordable low-down-payment mortgages a reality. Bottom line…We put people into homes sooner! #WeAreMGICA day in the life of our Data Architect: The Data Architect provides Data Modeling and Data Management expertise to achieve business outcomes as a member of the Data & Analytics team.Under the direction of Enterprise Information Architect, the Data Architect contributes to the definition of standards, policies, and procedures for MGIC, in alignment with industry standards and best practices. The Data Architect contributes to analysis, planning, and solution design. They ensure solution designs and data models adhere to standards for business requirements as well as maintainability, extensibility, and security. As a project team member, the Data Architect creates and maintains conceptual, logical, and physical data models to meet business outcomes. They maintain reference data, metadata, and technical and non-technical documentation as required. The Data Architect participates as needed for other areas including validation, testing, and troubleshooting, including off-hours support if needed.What’s in it for you?•Competitive Salary & Benefits•Profit Sharing•401(k) with a company match•Pension Plan•On-site Fitness Center and Classes (corporate office)•Paid-time off and paid company holidays•Paid Parental Leave•Tuition reimbursementWhat we’re looking for: •Requirements include a Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in Information Systems. Additional years of related work experience may be substituted for education beyond an Associate Degree. ••Expertise in data modeling and data management is required for the Data Architect candidate. This includes demonstrated experience with normalized industry data models (e.g. party model), dimensional data models, and data modeling best practices to meet operational, master data, warehousing, big data, and BI needs. ••Strong proficiency with SQL and tools for data modeling, metadata management, and data management is required. Technical familiarity with ETL, data services, and hadoop is preferred. ••Experience working on Agile project teams, applying Agile tenets to data modeling and design is required.••The Data Architect candidate is versatile team player, focusing on achieving outcomes through teaming and collaboration. ••Exceptional written and verbal communication is a must, with a demonstrated ability to express technical concepts to a non-technical audience.A little more about us!Our headquarters are located in downtown Milwaukee, a place that offers something for everyone with its big-city attractions and small-town atmosphere. MGIC is a seven time recipient of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel Top Work Places award. This is an award based on the opinion of our company's greatest asset, our talented and dedicated workforce! We are committed to being an active and positive member of the local Milwaukee community. Along with our co-workers, we support many local initiatives including:•United Way•United Performing Arts Fund•Habitat for Humanity•Junior Achievement•Public Television Channel 10/36 AuctionMGIC offers a comprehensive benefit package which includes medical and dental insurance, pension, profit sharing and 401(k) savings. We offer an on-site fitness center, wellness initiatives and a business casual dress policy.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background and substance abuse testing. For additional information about MGIC and to apply, please visit our Web site at www.mgic.com/careers.

You have one of the most important positions at ADP: Keeping our technology solutions performing for our 600,000+ clients and 57,000 associates around the globe. As part of the GETS team (Global Enterprise Technology Solutions), our mission is simple: Keep people productive by building solutions they want and keep them smiling with our awesome service. #winning
What’s our secret sauce for success? Well, that’s easy. It’s our growing team of fantastic associates who make it all happen. We’re collaborative, fast-paced, transparent, fun and expect the same from you. Your ideas matter and your impact can be felt from the moment you arrive.

The Lead Application Developer will lead the development of building Data Integration solutions using Informatica Powercenter and Data Quality. Maintain and support weekly/monthly load process

7+ years of experience in ETL using Informatica Powercenter
3-5 years of experience in Informatica Data Quality (Developer Client)
5 years of experience in working with Oracle database
3 years of experience in writing UNIX shell scripts

Expert in tuning Oracle database by adding Indexes and creating Materialized views

Good oral and written communication skills are expected
A self-starting team player able to work independently

I am located here in  Ohio and am heavily invested in the State and community.  I know the companies, have direct access to the decision makers/hiring authorities, and can provide top-notch guidance to help you navigate throughout the hiring process!  Why wouldn't you call me about the market and opportunities if it wasn't in your best interest to do so?

title: Senior Data Scientist - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
desc:
We're changing the way health care works for the better. That means consulting with our members, partnering with our physicians, and delivering drugs in the most efficient and effective way. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm) 

We are currently looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to join our team to work alongside like-minded Principal Data Scientists on the development and delivery of large and complex predictive modeling projects for healthcare Payment Integrity claim/case/membership detection.  This individual works with operations or business analysts to identify the project requirements and the expected outcome.  They team up with fellow Data Scientists to discover business insights, identify opportunities, and provide solutions and recommendations to solve business problems through the use of statistical, algorithmic, data mining and visualization techniques.  In addition to advanced analytic skills, this Sr. Data Scientist is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database and computing environments, and communicating results.

Primary Responsibilities:
Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to build, maintain, and improve on multiple predictive detection engines in Advanced Analytics Labs

Lead discovery processes with fellow Sr. Data Scientists and Principal Data Scientists and partner with Payment Integrity Operation management to identify the business requirements and the expected outcomes

Create and provide sound statistical analyses and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions

Collaborates with data stewards to gather information to be used for analytics and predictive model building purposes and to ensure the data meets the qualifications and assurance requirements of the analyses

Design sampling methodology, prepare data, including data cleaning, univariate analysis, missing value imputation, etc., identify appropriate analytic and statistical methodology, develop predictive models and document process and results

Communicate analytics results and predictive models to business partners and clients

Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of statistical models and recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information
Required Qualifications:
Masters or Ph.D. degree in Data Science, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, applied mathematics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study

5+ years of experience of hands-on modeling skills and strong analytic programming skills using SAS tools, including SAS/BASE, SAS/STAT, and SAS Enterprise Guide 

2+ years of SAS Enterprise Miner

5+ years of experience manipulating large datasets and using databases

Self-motivated, capable to grasp analytical concepts and clearly understand how analytical solutions can help customers reduce their healthcare claim costs

Demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts-all the way down to the theorems- and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years demonstrated experience in the following Big Data and Machine Learning technologies
R, Python, Java, or Scala languages

Spark ML, Scikit-learn, H2O, TensorFlow, or related ML libraries  

Adaptable & experienced in converting SAS-based models to R, Python, or related open source

Working knowledge and understanding of medical coding, including ICD, CPT, DRG, etc.

Experience with health care claims data and Payment Integrity processes highly preferred
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.


Job Keywords: Payment Integrity, Fraud, Modeling, Claims, Medical, COB, Coordination of Benefits, Logistic Regression, Neural Network, Decision Tree, Machine Learning

title: Sr. Data Architect
location: 1701 John F Kennedy Blvd #2520, Philadelphia, PA, USA
desc:
Our client is currently seeking a Sr. Data Architect 
*This is a long term contract, candidates can work on a W2 or 1099 basis. 
This role will be responsible for designing, creating, deploying and managing the organization's data architecture by defining how the data will be stored, consumed, integrated and managed by different data entities and IT systems, as well as any applications using or processing that data in some way in support of the organization's strategic initiatives.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
1.            Design and create the physical data model for the data warehouse by analyzing the data from all source system applications.
2.            Create and maintain source to target mappings between the source system applications and the data warehouse, including business logic and data quality rules.  This includes working with the source system application development teams to ensure the application databases follow appropriate data architecture principles.
3.            Provide a standard common business vocabulary,  maintain the data lineage documentation and champion the maintenance of the business glossary by the data stewards.
4.            Own the Enterprise Business Domain Model (BDM) – this company's Business Language- and be responsible for the agile evolution of the model to enable the implementation of the intended business architecture. Develop and socialize data architecture principles to ensure their adoption by the application development teams.
5.            Build relationships with business stakeholders and partners to understand information needs.
Job Specifications:
Knowledge:
•             Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management required.
•             8-10 years of Data/Information Architecture experience, with 5+ years of consistent record of contribution, leadership and impact to the technology.
•             Experience delivering complex software systems through all phases of a software delivery lifecycle.
•             Experience across all phases of data modeling, from conceptualization to database optimization.
•             Experience providing direction, strategy and value by analyzing current and future states of data, setting and communicating standards, and conception of projects or features to close the gap between current state and future goals.
•             Excellent communication skills with significant experience in developing executive level customer relationships, including solid negotiation, influencing, presentation and communication skills at C and executive levels.
•             Successful track record in following through on both plans and communication of those plans with business and IT leaders.
•             Experience with Guidewire's Policy Center and Billing Center strongly preferred.
•             Experience in the financial/insurance industry, preferred.
•             Proven ability to influence at multiple levels with an organization.
•             Experience with Cloud Computing and Big Data preferred.
•             Experience in Information Technology (IT) working on large complex $MM applications development and ITO projects.
Skills and Abilities:
•             Create and maintain the physical data model for the Enterprise Data Warehouse to ensure accurate data consumption.
•             Own the Enterprise Business Domain Model - and be responsible for the agile evolution of the model to enable the implementation of the intended business architecture.
•             Identify and utilize data architectural patterns that are aligned to business enterprise architecture, leverage common solutions and services, and meet financial targets (cost and benefits).
•             Participate in the data governance process as a member of the enterprise data council.
•             Build relationships with business stakeholders and partners to understand information needs. 
•             Define enterprise information strategy and roadmap that aligns with corporate goals.
•             Design and implement the process for integrating data design and implementation into this company's Agile Process.
•             Partner with Business Agile Teams to provide early stage domain modeling services, support, and mentoring to leverage business domain modeling practices and incorporate domain language usage in produced Agile artifacts.
•             Partner with Implementation Agile Teams to provide support and mentoring to facilitate adherence to the enterprise data strategy and ensure BDM traceability.
•             Direct the evolution of the metadata strategy to provide accessibility to the Business Domain Language and traceability to its logical and physical manifestation in enterprise applications and Business Intelligence.
•             Partner with Business Agile Teams to establish a process that provides early stage user interface prototyping  support and mentoring to consistently capture interaction requirements.
•             Partner with Implementation Agile Teams to provide support and mentoring to incorporate information architecture and make sure that the resulting user experience reflects the customer's needs and consistently presents information in the business domain language.
•             Provide a Community of Practice for Agile Team members to provide a good understanding of model information structures, data gathering requirements, user needs and behaviors,  and labeling techniques.

title: People Data Scientist (Temp, Benefits-Eligible)
desc:
This role is temporary, estimated for six months with benefits.

At Terumo BCT (TBCT), we are working to use data to inspire our decision making more thoroughly, and our People Reporting and Analytics function at TBCT uses analytical approaches to help make TBCT a great place to work.

As a People Data Scientist, you'll help us analyze our people data better to support insights at scale. You are detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. Most of all, you're someone who wonders 'Why?' This is an ideal role for individual with broad-based, generalist-type human resources experience hoping to grow in the people reporting, benchmarking, analytics, and/or workforce planning spaces, or a Data Science and Business Intelligence professional hoping to learn more about human capital management. Excellent growth opportunity for the right candidate.

This role will ultimately play a critical role in helping our global Associate & Organizaitonal Effectiveness (Human Resources) team address the data-related needs of their clients across the globe by automating existing reporting to better serve repeated, predictable business needs. You'll work in partnership with cross-functional partners globally to ensure data automations meet customer needs.

Our ideal candidate prides themselves on excellent follow through, accountability, and documentation. Must be able to navigate ambiguity, balance competing priorities, and escalate concerns as appropriate. Customer- centric disposition and the tendency to over-communicate outcomes and processes are ideal.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES
Assists with the architecture, development, and automation of data solutions, iteratively building and prototyping reports and dashboards to begin to enable insights at scale.
Builds queries to business specifications and conforming to established best practice definitions;
Manipulates and analyzes large data sets, connect disparate ideas into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations using creative, structured and analytical thinking;
Participates in and curates content for quarterly people reporting products review;
Helps to ensure that all report distribution conforms to security and privacy models;
Supports and participates in people data governance processes;
Reviews people data periodically with business users to ensure accuracy;
Creates effective, scalable reporting solutions (e.g. columnar reports and benchmarking dashboards).
Prioritizes work to manage multiple workstreams, high pressure situations, and new information.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

Education
Bachelor’s degree with studies in analytics, data science, information technology, statistics, finance, or a related field, or equivalent experience.

Experience
Minimum 3 Years of experience in data science, business intelligence, human resources, management consulting, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Skills
Experience using Alteryx or other ETL automation software highly desirable.
Experience using SQL, Python or other data or scripting language.
Must have proficiency with Excel.
Thorough understanding of data science process and data discovery processes.
Experience building and maintaining a solution to collect, store, and organize data to address client needs.
Ability to perform and script algebraic-style calculations and queries.
Experience using data visualizations to communicate trends (e.g., tables, charts, graphs);
Experience with conducting research using basic statistics (e.g., correlations, t-tests, regressions)
Previous use of visualization software (Tableau, Qlick, Microsoft BI, Domo, etc.) preferred.

OR
An equivalent competency level acquired through a variation of these qualifications may be considered.

For more information, please contact Jessie at  303 542-5219 or [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

title: IT Lead Business Analyst - Data and Analytics
desc:
Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for an IT Lead Business Analyst - Data Management for the Medical Device BUIT Data and Analytics Product Line. The primarily location is Somerville, NJ (Open to NJ/PA for Posting), and may require up to 25% domestic travel. Our Medical Devices business segment produces a broad range of innovative products and solutions used primarily by health care professionals in the fields of orthopedics, neurological disease, vision care, diabetes care, infection prevention, diagnostics, cardiovascular disease, and aesthetics. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer The IT Lead will play a key role building and deploying various data management solutions in realization of our Data and Analytics strategy to transform the Medical Device Regional Data Analytics capabilities. The IT lead will implement data lake, data warehousing solution and data analytics visualization capabilities including mobile analytics to enable our business users to quickly identify insights and drive business performance. The IT lead will collaborate with IT peers, Business Product Owners, Application Services and Global Technology Services to apply Enterprise technology and development capabilities to deliver solutions that rapidly meet business needs. Key skills are needed to build data management capabilities in the realm of Big Data, Master Data Management, Metadata Management, Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing and Analytics. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESUnderstands and applies best practice techniques to develop enterprise Data Lake, Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing solutions in a high paced environment Carries data architecture ownership to develop data models, metadata solution which meet the needs of the organization's information systems, manages data dictionary and the flow of information leveraging variety of data platforms. Analyzes internal and external data sources especially ERP and Contracting centric datasets to discover data and articulate the data scope and target models to development teams and business partners. Performs source data analysis, data discovery, collaborates with business and peer teams to synthesize the business rules required for data acquisition and creation of information with context association Possesses solution implementation experience leveraging AWS cloud stack components (Redshift, S3, RDS, EMR, Lambda), NoSQL, Talend, Informatica, Tableau and Qlik toolset or similar. Partners with Business Product Owners and Data Leads to define the IT needs and corresponding backlog stories. Works with shared Application Services teams and Global Technology Services to deliver solutions utilizing an Agile delivery model. Maintains data integrity by working to eliminate redundancy. Participates in Data Governance meetings and engages with cross functional teams to stay informed of the ways the organization uses its data and understands its potential impact to delivery of specific initiatives. Maps out business processes to serve as a reference for development and IT support. Explains to business how requirements may be implemented from a functional standpoint. Understands development estimates and articulates different levels of effort required to address the changing priorities and requirements in a high paced environment. Tracks progress of the product development and reports to the IT and business stakeholders on delivery status of the data management capabilities, functionality and applications. Applies enterprise architecture practices to accelerate our ability to meet current business needs, to scale and to adapt to dynamic business needs. Maps out complex business processes to serve as reference for development of data and analytics' solutions and advocates for business process simplification where appropriate to deliver robust and cost effective solutions. Coordinates progress of data discovery, build of data foundation capabilities occurring in multiple Agile Scrum work streams. Co-ordinates work streams, activities and initiatives across Product Lines as needed. Ensures compliance requirements are met, oversees documentation activities and participates in compliance activities as required Ensures successful business product owner engagement and completion of user acceptance testing Partners with Application Services to manage Application Service Level Management. Takes business requirements and writes specifications in a consumable format and terminology for development team. 
Provides technology leadership and data subject matter expertise to drive business adoption of self-service analytics models and solutions. Qualifications A Bachelors' Degree or equivalent is required. A minimum of 5 years of business experience is required. Data analysis skills with hands-on expertise to work with heterogenous data sources are required. Experience in the Medical Devices/Pharmaceutical/Healthcare industries is required. Deeper domain knowledge of ERP (Sales Domain) and contracting data is required. Experience in analyzing data domains in pharma/medical devices sectors with commercial functions' scope is required. Demonstrated ability to work with business partners to translate business needs into relevant big Data Lake and complementing business intelligence solutions is required. Experience with data management and data modeling activities is required. Strong business acumen is required. Demonstrated expertise in data analysis, applying subject matter expertise, building of data management capabilities like Master Data Management, Metadata Management, Data Quality and Data Governance to deliver positive business impact is required. Proven experience delivering business intelligence and visualization solutions in direct support of business functions is required. Agile project delivery experience is preferred. Applied experience with Amazon Web Services Redshift is preferred. AWS Could Stacks experience preferred. Talend/Informatica data integration toolsand Qlik/Tableau analytics tools experience is preferred. Experience working with shared Application Services teams and key vendors is preferred. Primary Location United States-New Jersey-Somerville Other Locations North America-United States-Pennsylvania, North America-United States-New Jersey Organization Ethicon Inc. title: Analyst I-II, Data Science
desc:
Are you passionate about improving the quality of healthcare? 
Are you interested in exploring a rapidly expanding universe of clinical data? 
Are you ready to leverage your talents to make healthcare better for everyone? 
Are you fascinated by the growing field of data science?
Then join the new Data Science & Advanced Analytics team at Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG) that is transforming the delivery of healthcare in the United States!
HSAG has been a pioneer in the field of healthcare quality improvement for over three decades, serving approximately:
25 percent of the nation’s Medicare population
46 percent of the nation’s Medicaid population
20 percent of the nation’s dialysis population
HSAG is nationally recognized as an industry leader in the areas of data analysis, measure development, and patient satisfaction surveys. We are in search of talented individuals that are interested in a career in analytics as an Analyst in HSAG’s Data Science & Advanced Analytics division. Together we can spread positive change to make healthcare better.  
UNIQUE BENEFITS
The Analyst also benefits from HSAG’s desire to grow its staff into the future leaders of healthcare quality improvement in the nation. New HSAG analysts are provided formal training in statistics, clinical epidemiology, SAS, healthcare data, and an assortment of healthcare-related topics. 
HSAG offers:
A comfortable work-life balance, including half-day Fridays and flexible work schedules.
Three weeks of paid time off and 13 company-paid holidays where staff leave two hours early prior to each holiday just to get a “jump start” on holiday festivities.
HSAG offers a competitive benefit package which includes, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) and an employee stock ownership plan. 
DESCRIPTION
The Analyst is a key contributor to cutting edge analytic work that spans the broad spectrum of healthcare data projects at HSAG. Driven by intellectual curiosity and a passion for healthcare quality, the Analyst develops and executes innovative analytic plans that are intended to provide healthcare decision and policy makers with the necessary information to transform healthcare. The Analyst will also assist in designing a wide array of analytic studies and participate in all phases of the research design process. The Analyst will have at his or her fingertips a wide array of data types to facilitate data exploration, including:
survey
case review
medical and prescription drug claims
eligibility
clinical
electronic health record
operational
Details regarding potential project assignments will be discussed with potential candidates during the interview process.
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as an integral part of HSAG Data Science & Advanced Analytics division.
Understand primary types of healthcare data and methods for approaching data assessments.
Evaluate a wide array of data types.
Conduct and interpret analyses, develop appropriate statistical models, manipulate complex databases, and track and evaluate patterns of care and outcomes.
Perform data validation, conduct analysis plans, and cross reference data.
Attend and participates in team training meetings.
Present and communicate project results to non-analytic staff members and customers. 
Represent HSAG in a professional manner at all times.

title: Master Big Data Cloud Analytics Developer
desc:
Our client is currently seeking a Master Big Data Cloud Analytics Developer 
Position: Master Big Data Cloud Analytics Developer  Duration: 12+Months Location: Creve Coeur, MO 63141   Job description: •         Client is seeking a developer to partner with other engineering teams to help architect and build the data pipeline that ingest hundreds of billions of data points for our Field Analytics Platform utilizing AWS. •         Expand capability using various open source data processing technologies like Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, Cassandra and Neo4J into our infrastructure.  •         Become an expert of AWS services that we leverage. •         Help to efficiently integrate our big data infrastructure in the AWS cloud.  •         Build services, deploy models, algorithms, perform model training and provide tools to make our infrastructure more accessible to all our data scientists. •         Enable specific initiatives to build our capabilities  from environmental classification toIn-Season Field Analytics and more.  •         Requires a degree or 15+ years’ experience in field or related area.   Top Skills: •         Cloud Services  •         Big Data  •         AWS   Daily Task: Building Big Data processing flows that will be used to process large amounts of data coming into the platform   Responsibilities: •         Front-end UI development that will be used by our business users  •         API development that will be used across the platform •         Building Big Data processing flows that will be used to process large amounts of data coming into the platform •         Build out platform components in AWS •         Building monitoring tools and scripts for the platform •         Continuously refine data platforms to increase robustness and expand capabilities based on current and anticipated needs

Bachelor’s degree in related field is required

title: Data Architect
desc:
Ref ID: 00340-9500823340Classification: Account Executive/Staffing ManagerCompensation: DOEThe Data Architect will be a key member of the IT Global Applications team, driving data modelling, design, and implementation efforts across multiple business areas and enterprise systems at Simpson Strong-Tie. The primary responsibility will be to drive the design and implementation of a global product data model for Simpson as well as to define the data flow of the product data between our major information systems. This work will include identifying existing data sources, determining systems of record, as well as designing new data stores. The ideal candidate has a background in database design, will understand how to design normalized data structures, how to identify and design the relationships between data elements, and will also have solid business analyst skills  being able to understand and capture business requirements, listen, and push back as needed to come to a practical, sustainable design. A background in structural engineering background is also highly desirable. This role is NOT a data scientist or Big Data role, although these skillsets would be helpful, the scope of the work does not include a big data use case. The Data Architect will work directly with Business stakeholders and Subject Matter experts within the Engineering, Marketing, Sales, and IT organizations. He/she will be responsible to requirements gathering, design, and working with the IT Business Intelligence team to implement the data architecture for our product model as well as other data models within our client.


50% Analyze business and functional requirements related to Simpson's product data model as well as other major data models for Simpson Strong-Tie. Develop the data model design and drives the implementation of the data model and related BI structures, data flows, and data governance processes. Work with business stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand the data requirements and work with the IT Business Intelligence team to build the data structures. Applies sounds data modelling and design concepts to design the appropriate data solutions for our client. 30% Develops all related business requirements and data model and data flow diagram documentation. Reviews and communicates all final designs to business and IT stakeholders, and ensures that we have buy-in from all appropriate stakeholders. Ensures that documentation is kept up to date and available to stakeholders. Maintain data flows and data location documentation for GDPR compliance. 20% Drives the data model implementation with the IT Business intelligence team, and will act in the role of project manager for data structure builds. Will drive day to day project management tasks, report progress and issues to management, and will ensure that all aspects of the data model project are met including design, development, communication, training, integrations, and cutover. 10% Works with external partners and vendor organizations as needed to deliver on objectives. Provides oversight on all technical deliverables. Ensures that we have consistency across all our processes and enhancement work. Ensures that work provided by partners meets Simpson's internal standards, and is ultimately accountable for the solutions delivered. title: Data Scientist, Zoro US
desc:
Data Scientist, Zoro US Our Data Scientists are instrumental in managing data, understanding the needs of the business to analyze data and present information that is actionable. This Analytics team covers a broad scope of projects, including customer segmentation, A/B testing, channel investment optimization, predictive modeling, promotion forecasting and evaluation, pricing analysis, etc.  As a Data Scientist, your work will support our business leaders to make critical decisions every day. The successful candidate is passionate about eCommerce business, learning about all aspects of the Zoro business and collaborates well with others.  Our aggressive growth goals mean that your day-to-day responsibilities and projects can vary greatly—which means all the more opportunity for you to make an impact!  Responsibilities:Actively collaborate with internal business partners to support their need to analyze aspects of the business
Provide analytic supports for key business activities (strategic initiatives, campaigns design, customer segmentation strategy, channel bidding strategy, price sensitivity & demand elasticity, merchandising optimization, etc.) including data mining, analysis, and presentations
Complete the end-to-end analytical process: receive and evaluate business partners’ requests, develop analytical plan and methodology, confirm analytical plans with business partners, implement data analyses, and provide recommendations
Responsible for the quality of data and integrity of the analysis performed
Participate in monthly review meetings to share insights/learning from the business data, and also provide updates on key analytical projects
Build predictive and inference models using R and Python to support business initiatives in the areas of customer acquisition, activation, engagement, and retention or channel investment optimization
 Qualifications:2+ years of experience in marketing analytics, database marketing, data mining, and statistical modeling. Experiences of advanced data analysis in eCommerce or a top-tier consumer-focused company (in technology, consumer goods or retail domain) are required.
Capable of using advanced analytics tools and techniques. Demonstrated proficiency in NoSQL SQL/relational databases (MySQL) and data warehouses (AWS RedShift, Google BigQuery), and Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Business Objects, Microstrategy, etc.).
Proficiency in Microsoft Office:  Excel spreadsheet modeling and PPT presentation creation
Strong communication skills in order to collaborate effectively with business stakeholders. Must be able to interact cross-functionally and drive both business and technical discussions
Have prior experiences in assisting business decision making through data mining and machine learning
Master’s degree in quantitative fields such as statistics, engineering, operational research, or economics. An MBA is a plus.
Capable of thinking through complex business problems and solve them by analyzing large amounts of data.  Proficiency with SQL, Excel, R, and Python for statistical modeling, clustering, classification, machine learning, and data mining is required.
Knowledge of web tracking technology (Google Analytics, BigQuery, etc.) is a definite plus.
 Additional Information:Zoro is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. View our open positions at: http://zoro.com/careersMeet some of the skulk at: http://www.zoro.com/bios

title: Geospatial Data Storage Engineer
desc:
Overview
KeyW is a total solutions provider for the Intelligence Community, solving their toughest challenges. We support the collection, processing, analysis and dissemination of information across the full life cycle of the Intelligence Community’s mission. We employ and challenge the most talented professionals in the industry with solving such complex problems as preventing cyber threats, transforming geospatial imaging into intelligence, and combating global terrorism.

Responsibilities
Job Description: The Geospatial Data Storage Engineer is focused on GEOINT data holdings and data services within an enterprise geospatial database. Working with GEOINT SMEs, Geospatial Data Storage Engineer validates, identify and resolve discrepancies of the data and metadata. They work in coordination with data loaders and support the Database Manager, System Administrators, and Database Administrators to ensure data accessibility and availability for users of the system. The Geospatial Data Storage Engineer focuses on acquisition, maintenance, and dissemination of data in support GEOINT activities. The Geospatial Data Storage Engineer is responsible for ensuring that records / info management objectives are met. They develop and interpret policy, procedures and guidelines for implementing system wide data management across the enterprise system. Geospatial Data Storage Engineer ensures economy and efficiency in creation, use, maintenance and disposition of data. They develop and provide training and guidance for the analysts.

Qualifications
Required Skills:Must demonstrate experience in the following software but not limited to:
ArcGIS 9.x/10.x
ArcSDE 
Metadata
ArcGIS Server
Image Server Extension
Geoprocessing Script Development (VBA, Python, Model Builder, .Net Addin)
Must have 3+ years of experience working with geodatabases, large flat file vector data, and raster (images, grids, matrix) data in an enterprise/personal geospatial database structure.  Must have hands on experience managing QA/QC of geospatial databases and datasets.  Must have experience working with metadata and creating metadata templates.
 Location: Springfield, VADegree: The successful individual must possess a B.S. degree in Geography/GIS, Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline and at least 5 years of experience.  An ideal candidate may substitute a degree with 4 years of working experience mentioned in the job description. Clearance: Positions require a Top Secret/SCI security clearance, based on current background investigation (SBI).  Clearance processing will be completed by the U.S. Government.

title: Data Architect
desc:
The position will be responsible for working with the EPA Exchange Network grant to implement the surface water tracking system (ATTAINS) data exchange and update an existing water quality data exchange.  In order to achieve the data exchanges, this position will be responsible for developing, testing, and implementing the migration of data from the DNR/Environmental Protection Division (EPD) source systems to EPA defined staging tables through various database objects and ETL routines in a SQL Server environment.
 
The candidate can be expected to perform the following (but not limited to):
Update and integrate EPD’s internal databases via an Exchange Network data flow with federal databases
 Implement EPA's newly redesigned national data exchange flow configuration for required reporting of surface water assessment (ATTAINS) results
Update the EPD’s Water Quality Exchange (WQX) schema to utilize the most recent version that supports raw data flows

Utilize the EPD account of the Virtual Exchange Service Administrator (VESA) web portal to deliver the staged data to the federal databases. This will require coordination with the EPA managed VESA administrators and support staff. 
Test and troubleshoot web services that instantaneously link to EPD's datasets to promote transparency and customer service support

 
The role includes writing high-level SQL queries, writing scripts for computer automation, documenting decisions, quality assurance/control, IT infrastructure integration, and data management support. The position will be instrumental in maintaining effective communication and coordination among project team members and external partners, including participation in coordination, tracking, and reporting.
 
Percent of time performing various duties:
40% - Assist in designing data flow procedures between EPD and external systems. Format and validate data, prepare databases, evaluate flows (quality assurance/quality control; QA/QC), and document procedures. Collaborate with technical programming staff to automate processes or fulfill other programming needs.
 
40% - Help prepare various raw datasets for upload to databases, assist in QA/QC process, and generate automated reports based upon the data. Manage and display data or results in various spatial viewers and web pages.
 
20% - Project coordination: Set up and facilitate meetings among technical and program staff to document progress towards project goals. Assist with data and progress reports for submittal to EPA.


This role requires knowledge of new technologies including web services, map services, Exchange Network protocols, and object-relational database management systems. Ideal candidate will have the ability to work independently with little supervision, as well as with an integrated team. Excellent skills in problem-solving, collaboration, and communication including speaking, writing, and listening are needed.
 
Candidate should possess superior organization skills and attention to detail. Proficiency is needed in Microsoft Office, especially Access and Excel. Experience processing and maintaining large volumes of data, stored procedures, and functions is a must.
 
An ideal candidate has some combination of education or experience among the following: Data systems design, analysis, development, documentation, testing, debugging, and deployment.

title: Senior Data Manager-SQL / Python / R
desc:

This role will be critical in project management and client leadership, ensuring consistent and quality output on data management and analytics projects for the client. REQUIREMENTS: Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, Statistics or related technical field required
 5-7+ years related work experience in data management and analysis; Specific experience with data management for attribution modeling, media mix modeling, or predictive sales modeling is a plus
 Experience with the full development life cycle of an analytical application stack from raw data ingestion through to analytical outputs

 Understanding of digital/media/marketing data sources and metrics preferred: Digital (e.g. Web, Social, Display, Search, etc.); Media (e.g. buying models, CPU, Impressions, GRP); Measurement analytics, Quantitative business measures (Adstock, ROI, Churn, etc.); Statistics (Correlations, sample sizing, etc.)
 Experience with visualization techniques for data analysis and presentation (Tableau is preferred)

title: HEDIS MRR Data Subject Matter Expert - Telecommute
desc:
Primary Responsibilities:

Manage multiple priorities


Have experience and expertise in SQL


Be able to read, and write SQL code with knowledge of inner and outer joins, table and view properties, and ability to review and understand a data dictionary as it relates to a database environment


Understand HEDIS MRR data requirements from point of abstraction, data result coding, MRR data integration, scoring of measure results against administrative data and NCQA guidelines on medical record data use for reporting, and final data results on IDSS.xml files and PLD


Have expertise in health plan sampling and chase data; how sampling process works with random seed, provider data and chase logic election and how it impacts retrieval and abstraction works, etc


Understand Supplemental data concepts for HEDIS and how it impacts MRR process and rules for converting MRR data into future administrative data source for data runs


Experience working in a matrix environment


Develop data driven metrics to identify gaps and implement interventions to improve results on key hybrid performance measures


Thorough understanding of measure analytics to perform investigative research


Evaluates and prioritizes recommendations for quality improvement to customers


Familiarity with ICD-9-CM, ICD-10-CM , CPT, DRG, LOINC, HCPCS, TOB, POS, NDC coding


Be able to translate data from various formats and data warehouses


Be able to merge and append data from various sources


Experience in Data Validation


Provide guidance to clients on MRR data issues and MRR data questions and set up data tollgates / controls


Knowledge of claims and claims processing and how this impacts MRR data collection with administrative refreshes


Demonstrates ability to consistently follow published HEDIS and Stars technical specifications 


Provide strategic support in preparation of the HEDIS Roadmap, HOQ, HEDIS audit, and Primary Source Verification


Be able to work with ambiguity


Be able to manage and prioritize large projects with great visibility


Be able to present to clients’ data results via WebEx and onsite auditor presentations


Intermediate to expert level in MS Office, especially MS Excel for data validation reports and summary rate report compilation of results / edits required, PowerPoint presentations, creating dashboard reporting, etc

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent years of experience


3+ years of experience in Medical Record Review (MRR) projects at a vendor level and/or health plan organization level


3+ years of experience in a health care delivery organization, such as a managed care organization


3+ years of HEDIS experience, performing a wide range of functions with strong focus on data analysis and reporting


5+ years of data analysis experience


3+ years of working with final submission files to NCQA, CMS, California P4P, NY QARR, and/or other state submissions


3+ years of writing SQL code


Intermediate knowledge of Excel


Knowledge of Medicaid and/or Medicare programs

Knowledgeable of current trends in HEDIS in managed health care

1+ years of experience working in a matrix environment

 
Special Skills:

STARS experience


Knowledge of NCQA MRR, CMS, HOS, and CAHPS requirements


Familiarity with ICD-9-CM / ICD-10-CM, CPT, DRG, LOINC, HCPCS, TOB, POS, NDC coding

 
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

desc:

title: Associate Director, Data Management - Oncology
desc:
Join a Legacy of Innovation 110 Years and Counting!Daiichi Sankyo, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of Daiichi Sankyo, Co., Ltd. The Company currently markets therapies in hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes, acute coronary syndrome, thrombotic disorders, stroke risk reduction, opioid-induced constipation, IV iron therapy and metastatic melanoma.Job SummaryPosition manages the end-to-end delivery of data management services for assigned projects/studies, collaborating with CROs and other vendors to ensure high quality deliverables on time and within budget to support drug development processes and global submissions. This position provides leadership within Data Management by partnering with internal and external stakeholders to optimize Data Management technology, processes, and standards. Additionally, this position develops/proposes strategies within Data Management and collaborates cross-functionally to ensure successful outcomes for projects/studies. This position has strong knowledge of Electronic Data Capture/related applications and industry standards, and strong skills in working with data received from CROs and other third party vendors. This position has solid verbal/written skills, analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills and works effectively with people at different levels and from different disciplines and cultures. Additionally, this position possesses advanced knowledge of clinical operations and processes and relevant regulatory requirements. This position has experience working on Phase I-IV study studies within the medical device and/or pharmaceutical industry across multiple therapeutic areas and experience with regulatory submissions and inspections. Finally, this position has strong skills in continuous improvement, project management, change management, and risk management.ResponsibilitiesLeadership, Direction, and Strategy: Establishes Data Management strategy at the project and/or study level for a larger number of projects/studies with greater complexity. 
Leads functional and/or multidisciplinary teams working on projects/studies and/or initiatives. 
Proactively identifies and manages risks at the project and/or study level for a larger number of projects/studies with greater complexity.
May manage Data Management full-time and/or contract staff.
Project Management: Plans and directs the conduct of Data Management activities for assigned projects/studies through outsourcing (e.g., study startup, study conduct, study closeout, and reporting). 
Provides oversight for Data Management CRO and other third party vendors to ensure compliance with the protocol, external/internal standards, Good Clinical Practices (GCPs), applicable regulatory guidelines, Policies, SOPs, and other relevant guidelines. 
Ensures Data Management deliverables meet/exceed project/study team expectations regarding quality, time, and cost and that Data Management documentation is filed/archived according to applicable Daiichi Sankyo and regulatory requirements.
Functional Expertise: Reviews/approves clinical study related documents that are owned by other functions (e.g., Protocols, Statistical Analysis Plans, Clinical Study Reports).
Actively participates in audits and inspections.
Operational Efficiency / Continuous Improvement: Provides leadership within Data Management by partnering with internal and external stakeholders to optimize Data Management technology, processes, and standards (improving quality/inspection readiness, decreasing cycle times, and reducing costs). 
Leads multidisciplinary process improvement initiatives. 
Leverages comprehensive Data Management expertise to promote best practices across the Clinical Trial lifecycle.
QualificationsEducation and Experience• MS/BS in life sciences or related field• 8+ years data management and/or related work experience in a medical device or pharmaceutical company, or similar environment (e.g., CRO)• 3+ years combined experience managing people and/or initiativesDaiichi Sankyo, Inc., is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Specialist I-II
location: 3133 E Camelback Rd, Phoenix, AZ, USA
desc:
Are you interested in exploring a rapidly expanding universe of clinical data? 
Are you ready to leverage your data management skills to make healthcare better for everyone? 
Then join the new Data Science & Advanced Analytics team at Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG) that is transforming the delivery of healthcare in the United States!
HSAG has been a pioneer in the field of healthcare quality improvement for over three decades, serving approximately:
25 percent of the nation’s Medicare population
46 percent of the nation’s Medicaid population
20 percent of the nation’s dialysis population
HSAG is in search of talented individuals that are interested in joining HSAG as a Data Specialist. Together we can spread positive change to transform healthcare.  
UNIQUE BENEFITS
Beyond exciting work that is shaping healthcare quality in the United States, HSAG offers:
A comfortable work-life balance, including half-day Fridays and flexible work schedules.
Three weeks of paid time off and 13 company-paid holidays where staff leave two hours early prior to each holiday just to get a “jump start” on holiday festivities.
HSAG offers a competitive benefit package which includes, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) and an employee stock ownership plan.
DESCRIPTION
The Data Specialist is a key contributor to cutting edge data management work that spans the broad spectrum of healthcare data projects at HSAG. The Data Specialist will support extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, testing and validation of processed data, and tracking and reporting testing results in support of HSAG activities. This position is responsible for working with the Data Science & Advanced Analytics (DSAA) team, and clients to achieve corporate, department, and project goals and objectives. Primary duties include data collection, processing, initial validation, document creation and maintenance, in addition to notification management. Duties would also include the development of project work plans, project documentation, and technical writing as needed. The Data Specialist acts as an internal and external liaison for data management and support activities by monitoring data status and customer issues, and providing technical assistance. This individual represents the company as needed at planning, training, and implementation meetings with assigned clients.
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Under the direction of the DSAA Data Management Director, develop, improve, and implement solutions and documentation related to data management activities currently in use and to be developed in support of HSAG activities.
Prepare and deliver documentation and technical support to corporate staff and HSAG clients, managed care organizations, and their contractors regarding data gathering or dissemination activities.
Document internal policies, procedures, and quality control processes that ensure complete, accurate, and secure data is available for applications and DSAA analysts.
Document internal policies, procedures, and quality control processes that ensure complete, accurate, and secure data meet customer requirements.
Research customer issues, and provide data support services.
Participate in User Acceptance Testing process.
Responsible for documentation related to key deliverables and support documentation for assigned contracts and projects.
Accountable for ensuring completion of assigned tasks according to contract specifications and ensuring that completed tasks meet client and budget requirements.
Provide testing, documentation, and support for the database and project design, data collection and management, monitoring, and report preparation for assigned projects.
Assure timely and high quality contract deliverables, and be accountable for the development and adherence to project time and task schedules for assigned projects.
Troubleshoot with other HSAG departments on project activities, when necessary.
Maintain flexibility to assist and support all department activities as necessary.
Act as a contact for the data management and documentation support.
Keep abreast of changes in testing technologies and environments, database structures and current analytic methodologies, and communicate this information to peers and others within the company.

title: Sr Mng, Data Scientist
desc:
Sr. Manager, Data Scientist - Artificial Intelligence

Are you a Data Scientist that is passionate about working with massive sets of data? Then this is the position for you! You will have the opportunity to showcase your innate ability and passion for data with  the 6th largest, e-commerce company in the world!
We are targeting a motivated, self-starter, who revels in the opportunity to make sense of business data. This position will impact conversion in real-time! The projects you will focus on will be natural language, visual analytics, and machine learning. The ideal candidate will be eager for the opportunity to have access to massive data sets to create greenfield algorithms and models from scratch! You will lead a team of 3-4 Data Scientist. This position will entail 60% hands-on strategy, 30% leading and providing technical guidance to the team, and 10% presentations to business partners.
Your input will be a key factor in deciding business direction and initiatives within this growing organization! This is a direct hire position location in Atlanta, GA. Enjoy a casual dress code, flexible work hours, with a well-funded company that has a start-up feel. Relocation assistance is available for out of town candidates.
Responsibilities:

Prototype and develop scalable and robust algorithms using massive data sets to power data-driven products and decisions. 


Perform advanced data/predictive modeling, text mining, data mining, regression, cluster analysis, customer segmentation, forecasting, A/B testing, hypothesis testing, etc to unearth key metrics that define success.


Build, create, model, analyze, and present data and statistical findings to generate insights and recommendations. 


Collaborate with other engineers, data scientists, and product/business stakeholders. 







Required Skills:

4+ years of experience with statistics, data models, data mining, and data analysis


1+ year of data science and hands-on machine learning (personalization) experience


1+ year experience managing and leading a team of Data Scientist 


Experience working with Natural language or visual analytics (image processing)


Experience with R or Python


Experience utilizing a big data platform such as Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc. 


Ability to define problems and translate findings into a business message 


Master's in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Economics/Econometrics, Physics, or related. 

Preferred Skills:

Experience working in a cloud environment


eCommerce or Retail industry experience


PhD

About Unisys

Do you have what it takes to be mission critical? Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers.  As a member of our diverse team, you’ll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government’s critical systems. Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics.Unisys is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. title: Data Warehouse Administrator
desc: Overview: The candidate will assume a role in the engineering efforts as part of the Decision Support System which supports management of, measurement of and bench marking of business operations in relation to best business practices for the health care service industry and internal business objectives. The incumbent in this position will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and managing the Core Database Services IT unit supporting all major units of the company. This position will assist in the analysis and implementation of strategic organizational initiatives related to data acquisition, data discovery and large data modeling.As a support associate to department based Analysts, the Engineer will design, structure, and develop data repository logic against the Enterprise Health care Management Data Warehouse supporting the client. The incumbent is responsible for the design, build, and deployment of the end user analysis components of the analytic solution. The position is responsible for developing the interfaces to the data warehouse to include externally and internally sourced data that will be visible to the enterprise, and must, therefore, work closely with the IT Sr. Business Analyst and the end users to gain a full understanding of their needs. Working with the Sr. EMR Programmer, the Engineer designs databases that support the decision support platform and corporate dashboards, ensuring that the end user requirements gathered during the requirements definition phase are accurately met with the final build of the solution. In most cases, the Engineer will work with commercially available databases, especially SQL Server. To be most effective, the incumbent should be familiar with metadata concepts and the Data Warehouse data model. 1. Funding Sources; Providers; EmployeesAll customer related services and reports are delivered within specific time frames as established by standards of practiceAll customer related services are coordinated and meet the individual's needs and expectationsServices are rendered in a dependable and reliable mannerAll interactions with customers are conducted with dignity and respect3. title: Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst ( SQL )
company: We are searching for a Senior Business Analyst / Data Analyst experienced in data quality solutions with an understanding of OLTP, ETL, and data warehousing principles. The Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst will work with end users, internal business uni...
desc:
Qualified candidates may forward resumes to Autumn at [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

Sorry NO C2C


Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst
Morrisville, NC

ACS Group is searching for a Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst for an opportunity in Durham, NC!

We are searching for a Senior Business Analyst / Data Analyst experienced in data quality solutions with an understanding of OLTP, ETL, and data warehousing principles. The Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst will work with end users, internal business units, product development team, and other IT project teams in the analysis, profiling, documentation and management of requirements throughout the life of the project. This role will also serve as subject matter expert on data quality proactive alerts as well as associated data quality tools and processes. Candidates should have in depth experience working with end users, developers, and other analysts to refine identified business needs through design reviews and information sessions. Candidates should be results driven, detailed orientated and work well within a global, dynamic and creative team. This candidate should have experience working in an AGILE environment. Experience with large data sets, specifically clinical data, what it looks like, what it means and how it’s used, is highly desirable.
RESPONSIBLITIES:

Act as subject matter expert on data quality issues, tools, and processes
Perform requirements gathering and analysis in order to provide high quality and detailed requirements, ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user community
Collaborate with designated members of the applicable business groups and product development teams to create requirement documents
Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions with BI developers to understand needs of the customer
Assist with process modeling to clarify business requirements, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary
Be a “go to" subject matter expert for Client data, data quality tools, and processes. Assist in knowledge transfer to other technical staff members of business data processes
Collaborate with developers and other analysts to ensure adherence to business requirements and customer needs
Conduct data analysis activities against source systems, 3rd party products, or data that resides within Client business intelligence solutions
Triage of data quality issues reported by users
Resolve conflicting end-user requirements
Author and enter requirements/user stories into a requirements management tool, such as Top Team and Jira
Follow Client System Life-Cycle (SLC) and Computer System Validation (CSV) procedures, as appropriate
As needed, review SLC Development and Validation document(s) prior to authorization, to ensure that it incorporates previously-captured requirements, and includes tests or test steps that explicitly address each identified user requirement
Collaborate with Global IT Solutions functional groups by adhering to established processes to ensure that business requirements are delivered through successful project implementation of optimal, cost-effective solutions
Collaborate with project team to ensure timely delivery and quality of all project deliverables







TOP 3 QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS:

Ability to guide the user in identifying business and data requirements with minimally 3 years proven experience in requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification, and the ability to apply them in practice
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry preferred
Strong skills utilizing SQL and relational databases

REQUIREMENTS:


Candidates should possess a Bachelor's degree, and have a minimum of 5-7 years of business experience, working towards or holding applicable industry accreditation or certification; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Ability to guide the user in identifying business and data requirements with minimally 3 years proven experience in requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification, and the ability to apply them in practice
Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences
Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills
Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature
Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features
Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing
Expert knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC
Strong skills utilizing SQL and relational databases

NICE-TO-HAVE (NOT Required):

Experience with data visualization tools, such as Spotfire, Tableau, is a plus
Familiarity with SCRUM agile development methodology is a plus
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry preferred
Strong understanding of Data Warehousing / Business Intelligence principles is highly desirable
Experience with data quality issues a plus
Ability to conceptualize and think creatively

title: Data Warehouse Developer
desc:
Data Warehouse Developer Job Summary:
Optomi, in partnership with a national leader in multi-media advertisement solutions, is seeking a Data Warehouse Developer to support their flagship product that is reshaping the industry in audience measurement and viewership across all media platforms and devices.  In this role, you will develop massive solutions for real-time event processing and Big Data Business Intelligence applications. 


What the Data Warehouse Development professional will enjoy:
You will work with modern Big Data and Data Warehousing technologies, including Netezza, Teradata, Spark, Hadoop, etc.
You will work within a highly mature, highly collaborative Agile environment
You will be part of a product team and line of business that is generating revenue – This is not your typical IT “cost center"
The team culture encourages employee health and moral by allowing flexible work hours, team celebrations, and high recognition for the work you do on the products developed.  

Data Warehouse Developer Job Responsibilities
You will work with a small (5-7) product team to develop solutions that pull in data from a variety of sources spread across multiple geographic locations and deliver data from a Teradata data warehouse to BI products that drive revenue.   
Recognize patterns in these tactical requests that lead to strategic solutions, and make suggestions along these lines.
This position must take into consideration the business case, objectives, requirements and constraints typical for large-scale multi-terabyte Data Warehousing applications spanning diverse data sources, multiple BI solutions and large user audiences.
Maintain current ETL frameworks and methodologies.
Utilize standard design patterns for ETL development in a Teradata environment.
Collaborate with architects to align the ETL design to the business case and the overall solution



Apply today for the Data Warehouse Developer Job if your background includes:
3+ years of experience in building data warehouse solutions including experience in data migration, data integration, and ETL.  
Strong skills in a variety of Database / Data Warehouse technologies and languages, which may include SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle, Teradata, Netezza, etc.
Solid understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts, and best practices (ODS, Data Marts, Staging, etc.)
Experience in the application of data modeling principles for data warehousing (Normalization, Star Schema, etc.)
Experience with Teradata or other MPP databases is preferred
