title: Data Architect - Data Modeler
desc:
PURPOSE This position is a Senior Technical IT Systems / Data Architect / Modeler position on the Data Delivery team.  The Data Delivery team is responsible for the management, integration, standardization, and mastering of enterprise data supporting our clinical trials business. The Data Delivery Architect I Data Modeler works with customers, business units, IT product architects, and project teams in the analysis, profiling, documentation, and management of technical solution architecture deliverables throughout the life cycle of data oriented projects.  This role conducts industry solution feasibility analysis, provides technical leadership on complex projects, and develops logical / physical data models / architectures. A subject matter expert in the data that powers our CRO business, tools and technologies used in Data Delivery products. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems. Prepares detailed technical data model specifications that support development teams, architecture review boards and future-state data needs. Participates in meetings as a technical CRO data expert.  Has full technical knowledge of all phases of the system development life cycle.  Ensures business needs are delivered by the overall technical solution and overall quality is achieved.  Works closely with data analysts, business analysts, data architects, and developers (onshore and remote) to ensure that technical/data requirements are fit for business purpose and fully understood by the project teams before solutions are developed and implemented for business consumption. Acts independently under general direction. Provides technical leadership on complex projects. May be responsible for multiple phases of a project. May have duties instructing, directing, and checking the work of other system engineering personnel. May have quality assurance review responsibilities. RESPONSIBILITIES Establishes the data modeling architectures, standards, best practices and data integration directions for the Data Delivery solutions / platforms.  Perform detailed systems and data analysis in order to provide high quality and detailed data architecture / model designs. Performs cost, benefit and ROI analysis ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user & technical community. Aligns to corporate architectures and standards.  Develops data prototypes against source systems, 3rd party products, or data that resides within QI business intelligence solutions to confirm data quality, prove concepts, determine if data is fit for purpose and inform accurate solution data architecture and solution development.  Develops logical and physical data models that supports business needs of data oriented solutions. Designs data models to meet business needs, high performance / real-time data streaming, enables enterprise integration, and looks to future-state data innovation.  Ensures the Data Delivery team is able to communicate data structures for any request of the data that powers our solutions. Documents data models utilizing MindMap and other data modeling tools.  Documents data lineage from source to report.  Performs triage of data issues reported by users in production systems.  Serves as top level technical data expert on large, complex data projects.  Performs peer reviews of work products such as architecture designs/patterns, code design, and overall solutions with regard to IT standards, procedures, and ability to achieve business objectives.  Performs long-term evaluations of data models, data systems, databases, and solutions for security risks.  Defines and documents data standards to be performed, data enrichment operations, data validations, data security requirements, and data exception handling processes.  Responsible for maintaining Data Delivery data dictionaries, and Erwin model repositories.  Performs data profiling on relational databases and XML.  Be a “go to” subject matter expert for QI clinical systems & data.  Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions to understand needs of the customer.  Collaborate with developers to ensure adherence to business requirements, technical designs, data architectures, and customer needs.  Resolves conflicting end-user technical requirements.  Conducts root cause analysis on systems and database issues throughout the life cycle of the project.  Follow QI System Life-Cycle (SLC) and Computer System Validation (CSV) procedures, as appropriate.   Model processes to clarify technical designs, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary.  Produce and review data/information models and preliminary system architecture, as needed.  Exhibit confidence and an extensive knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving business problems.   Develop training and support programs for QI Data Factory data, technology and process implementations, as needed. Continuous learning is key to success in this position.  Mentors junior team members in training and developing technical expertise.  Performs other duties as directed.


REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES A motivated self-starter and technical leader with a track record producing positive results.  Minimally 5 years in a technical expert, SME, or solution architect role in a data warehousing / business intelligence solution team.  Minimally 5 years’ experience in defining enterprise logical data models / architectures with 3 years working experience with Erwin. MindMap is a plus.  Ability to guide the user in identifying technical system / data requirements with minimally 3 years proven experience in requirements elicitation, analysis, technical specifications, data architectures, and verification, and the ability to apply them in practice.   Minimally 5 years’ hand-on experience coding in SQL and SQL constructs.   Minimally 3 years’ hands-on experience utilizing TOAD (Tool for Oracle Application Developers).   Minimally 3 years hands-on experience utilizing relational databases, experience in the latest releases of the Oracle database product is a strong plus.  Minimally 3 years’ experience in documenting data analysis results including source to target mapping of databases.  Minimally 2 years’ experience with Data Profiling concepts and processes.  Expert knowledge of XML, XML schemas.  Proficiency in one or more of the following: VB.Net, C#, ASP.Net, Microsoft Visual Studio, Microsoft.Net, or Java.  Possess an expert knowledge in software development tools, practices and lifecycle methodologies.  Continuous learning is a natural progression for this candidate.  Strong understanding of Data Warehousing / Business Intelligence principles, data usage, and database structures including data staging/lake areas, operational data stores (ODS), and data marts (DM).  Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences.  Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills.  Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature.  Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features.  Strong technical and business writing skills.   Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing.  Expert knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC.  Ability to conceptualize and think creatively infusing innovation in all product solution designs.  Experience with process improvement and re-engineering solutions.
Ability to develop training and support programs for global technology and process implementations.   DESIRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS AND ABILITIES:  Experience in the Healthcare Industry with Life Science / Contract Research Organization (CRO) experience a strong plus.  Experience working a regulated Healthcare regulatory environment.  Experience in data modeling / models support IDMP is a strong plus.  Experience with near real-time, and data streaming data flows, and solutions a strong plus.  Experience in Big Data, Hadoop, No SQL preferred.   Specific experience in CRO related standards/solutions including CTMS, ODM, CDISC / SDTM, CDISC ODM, eDC, Safety, Lab systems is a strong plus.  Professional consulting experience preferred.
  MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Candidates should possess a Bachelor's degree, and/or have a minimum of 5-7 years of experience and > 3 years data analysis experience.  Alternatively, extensive operational experience with clinical trial execution experience can be leveraged.    EEO Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Operational Data Architect
desc: Operational Data Architect  Description  The Operational Data Architect will develop pragmatic enterprise data architectures, data models and guidance to be used by the business units to directly impact operations. This job entails the generation of segment architectures supporting data and security requirements for the FAA. Data architectures created will incorporate security and business requirements and will reflect modern software architectures and practices such as Single Page Applications (SPA) using AJAX, JavaScript, and AngularJS. The Data Architect supports data governance, establishment of self-service data services, and building data security into all solutions.  Requirements  - Enabling the use of enterprise data to multiple applications by exposing schemas and ODBC/JDBC services  - Develop requirements and models for the future-state, current state and gaps in data architecture  - Create and maintain EA artifacts using modeling tools such as Sparx and Rational and mapping to FEAF  - Align new data architectures and solutions to security requirements  - Monitor regulatory guidelines in areas such as security, privacy, data policy  - Interpret compliance guidance in areas such as data security and emerging industry standards to determine their impact on the Data Management Program  - Propose innovative solutions to the business problems leveraging open source tools  - Provide support in developing information and data management governance structures, policies, and processes  - Develop and maintain system interfaces and data exchange data sets  - Prepare presentations and white papers on data architecture and data management-related topics and issues  - Support the curation of enterprise metadata and data elements  Technical Skills:  - IT systems design and architectures including technologies such as Service Oriented Architectures, Web Services Architectures, SOAP, Single Page Application, AJAX  - DevOps methodology and associated tools such as Git, Jenkins, Docker, Ansible, Artifactory  - Designing enterprise interface models using SQL, Java, ODBC/JDCS, REST or similar  - Use of JavaScript tools and techniques to expose enterprise data  - Knowledge of laws, policies, and regulations applicable to Federal data and information enterprise architecture  - Experience in setting policies, procedures and strategies to support effective data management for a Federal customer  - Highly skilled in applying enterprise architecture principles and methods in supporting IT programs and projects.  - Expert with Microsoft Office tools, including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Visio  - Presentation and facilitation skills – ability to generate a variety of presentation materials for senior management and technical staff  - Working knowledge of the Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework  - Ability to analyze project, program and portfolio needs across the enterprise and within segments.  - Practical methods for establishing and updating enterprise repositories for application, interface, and data information  - Implementation of NIST guidance in the areas of data security, system security, such as NIST 1500.6 Big Data Interoperability Framework and NIST 800-100 Information Security Handbook.  - Experience with Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA) Risk Management Framework (RMF) and the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF).  - Identification of Mission Essential Functions for risk analysis and system evaluations  Qualifications  This role requires a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related study, or equivalent project-related experience.  - Minimum of fifteen years of experience in IT, with at least five years in data architecture, database architecture, data modeling, and/or Enterprise Architecture  - Experience producing responses to high priority, quick turn-around data calls and report generation  - Practical experience with "data-as-a-service" concepts for internal/external data publication and sharing  - Practical experience with SOA implementation and operation  - Minimum two years of experience with IBM's System Architect  - Experience with Federal Enterprise Architecture Frameworks and reference models.  - Data modeling and information classification experience within the Federal Government  - Experience with schema implementation in SQL and JSON  - Experience with exposing ODBC/JDBC services  - Experience as a data analyst is highly desirable  - Experience implementing EA, MDM, or data warehouse solutions desired  - Position Papers – experience generating position papers for complex technical, policy, business process, and organizational issues  - Information Systems Security domain expertise, evaluation of Information Systems Security and cyber risks   Clearance: Must be able to obtain a Public Trust Clearance   #LI-SM2

title: Data Engineer
location: Crown Center, Kansas City, MO, USA
desc:
Genesis10 is actively seeking a Data Engineer for a Direct Hire/Full Time position with our financial services/banking industry client located in downtown Kansas, MO.  Description:Genesis 10 is seeking an experienced GreenPlum/PostgreSQL Data Engineer to provide production support for its Research Operational Environment (ROE).The ROE is a Linux based HPC system paired with a Massively Parallel Processing Data Warehouse platform. The combination provides a unique environment capable of supporting advanced data analytics on extremely large and complex datasets. The ROE is designed to be a blend of the technologies typically found in a academic research environment with operational support processes found in enterprise IT to meet higher Service Level Agreements (SLAs).Key Activities:Provide production support of the data warehouse as well as the ETL jobs Support the acquisition of data Contribute to the design of new data warehouse components and/or data marts Perform complex data migration tasks to transform and merge data Develop and support self-monitoring, robust, scalable data pipeline ETL jobs using Python/SQL and combination of other languages to implement pre-defined business rules, quality checks and metrics, ensuring scalability and data quality in data warehouse processes Ensure data pipeline ETL jobs are well tested and monitored Conduct data profiling to ensure data quality and data integrity are maintained at all times Provide documentation (Data Mapping, Technical Specifications, Production Support, data dictionaries, test cases, etc.) for all projects Provision data structures such as fact and dimension tables and other objects as needed Manage database supporting elements including schemas, tables, views, etc. Manage permissions to ensure data accessibility, reliability and integrity SQL Query development and Optimization Provide 3rd level support assisting users with access and other help desk ticket requests or issues May require weekend or evening hours and being on call 24 hours a day, seven days a week 
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an information technology field (e.g., Computer/Management Information Systems (MIS/CIS), Computer Science (CS), Electrical/Computer Engineering (EE/CE), or an equivalent combination of related education and/or work experience Typically requires four to six years of relevant and progressive information technology experience directly related to the design and development of software solutions; with some experience in enterprise-class solutions. Three or more years of experience as a Pivotal GreenPlum/Postgres DBA, three or more years writing PL/SQL procedures and functions and three or more years Unix/Linux/Python scripting preferred. Ability to diagnose complicated data warehouse ETL processes, data flows and business logic failures, and quickly resolve issues preferred. Strong performance-tuning skills preferred. Strong understanding of dimensional modeling and other data warehousing techniques preferred. Expert level SQL preferred. Excellent attention to detail preferred. Strong planning and organization skills. Strong initiative, innovative thinking skills, and the ability to analyze details and adopt a big-picture view. Demonstrated problem solving skills, including the ability to think logically and analytically. Fundamental project management skills. Demonstrated ability to adapt and learn new technologies. Familiarity with Industry software development methodologies, standards and architecture frameworks. Fundamental project management skills. Strong oral and written communication skills preferred. Ability to explain complex technical information to technical and non-technical contacts. Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to effectively build relationships; promote, and work well in, a collaborative team environment; and influence others. Accomplished analytical skills preferred. Knowledge, experience, and expertise in a variety of operation systems including, but not limited to, Linux, OSX, and Windows preferred.
If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today! About Genesis10:Genesis10 is a leading U.S. business and technology consulting firm with hundreds of clients needing proven talent and solutions to power their strategic initiatives. If you are a high performing business or IT professional with solid, referenced experience, we want to meet you. Genesis10 recruiters and delivery professionals are highly accomplished career advocates, who get to know you beyond your resume to position you with the opportunities that fit your skills, experience and aspirations. We have benefit options to fit your needs and a support staff that works with you from placement throughout your engagement – project after project. To learn more about Genesis10 and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at www.genesis10.com “Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V”

title: Data Engineer
desc: Description Position Summary:  This position will be responsible for managing, implementing and supporting data model design implementation on GreenPlum database . He/she will be implementing data summarizations models for analytics on Greenplum /big data environment. Using this model he/she will recommend best practices for data loading, data integration and analytics implementation on Greenplum/ Big data.  Telecommuting is an option  Major Responsibilities:  - Model, summarize and integrate data in Big data environment.  - Create and implement efficient DW/summary for analytics usage .This should have efficient data integration, transfer and summary strategy on GP database.  - Lead/support Big Data Platform initiatives for the enterprise specifically related to data analytics on GP platform.  - Make recommendations and give expert advice to management on topics related to: GP Data Platform Architecture, Tools, Technologies and Infrastructure, analytics  - Manage expectations of internal and/or external customers. Handle complaints and offer meaningful short and long term resolutions.  - Support all the groups with various needs of data analytics.  - Create strategy to ingest and presentation of data of Green plum or other big data environment.  - Other projects as assigned by the supervisor    Qualifications  - B.A. /B.S. Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or equivalent work experience required - Minimum 5 years work experience as an Green Plum, MPP databases, Big Data and in-memory databases. - Must have comprehensive knowledge of database technologies - Greenplum 4.3.x.x and Unix or Linux platform - Background in relational databases like Oracle/Teradata is helpful. - Experience with Linux scripting is required (Perl and/or Korn shell/Bourne Shell/ Python) - Understanding of basic SQL commands necessary to perform administrative functions. - PostgreSQL is a plus - Knowledge in Greenplum/Postgress Architecture, Configuring Greenplum system - Defining and Managing the database objects and data in Greenplum. - Knowledge in GPLOAD and GPFDIST in Greenplum. - Managing the Schema, Tablespace and Partitioning in Greenplum. - Install, Configure and maintain Greenplum databases - Broad understanding and experience of real-time analytics, NOSQL technologies(e.g. Hbase, Cassandra, MongoDB) is plus - Knowledge in the following is very beneficial: -Pivotal Big Data Suite - Greenplum, Gemfire, Spring XD and Rabbit MQ -Environments: Amazon Web Services, Cloud Foundry and vCloud Air -Big Data Technologies - Hadoop, Kafka, Zookeeper, Hbase, Hive etc. (Nice to have) - Should be able to support Java application is a plus - Gemfire or in- memory solution experience is also a plus. - Ability to work independently and with other database administrators, application administrators, product developers, and product management as required - Experience monitoring database management systems and in- memory solutions as well as evaluating performance to maximize efficiency - Experience with support of high volume, low latency, 24x7 production database environments with strict availability requirements and revenue at risk - Ability to plan work to meet project deadlines, accommodate demands by users, set priorities and escalate issues appropriately - Superior communication skills (verbal, written and presentation), customer service-oriented - Strong problem solving skill set, and the ability to understand new technologies quickly are essential - Ability to work independently and with other database administrators, application administrators, product developers, and product management as required - Regular, predictable, full attendance is an essential function of the job - Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening are required.  Physical Requirements: -The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. -The associate will be required to: read; communicate verbally and/or in written form; remember and analyze certain information; and remember and understand certain instructions or guidelines. -While performing the duties of this job, the associate may be required to stand, walk, and sit. The associate is frequently required to use hands to touch, handle, and feel, and to reach with hands and arms. The associate must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25lbs/12kg. -Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.   Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.  About Penske Truck Leasing Penske Truck Leasing Co., L.P., headquartered in Reading, Pennsylvania, is a partnership of Penske Corporation, Penske Automotive Group, and Mitsui & Co., Ltd. A leading global transportation services provider, Penske operates more than 260,000 vehicles, employs more than 29,000 people, and serves customers from more than 1,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe, Australia, and Asia. Product lines include full-service truck leasing, contract maintenance, commercial and consumer truck rentals, used truck sales, transportation and warehousing management and supply chain management solutions. Visit http://www.GoPenske.com to learn more.

desc:

Use of administrative application and other applications to ensure data integrity. Analyze data for inconsistencies. Maintain all Corporate Data Services department files/database. Work under direct supervision. Lead multiple projects and project teams. Ensure data integrity, and maintain and manage the current data structure. Acquire, manage, manipulate and analyze complex data sets and consolidate the results in a concise and meaningful manner. Develop and enhance various reports.Responsibilities:
Use an administrative application and other applications to ensure data integrity.
Coordinate changes to computer databases, test and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems.
Coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard computer databases.
Apply statistical theory and methods to collect, organize, interpret, and summarize numerical data to provide data analysis.
Responsible for data analysis on various platforms, documentation and testing, and assist in the management of projects from initial scoping through final delivery and sign-off.
Assist in the evaluation and error detection of the data in the data repository.
Log requests and track the completion of all incoming forms into tracking spreadsheet and/or Access database.
Analyze data for inconsistencies, checks for duplicate data.
Maintain all Corporate Data Services department files/database.
Lead multiple projects and project teams while maintaining current work load.
Mentor junior associates on needs, applications and databases utilized by the data management team.

Bachelor's Degree in Information Science, MIS, Computer Science or equivalent.
Minimum of 4 years' of relevant experience.
High level of competency in using applications such as MS Excel, MS Access, Data warehouse database design, SQL Server, SQL Query Design and Oracle.
Minimum 1-3 years' experience managing Oracle/SQL databases and/or developing efficient SQL queries, stored procedures, indexes, views, functions. Minimum 1-2 years' experience in data mining techniques and procedures and knowing when their use is appropriate.
Technical expertise regarding data models, and database design development.
Knowledge of Utilization Management and URAC standards is a plus.
Ability to easily and simply communicate with key stakeholders analysis trends and techniques as required
Must have the ability to work with large sets of data and analyze it to find conclusions. Ability to take a business problem and clearly define ways to solve the problem.
Close attention to detail, conscientiousness of details. Must be vigilant in analysis to come to correct conclusions. Must be thorough and precise.
Ability to define and document processes, process improvements and train members of the team on these processes as they are defined and/or updated.
Excellent organizational and analytical skills required.
Ability to lead various projects and team members, mentor junior associates

title: Data Integration Specialist
desc:
At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.
We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.
Locations Available:* San Dimas CA * El Paso TX* Alpharetta GA* Florence SC
POSITION SUMMARY: 
Responsible for the analysis and delivery of client interfaces for ADP Compliance and Payment Solutions (CAPS) products and most specifically the Health Compliance product. This role works closely with our interface developers, implementation and Client Services to implement and support the client interface products. The CIS will present benefits and ease of use of the interface products to clients and prospective clients. This position serves as the subject matter expert from a functional and technical standpoint with regard to the client’s ERP payroll system (such as; Lawson, PeopleSoft, Oracle and Infinium) and the ADP CAPS interface products.
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Support client needs related to Payroll & HRMS systems (Lawson, PeopleSoft, Oracle and Infinium, or specific ERP functional/technical knowledge a plus)
Develops solutions to highly complex and critical business systems and projects by leveraging experience, background, and analytical skills.
Understands the perspective of the client and takes actions to integrate their needs with the products and strategic direction of ADP. Responsible for gathering client specific data and processes that could have an effect on the standalone interface requirements. Document and test product interfaces for the import and export of client data. Present and discuss proposals with developer and other partners.
Translate technical information to a non-technical audience and provide excellent follow-up with clients. Ensure correspondence & communication is complete, concise, professional & timely. Expresses written ideas clearly. Verbal presentations are logical & well thought out.
Provide hands-on technical expertise and direction to the Account Management team to understand business challenges and user requirements that are translated into process and technical solutions.
Document and report to all levels of management the status of projects to ensure deadlines are met.
Supports the Client Integration Services team by participating in the resolution of issues and meeting inter-department objectives and goals. Provides feedback to support business and departmental objectives. Accepts responsibility for own actions to ensure success of the team.
ABOUT YOU…
3 years of experience with project/program management, or related function (planning, scheduling, project coordination, earned value analysis).
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, MIS, or equivalent education and/or work experience.
Demonstrates strong customer service orientation.
Experience with Payroll and HRMS Systems preferred, or ERP Technical/Functional expertise with one or more of the following: PeopleSoft, Oracle, Infinium, JD Edwards or Lawson.
Proven experience delivering project/client results to an organization.
Good organizational skills.

title: Manager of Master Data - SAP MDG
desc:
Manager of Master Data
SAP MDG (Master Data Governance)


This position reports directly to the SVP of Technical Services and is responsible for the effective management of all aspects of Product Data standards, development, and stewardship. The Manager establishes policies, reporting, KPIs, & feedback processes to ensure consistently high service performance for the department, with an emphasis on continuous improvement. This requires leveraging the existing resource capabilities and developments of all operating units to drive efficiency and standardization in our approach towards data collection and accurate system information. This role has direct reports and a large team of indirect reporting relationships.
Responsibilities:

Insure that key master data initiatives are deployed consistently at all operating sites.  
Oversee and direct the overall master data direction of the corporation.
Meet with consumers of master data services in order to discuss and resolve quality problems.
Help sustain a culture that is based on continuous improvement.
Execute human capital processes including goal setting, performance reviews, merit planning, human capital planning, recognition, and career development for all direct reports.
Maintain and facilitate a comprehensive understanding of SAP product data requirements, fulfilling the function as necessary and directing other users in interpreting information, monitoring accuracy in the development of data and system corrections.
Facilitate and coordinate data requirements and standards with resource allocations for the preparation and integration of data to SAP and other enterprise systems.
Apply available reports and queries from the data for analysis work, governance, tracking and/or reporting data to other departmental and Corporate Managers to drive continuous improvement.
Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the appropriate data impacts necessary for directing and assisting other users, interpreting information, and monitoring accuracy.
Successfully lead training and support for implementation of Master Data tools, process optimization, and standardizing Master Data cross-functional data flows.
Successful development and maintenance of appropriate system controls and procedures to ensure integrity of data used in reporting and decision making.

Deploy Master Data standards and practices to newly acquired operating units.
Define master data policies and build the team to support the tools and governance of global master data management program using SAP MDM and MDG in support of global SAP business transformation. 

Engage with business users to implement data management program enabling them to manage master data efficiently with high quality. 

Define an actionable data quality index to continuously monitor the quality of data. Research and analyze the data quality to drive continuous improvement efforts. Stay abreast of industry trends to keep the Master Data Management program modern and effective. 

Oversee the day to day operations of the MDM and MDG teams. Engage with business partners to adhere to and maintain the master data governance processes. 





Required:
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or related field required.
5+ Years of SAP experience related specifically to Master Data Structures including BOM Management, Routings, Work Centers, and Business Analytics.  
Project Management certification or equivalent experience.  
3+ years of supervisory/management experience.  
Microsoft Office Suite experience including MS Access and SharePoint preferred.
Other preferred experience – SAP MDG, Smartsheet, Azuqua.

desc:

Duration: 3 months contract, extendable up to 24 months

Job Description:
With a focus on market analytics for the Medical Device business, the Advanced Analytics Project Manager will support the creation of best in class practices for reporting, forecasting, and consolidating data. 
They will partner with key stakeholders throughout all aspects of the analytics project life cycle (e.g. business case, internal alignment, vendor selection, resource allocation, research design, implementation, and action planning). 
This individual will be responsible for coordinating the activities of internal and external team members, and will be required to interact with management regularly.

Minimum 5 years of related business experience required 
Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA/other graduate degree preferred 
Strong Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint required 
Strong analytics, project management, and stakeholder engagement skills required 
Experience conducting analyses with both primary and secondary data sources preferred 
Experience with data analytics software (e.g. Tableau, SPSS, SAS, R, Python) preferred

desc:

Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst
Morrisville, NC

ACS Group is searching for a Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst for an opportunity in Durham, NC!

We are searching for a Senior Business Analyst / Data Analyst experienced in data quality solutions with an understanding of OLTP, ETL, and data warehousing principles. The Sr. Business Analyst / Data Analyst will work with end users, internal business units, product development team, and other IT project teams in the analysis, profiling, documentation and management of requirements throughout the life of the project. This role will also serve as subject matter expert on data quality proactive alerts as well as associated data quality tools and processes. Candidates should have in depth experience working with end users, developers, and other analysts to refine identified business needs through design reviews and information sessions. Candidates should be results driven, detailed orientated and work well within a global, dynamic and creative team. This candidate should have experience working in an AGILE environment. Experience with large data sets, specifically clinical data, what it looks like, what it means and how it’s used, is highly desirable.
RESPONSIBLITIES:

Act as subject matter expert on data quality issues, tools, and processes
Perform requirements gathering and analysis in order to provide high quality and detailed requirements, ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user community
Collaborate with designated members of the applicable business groups and product development teams to create requirement documents
Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions with BI developers to understand needs of the customer
Assist with process modeling to clarify business requirements, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary
Be a “go to" subject matter expert for Client data, data quality tools, and processes. Assist in knowledge transfer to other technical staff members of business data processes
Collaborate with developers and other analysts to ensure adherence to business requirements and customer needs
Conduct data analysis activities against source systems, 3rd party products, or data that resides within Client business intelligence solutions
Triage of data quality issues reported by users
Resolve conflicting end-user requirements
Author and enter requirements/user stories into a requirements management tool, such as Top Team and Jira
Follow Client System Life-Cycle (SLC) and Computer System Validation (CSV) procedures, as appropriate
As needed, review SLC Development and Validation document(s) prior to authorization, to ensure that it incorporates previously-captured requirements, and includes tests or test steps that explicitly address each identified user requirement
Collaborate with Global IT Solutions functional groups by adhering to established processes to ensure that business requirements are delivered through successful project implementation of optimal, cost-effective solutions
Collaborate with project team to ensure timely delivery and quality of all project deliverables







TOP 3 QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS:

Ability to guide the user in identifying business and data requirements with minimally 3 years proven experience in requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification, and the ability to apply them in practice
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry preferred
Strong skills utilizing SQL and relational databases

REQUIREMENTS:


Candidates should possess a Bachelor's degree, and have a minimum of 5-7 years of business experience, working towards or holding applicable industry accreditation or certification; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Ability to guide the user in identifying business and data requirements with minimally 3 years proven experience in requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification, and the ability to apply them in practice
Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences
Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills
Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature
Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features
Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing
Expert knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC
Strong skills utilizing SQL and relational databases

NICE-TO-HAVE (NOT Required):

Familiarity with SCRUM agile development methodology is a plus
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry preferred
Strong understanding of Data Warehousing / Business Intelligence principles is highly desirable
Experience with data quality issues a plus
Ability to conceptualize and think creatively

title: Data Manager
desc:
The Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS), the largest society in the world for professionals in the field of operations research (O.R.), management science, and analytics is searching for a Data Manager.

 The Data Manager will be responsible for the organization’s data systems and ensuring that they meet organizational requirements and future needs. Key responsibilities for this role include; planning, developing, implementing, reporting, maintaining data management processes and suggesting improvements. Manage database upgrades, maintenance, integrity, accuracy, back-up, recovery, security, and database enhancements.  

 The Data Manager must have the technical knowledge to understand the Association Management System (AMS) or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Data Warehouse to recommend and implement the optimal way to collect, store, retrieve and analyze the data. He/She will lead and manage the integration and analysis of data from a variety of sources to address business questions. 

 DUTIES AND RESPONSBILITIES: 
 ● Analyze, design, develop, and integrate database systems across the organization, including add-on programs 
 ● Ensure data systems are operational and all vendor systems updates are properly loaded to Data Warehouse. 
 *  Design and develop Business Intelligence (BI) and dashboard reporting; Develop methodologies for data collection and evaluation relevant to each project or business question; Analyze data with standard statistical methods, interpreting results with written summaries. 
 ● Develop, document and maintain data source & quality goals 
 ● Build and maintain database scheme, tables, procedures and permissions. 
 ● Oversee backup, clustering, mirroring, replication and failover 
 ● Create shell scripts for task automation. 
 ● Review the referential and historical integrity of data warehouse information and resolve data quality problems through appropriate process design strategies; Review data for inconsistencies or anomalies 
 *  Develop and execute test cases for new data processes, perform error detection and correction tests and procedures,  
 *  Monitor all ETL jobs to ensure that data flows correctly between systems 
 *  Provide end user support for database/reporting applications as required. 
 *  Programming and processing for the monthly Membership renewal/invoices in the AMS 
 *  Understand privacy law and standards and guide the Institute to ensure our compliance. 
 *  Other duties as assigned from time to time. 











● Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or a technology-related field of study; Master’s degree in related quantitative field preferred 
 ● 5-7 years of experience with relational database systems, structures, theories, principles and practices 
 ● Extensive knowledge and experience in Data Warehouse and business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Cognos or other industry leading tools 
 ● Experience with Oracle, SQL Server and SSIS  
 ● Experience with one or more scripting languages (Java, Bash, Perl, Python) 
 ● Experienced preferred in the migration of data from one system or platform to another 
 ● Experienced in relational database technology, transaction processing procedures, reporting, and basic familiarity with modeling and design tools. 
 ● Demonstrated supervisory skills and leadership experience 
 ● Experience in writing and executing test cases 
 ● Experience with Project Management and/or Quality Assurance a plus. 


 ADDITIONAL SKILLS REQUIRED: 
 ● Ability to handle multiple demands, shifting priorities, rapid changes and adapt responses and tactics to meet organizational goals and objectives. 
 ● Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing. 
 ● Should be able to work efficiently and effectively within a team environment. 
 ● Ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience.  


 PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: 
 Must have the ability to perform moderately strenuous activities including, but not limited to, sustained activities (continual bending, stooping, etc.) and lifting and moving packages up to 25 lbs.

title: Sr Data Scientist
desc:
Sr. Data Scientist
The Data Scientist Oversees and performs end-top-end data based research. Design data mining solutions to be implemented and executed with alignment to the planned scope and design coverage and needs/uses, leveraging knowledge and a broad understanding of E2E business processes and requirements.
The Data Scientist Defines the data analytics research plan, scope and resources required to meet the objectives of his/her area of ownership (segments of the project/engagement). This includes:- Analyzing the data and identifying data sources- Determining appropriate types of data analytics to be performed- Selecting and applying data analysis techniques to ensure that recommendations and predictions provide an adequate level of confidence based on defined coverage criteria- Designing repeatable, verifiable and traceable analytical models
The Data Scientist Identifies and analyzes new data analytic directions and their potential business impact to determine the proper prioritization of data analytics activities based on business needs and analytics ROI.
The Data Scientist Identifies data sources, oversees the data collection process and designs the data structure in collaboration with data experts (BI or big-data) and subject matter and business experts. Ensures that data used in the data analysis activities are of the highest quality.
The Data Scientist Constructs data models (algorithms and formulas) for required business needs and predictions.
The Data Scientist Works closely with content experts and managers to pinpoint queries, map data, and validate results. Maintains and enhances the professional and business relationship with internal stakeholders.
The Data Scientist Facilitates presentations on how to use the data. Offers practical solutions to be used by the end decision makers.
The Data Scientist Presents results, including the preparation of patents and white papers and facilitating presentations during conferences.
The Data Scientist Effectively participates in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing insights from a professional perspective.
The Data Scientist Prepares results in such a way they will be convenient for use. Provides professional support for team members and keeps them informed of assignments/ project status. Provides for training and support for other team members.
The Data Scientist Explores and examines data from multiple sources. The Data Scientist sifts through all incoming data with the goal of discovering previously hidden insights, which, in turn, can provide a competitive advantage or address a pressing business problem. A Data Scientist does not simply collect and report on data, but also looks at it from many angles, determines what it means, and then recommends ways to apply the data.
The Data Scientist Participates in technical designs of the wrapped product, which will run the model. Ensures that the model is properly used, that data inputs are supplied correctly and in a timely manner. Verifies that the correct data population is being processed. Ensures that that the output of the model is used correctly and that business objectives are being targeted.
The Data Scientist Participates in the development stages of the wrapped product, including design, development, QA, implementation and production. This is particularly critical when the Development and Implementation teams find it difficult to understand and evaluate the model's objectives and benefits.

Daily Activities Consist of three parts:
1. Data Engineering
2. Creating Models
3. Deploying models created by other Data Scientists





The Data Scientist has 5 or more years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience Solid knowledge of statistical techniques.
The Data Scientist has The ability to come up with solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets
The Data Scientist has Strong programming skills (such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Scala , Python or other big data frameworks, Java), statistical modeling (like SAS or R)
The Data Scientist has Experience with Amazon AWS toolset is an advantage Experience using machine learning algorithms
The Data Scientist has High proficiency in the use of statistical packages Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms
The Data Scientist has Strong communication and interpersonal skills Knowledge of telecommunications and of the subject area being investigated - advantage

Must Have

•Hadoop: Must have a general understanding and hands on experience.
•Scala and Spark: Must have hands on experience creating models
•Amazon Web Services
•Experience creating statistical models
•Experience with machine learning
•Good communication skills:  must be able to present work or discovery to senior leadership.

Education:
Masters in mathematics, statistics or computer science or related field – Ph D. degree preferred

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
desc:
CSI Tech is searching for a BI Analyst for a large, national finance/banking company located in Abilene, TX. 




The salary range for this position is 80k-95k. 
Green card holders or US Citizens will only be considered for this position. 




POSITION: Business Intelligence Analyst III 





SCOPE/CONTACTS: This position will work with all holding company banks and bank personnel. Contacts are regularly with persons outside of their own department or work group, but generally of a routine nature. Tact and diplomacy is a necessary consideration. 






ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
Business 
Works directly with business leaders and business analyst community to understand and prioritize opportunities where data and analytical insights can provide significant business value 
Provides analytical as well as technical leadership to the business analyst community, bringing new thinking and innovative approaches to solving problems 
Effectively scopes, sizes, and plans the development of analytical solutions and sets expectations accordingly 
Develops analytical solutions that meet or exceed the business need 
Creates relevant visualizations and/or documentation that aids in telling the story and effectively communicating new insights and headlines 
Summarizes analytical findings and makes recommendations on potential business actions to be evaluated 
Effectively communicates findings to business stakeholders who can affect change, and demonstrates follow-through in helping the business to implement change 
Technical 
Works with BI team and other IT resources to effectively source required data domains; provides input and best practice approaches to building out effective data integration solutions which could include both internal and external (3rd party) data sets 
Uses a variety of technologies to design and build analytical solutions that support the strategic and analytical needs of the business 
Analyzes data, trends, and data patterns and applies statistical methods to real-world business problems 
Provides input into the on-going improvement of the data sourcing and integration layer based on best practice data warehouse, data integration, data modeling, and data management methodologies and approaches 
Astute on new and emerging technologies and technical approaches (Big Data, Data Discovery, Data Visualization, Data Science, etc.) 







MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 

Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics (or equivalent experience) 
5+ years expertise in at least two of the following areas: Operations Analytics, Customer Analytics, Pricing Analytics, and Financial Analytics 
5+ years’ working knowledge and experience in statistical analysis. 
5+ years’ experience working with traditional as well as emerging Business Intelligence technologies (such as Azure, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Microsoft Power BI, Excel) 
Experience working with data from Jack Henry (or other ERP systems) and CRM applications 
Ability to create scalable, service-oriented and n-tier systems, structures and flows. 
Demonstrated ability to develop analytical solutions that meet or exceed the business needs 
Hands-on approach to working with data and working through technical data sourcing challenges 
Demonstrated ability to write code that can move and/or analyze data efficiently (Proficiency in SQL Server 2008-2012 T-SQL, stored procedures, and the SQL Server 2008-2016 BI Stack, working with MDX. 
Eager to learn and build both technical and analytical skills 
Self-starter with ability to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously 
Strong verbal and written communications skills 
Strong presentation and influencing skills when working at varying levels of the organization 
Highly collaborative working style

title: Data Analyst
desc:
WHO OUR CLIENT IS:$500 million private-equity backed transportation and logistics company that is a leader in its industry Company experiencing tremendous growth organically and through acquisition Culture that takes great pride in quality and reliability South Charlotte HQ operations with heavy investment in quality technology work environment

title: Senior Data Developer
desc:
RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client that is seeking a Senior Data Developer for their office in Miami Gardens, Florida (FL).Responsibilities: Develop data mappings in SSIS, reports in SSRS for Dashboard

 Develop and design database objects, tables, views, indexes, constraints, etc.
 Analyze query execution plans and optimize database code

 Produce a detailed functional design and architectural document to match customer requirements
 Create stored procedures and functions to incorporate complex database algorithms
 Write and understand complex SQL queries for MS SQL, MYSQL, and NoSQL databases
 Define, document, and develop new or maintain existing interfaces between applications, databases, and third-party systems to meet business requirements
 Perform ad-hoc analysis of production data where necessary to develop solutions to reported incidents
 Effectively communicate with the appropriate internal and external business and technical customers for information gathering and follow up
 Designing and maintaining schema and databases for MySQL, MS SQL, and NoSQL
 Other duties as assigned and modified at manager's discretion


REQUIREMENTS: Bachelors' degree of Science in Computer Science, MIS, or Mathematics
 5+ years of ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) coding experience in SQL
 3+ years of experience with MySQL, SQL Server
 2+ years of experience analyzing and develop Star Schema Designs
 Fluency with relational databases, including structure design, ad-hoc SQL queries, and stored procedures
 Experience in relational database design, optimization and performance with commercial-grade databases such as MySQL
 Experience with data dictionaries, data analysis and relational databases
 Familiarity with ERD tools (Erwin, data modelers)
 Ability to create conceptual, logical, physical data designs
 Ability to effectively query various database platforms to extract required information
 Proven understanding of SQL optimization (proper indexing and ability to interpret execution plans)
 Ability to understand business requirements and convert them into database designs
 Proven ETL development skills (SSIS, Informatica, or equivalent ETL tool)
 SSIS and / or Informatica development skill a definite plus
 Proven data modeling skills
 Fluent in English

desc:

title: Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required
desc: Job Description   If you are an experienced Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some of the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for a Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!  Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required          Job Responsibilities                                               Your specific duties as a Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required will include:  Position is to provide supplemental resource for coordination of a user access review process We will need this person to be able to use Excel (intermediate skill level - experience with lookups is needed) They will also be using SharePoint so, some experience with share point would be helpful Enters alpha and numeric data into spreadsheets and/or the mainframe The employees work either on individual projects, or a series of discrete tasks that demand data be transferred from one form into another Data must be entered quickly and accurately; data must be transcribed, interpreted, and verified for correctness   Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required Job Requirements As a Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree required you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills. Bachelor Degree in Accounting/Finance required 3-5 years of experience Intermediate Excel experience (VLOOKUPS, Pivot tables, etc.) Accounting and/or coding skills that require keying into a database are necessary, as is some degree of clerical work Also, proficiency in the appropriate computer programs, such as word processing and spreadsheets is essential     Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required Benefits  As a Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 39 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for Data Entry Clerk - Bachelor Degree Required Position include (but are not limited to): Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening. Keywords: Data Entry, Accounting, Excel, VLOOKUP, SharePoint

title: SAP Global EWM Data Steward - CUS0000738
desc:
GM is in the midst of one the world’s largest SAP implementations. This global SAP implementation is a key enabler for the end to end transformation of GM’s global business, including Customer Care and Aftersales (CCA). GM is seeking an outstanding individual to join the CCA SAP Implementation Team to drive the deployment of our Global Aftersales Template across the company. This position offers a great career opportunity in the newly formed Global Business Solutions Organization, which was formed to champion the company’s business transformation in GM’s dynamic aftersales business.This is a chance to develop your skills and expand your capabilities across a core set of commercial SAP modules in a vibrant global organization. You will have the opportunity to grow and be recognized as a leading SAP business professional working with SAP’s Service Parts Management software solution, which is considered one of SAP’s key growth opportunities. This is in perfect strategic alignment with GM’s vision for growth and globalization in the Aftersales business sector.

The successful candidate will:
Provide SME (Subject Matter Expert) input to the project team implementing SAP EWM & business user community using SAP EWM as it relates to Data Management and Data Governance. •  Work with technical and business teams to ensure that all Master Data relevant to their area is defined, used and loaded accurately. 
•  Works cross functionally and globally with business and technical experts and provide input to project teams. 
•  Assists in Investigation of defined interfaces and assist in the resolution of interface errors. 
•  Lead business readiness and execution of defined interfaces to ensure resource alignment, communicate status, escalate issues, and continuous process improvement. 
•  Supports data conversion activities for ongoing and future SAP implementations. 
•  Defines data requirements for new and existing interfaces 
•  Maintains good data quality principles in all activities 
•  Prepares presentations and training materials as needed 
•  Conducts training

The policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.


Required:Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Engineering, IT, or equivalent experience  
3 years of experience managing SAP Warehouse Master Data including Material, Vendor, Customer and Supply Chain Data
3 years of experience with Master Data Governance and Master Data Maintenance Processes.
3 years Program/Project Management experience
Strong relationship building skills
Proven ability to effectively lead cross-functional teams.
Strong oral & written communication skills.
Creative individual willing to think out of the box to come up with solutions to complex data issues.
Flexibility for early morning and late evening conference calls with other GM global regions.
Preferred:SAP EWM (Extended Warehouse Management) experience.

desc:
Cadillac Data Analyst                                                                                                                                                                        ROLE SYNOPSIS Cadillac Data Scientist, Advanced Analytics is an individual contributor that reports to the Director of Corporate Strategy & Advanced Analytics.Primary purpose:Drive implementation of advanced analytics across Global Cadillac embedding it in processes, analysis and planning procedures and methods
Help identify and solve Cadillac’s biggest challenges, identify potential risks, and uncover new opportunities to modify operations, expand revenue, or reduce cost through the use of advanced analytics
Support the corporate strategy group with constructively disrupting/enhancing Cadillac’s business model
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIESWork with and coach a Cadillac team of Analysts and collaborate cross-functionally in the planning and execution of advanced analytics and data management:Capability BuildingHelp build & execute Cadillac’s Global Advanced Analytics capability (Methods, Tools, Processes/Procedures); from both internal & external sources
Perform analytical methodology process improvements
Engage and collaborate with Cadillac Global team, GM IT, GM Advanced Analytics, GM Digital & Marketing Analytics for synergies and cross pollination, development and resource efficiencies
Advanced AnalyticsLead Advanced Analytics projects and integration across Global Cadillac
Develop actionable business insights by performing advanced analytics on a broad range of problems and data types; communicate findings both written and verbal in a clear, concise and compelling manner 
Conduct Cadillac Global segmentation modeling and evaluation (Vehicle & Customer)
Stay abreast of the evolving advanced analytics landscape; bring best practices and leading edge innovations to Cadillac
 Lead efforts to identify root cause of poor performance or KPI shortfalls
Predictive modelingCapitalize on new sources of data using state of the art tools and techniques to drive faster and better business decisions
Aide Cadillac in pivoting toward a forward looking predictive mode of operation
Predict the impact of initiatives and market shifts on the brand, volume, pricing
Identify predictive model opportunities (e.g., incentive optimization, supply chain, product development, etc.)
Identify and build predictive modeling opportunities for key business imperatives e.g., quality, marketing effectiveness, digital sentiment, volume 
Data ManagementBuild tools and processes to manage and disseminate data
Direct validation and approval of all data and information utilizing advanced analytics (predictive, statistical & machine learning based or high-technology derived) for Cadillac executive team decision making
Develop and implement solutions and methods to leverage Hadoop based GM data platform where possible
Business IntelligenceLead strategic KPI and key signals Business Intelligence across Cadillac
Manage tracking, management and automated tool development for executive and working team monitoring
Conduct process development for early warning signal (EWS) communication and action as part of ERM
Conduct instillation of regular business intelligence process and reporting implementing key prioritization, visualization, velocity, quantity and frequency considerations
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTSMinimum of 7 years’ experience in data analytics/data science  
Experience leading teams of analytical professionals and facilitating productive brainstorming, methodology development and problem solving 
Utilization of advanced analytics for business application in experience or education
Education or experience with distributed processing / cloud based architecture and Database management skills (e.g., SQL, cloud: Hadoop, Hive)
Working experience with enterprise warehouse management and query
Working knowledge of advanced statistical methods for predictive forecasting (beyond multiple linear regression analysis)
Exposure to programming (object oriented or otherwise)
Database management skills (e.g., MS Access, SQL, cloud: Hadoop, Hive)
Statistical software experience (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, STATA)
Demonstrated experience with scenario and simulation development
Strong project management skills; ability to execute multiple complex and long-term tasks with strong cross-department collaboration and high time-management acumen

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS 
Project Management or Process Management Certification (PMP, Six-Sigma, etc.)
Marketing Analytics Background
Economics exposure
Distributed processing statistical learning experience
Data Visualization & Business Intelligence exposure
Ability and desire to contribute in a low-structure, growing and fast paced environment
Graduate degree in statistics, applied sciences (e.g., physics), computer science and/or related quantitative field
Strong teamwork and communication skills and ability to work with all management levels 
Ability to collaborate successfully in cross functional and cross-regional teams 
Ability to make/recognize effective trade-off decisions and can negotiate skillfully in tough situations with both internal and external groups, can win concessions without damaging relationships
Ability to communicate complex concepts with compelling, simple and impactful delivery
Effective presentation skills in a variety of formal presentation settings: one-on-one, small and large groups with peers and superiors, and C-level executive teams inside and outside of the organization
Able to make sound decisions based upon a mixture of analysis, experience, and judgment
Natural initiative in decision making, execution and process improvement
Natural drive for making a contribution and creating new processes and methodologies

title: Market Data Consultant
desc:
Job Description:
The Investments IT Market Data group is responsible for all aspects of Market Data from commercial and vendor relationship management, financial and inventory processes and management and setting the market data strategy.

We are looking for a strong Market Data Analyst who will own and execute on several key initiatives on a portfolio of over $20M with 150+ suppliers. The successful individual in this role has worked in a market data role for 5+ years and is comfortable working on commercial initiatives and has a good technical acumen.
 
Key Responsibilities:
• Project manage market data integration activities into Client including, but not limited to,
o Categorization of acquired services
o Service comparison between current and acquired services
o Obtain communication and buy-in of next steps and action including:
Contract termination
Straight contract renewal
Renewal w. additional service
o Provide information to load into Inventory Management Tool
• Manage Usage Capture and Analysis program including, but not limited to,
o Report and metrics generation
o Project planning and execution
o Communication including to Senior Leadership
 




Essential Skills:
Required:
• 5+ years of market data commercial experience (preferably on the client side)
• Experience with market data licensing, contractual terms and vendor negotiations
• 5+ years of working in an IT environment with solid technical understanding of how market data services work
• 3+ years of project management experience
• Comprehension of web based platforms and technology
• Experience using FITS Inventory Platform desirable
• Financial industry experience and knowledge is a plus
• Solid communication and organizational skills

****Top 3 MUST HAVE requirements for this role
- 5+ years of market data commercial experience (preferably on the client side)
- Experience with market data licensing, contractual terms and vendor negotiations
- Excellent Communication and Relationship Management skills
Contract Management experience is highly desired.

Required Industry Background
- must come out of Investment Management industry (client buy/sell side ) or Market Data (Vendor side) company - for ex. Bloomberg or Reuters

title: Data Scientist
desc: Data ScientistThis position is responsible for business consulting activities for the Analytics Competency Center within various Duke Energy business units as a liaison to Information Technology in order to:- Serve as an expert in translating complex data into key strategy insights and valuable actions.- Discover business narratives told by the data and present them to other scientists, business stakeholders, and managers at various levels.- Develop and test heuristics - Create and run models- Perform data exploration and data mining- Create business intelligence, dashboards, visualizations, and/or other advanced analytics reports to adequately tell the business narrative and offer recommendations that are practiced, actionable, and have material impact, in addition to being well-supported by analytical models and data. With Some Supervision:- Partner with Business Clients, establish professional relationship, and communicate with analytics clients in order to understand business needs.- Frame Problems with Stakeholder, research and construct problem frames in order to understand the analysis context and scope that will provide timely, useful results.- Work in Project Teams and participate in multidisciplinary analytics project teams.- Interview Subject Matter Experts, plan and conduct individual interviews with experts to gain valid information and data needed for analysis.- Elicit Information from Groups, plan and conduct group elicitation sessions with working groups to develop and assess alternatives, uncertainties, and value and risk preferences.- Communicate Results to Decision Makers, explain the Results and conclusions of the analytics process in both written and oral presentation formats.- Create recommendations that are practiced, actionable, and have material impact, in addition to being well-supported by analytical models and data. Employees in this role will also:- Identify unique opportunities to collect new data.- Design new processes and build large, complex data sets.- Strategize new uses for data and its interaction with data design.Qualifications- Internal Basic/Required Qualifications:- Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university with a degree in statistics/analytics, physics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, economics or management of information systems- 1 to 3 years of experience with statistical analysis, data modeling and reportingDesired Qualifications:- Previous experience working in data mining, natural language processing, and / or data governance- Working knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language)- Working knowledge of Hadoop and related tools- Working knowledge of data analytic tools like SAS, R, IBM Cognos, Python, etc.- Hands-on experience with BI/visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.- Strong knowledge of basic and advanced regression and prediction models- Mastery of statistics, machine learning, algorithms and advanced mathematics- Strong oral and written communications skills- Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office products #LI-AK1s•com is an Equal Opportunity Employer - All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other factor determined to be unlawful under applicable law.

title: Data Entry Clerk
desc:
Data Entry Clerk/Accounting Assistant
Brook Park, OH
Pay Rate- $25/hour


Position Overview- 
The Data Entry Clerk will provide supplemental resource for coordination of a user access review process by working on individual or group projects and tasks. The Data Entry Clerk will enter alpha and numeric data into spreadsheets and/or into the mainframe.


Position Responsibilities-
Keeping track of received data and source documents.
Compiling, sorting, interpreting and verifying data to be entered.
Contacting prepares of source documents to resolve questions, inconsistencies or missing data.
Enters alphabetic, numeric or symbolic data for source documents into a computer following the format displayed on the screen
May review error reports and enter corrections into computer
File and route source documents after entry as appropriate.
Respond to inquiries regarding entered data.


Position Requirements- 
Candidate must have 5 years of experience in a similar role. 
Candidate must have a bachelor’s degree 
Candidate must be able to multitask and work on multiple projects at one time, have great organization skills, and have good communication skills. 
Data must be entered quickly and accurately; data must be transcribed, interpreted, and verified for correctness. 
Excel and Sharepoint experience is required.
