Please be aware that acknowledging or having criminal convictions does not constitute an automatic bar to employment.  Factors including, but not limited to age and time of the offense, seriousness and nature of the violation, and rehabilitation will be taken into account.

title: ***Senior Provider Data Specialist - West Valley City, UT
desc:
Expanding access to affordable, high quality health care starts here. This is where some of the most innovative ideas in health care are created every day. This is where bold people with big ideas are writing the next chapter in health care. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm) 

The Senior Provider Data Specialist is responsible for various activities related to the provider network database which may include any or all of the following: database maintenance, reporting and extracting data for various reports and analyses, initiating database improvement. Senior Provider Data Specialists develop and maintain standards for database integrity and quality assurance, coordinate corrective activities to clean database and retain users, and manage communication processes with other departments regarding database improvements. 

Primary Responsibilities: 

Conducting audits and providing feedback to reduce errors and improve processes and performance


Maintaining current provider data to ensure the quality of the network


May be responsible for representing the provider network area on company IT projects 


Proactively identify solutions to non-standard requests

Required Qualifications: 

High school diploma


4+ years’ experience in a professional office environment 


2+ years of data analysis, business analysis, reporting or auditing 


Intermediate level of proficiency with MS Office, particularly in Excel

Preferred Qualifications: 

Experience working within the healthcare industry 


Experience working with medical claims 


Customer service experience 


Proficiency with medical terminology 

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)


Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.


Job Keywords: Senior Provider Data Specialist, data analysis, business analysis, reporting, auditing, West Valley City, UT, Utah

title: Data Scientist
desc: About Us:We are a private mortgage insurer with $184.3 billion primary insurance in force covering approximately one million mortgages (as of April 30, 2017.) MGIC provides a critical component of our country’s residential mortgage finance system, protecting mortgage investors from credit losses. Mortgage insurance from MGIC also benefits consumers by making affordable low-down-payment mortgages a reality. Bottom line…We put people into homes sooner! #WeAreMGICA day in the life of our Data Scientist: (roles and responsibility)As a Data Scientist you will:•Manage and enhance existing predictive models including monitoring performance, research and development of enhancements and internal and external documentation.•Identify potential business questions where new predictive models may be valuable. Manage project to research, develop and document these models and ensure the appropriate standards, reporting and monitoring are in place.•Be a research and development resource for expanded analytics using a variety of data sources.•Participate in client discussions to gain an understanding of the business needs and strategies of our customers, as well as the overall mortgage industry.•Provide highly complex concepts in understandable business language to enable a deeper understanding of models and analytics.•Provide customer support for MGIC customers in the implementation process of the models.What’s in it for you?•Competitive Salary & Benefits•Profit Sharing•401(k) with a company match•Pension Plan•On-site Fitness Center and Classes (corporate office)•Paid-time off and paid company holidays•Paid Parental Leave•Tuition reimbursementWhat we’re looking for: (requirements)•Education: Completion of Doctorate Degree •Strong knowledge of all tools and platforms used in development at MGIC•Advanced knowledge and in depth understanding of: the residential mortgage lending industry; the role, operation, and significance of the secondary market, government agencies, and other key players; statistics, regression analysis, data mining and predictive modeling techniques, database management, financial concepts (ROE, NPO, IRR), and sampling theory•Highly advanced analytical skills to structure problems, perform very complex analyses, identify trends and inconsistencies, draw conclusions, and recommend solutions. •Highly advanced level of computer skills in order to do complex programming and modeling of problems using a variety of software and databases (currently, SAS, Tableau, Hadoop, Excel, Oracle and NeuralWare Predict) and be able to quickly grasp new and emerging technologies and software tools and apply them.•Highly effective communication and presentation skills in order to present findings and results of analyses, both verbally and in writing to MGIC management and external customers.•Teamwork approach to dealing with issues crossing corporate functional areas and ability to provide leadership and direction to lesser-experienced Data Consultants.A little more about us!Our headquarters are located in downtown Milwaukee, a place that offers something for everyone with its big-city attractions and small-town atmosphere. MGIC is a seven time recipient of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel Top Work Places award. This is an award based on the opinion of our company's greatest asset, our talented and dedicated workforce! We are committed to being an active and positive member of the local Milwaukee community. Along with our co-workers, we support many local initiatives including:•United Way•United Performing Arts Fund•Habitat for Humanity•Junior Achievement•Public Television Channel 10/36 AuctionMGIC offers a comprehensive benefit package which includes medical and dental insurance, pension, profit sharing and 401(k) savings. We offer an on-site fitness center, wellness initiatives and a business casual dress policy.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background and substance abuse testing. For additional information about MGIC and to apply, please visit our Web site at www.mgic.com/careers.

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Group: 
MCISClearance Level Needed: 
Top SecretShift: 
DayCategory: 
Scientific / AnalyticalManTech International Corporation is looking for a Data Science-Machine Learning Specialist for our client location in Springfield, VA or Sterling, VA or Washington, DC. General Responsibilities: We are seeking highly-qualified data scientists to lead the development and delivery of advanced, machine learning and predictive modelling solutions. Individuals experienced with large, structured and unstructured datasets are needed to transform, analyze, and model data for more effective decision support. Many analytical approaches are needed to support current and future work, including: data mining, clustering analysis, pattern recognition and extraction, automated classification and categorization, and entity resolution. These and many other techniques will be needed to implement risk-based targeting models of national security concern.• Lead projects with hands-on analysis and modeling, leveraging data analysis and analytical techniques and methods to solve complex business problems.• Perform problem domain definition, including data identification and analysis.• Extract, aggregate, manipulate, categorize, clean, and transform data associated within an identified problem space for use in predictive modeling.• Perform exploratory data analysis and feature generation• Identify patterns and/or anomalies in large datasets• Perform automated text/data classification and categorization as well as entity recognition, resolution and extraction.• Develop algorithms; train, evaluate, and deploy predictive analytics models using machine learning methods.Qualifications:• Bachelor’s Degree (required), Master’s or Ph.D. degree (preferred) in operations research, industrial engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science/engineering, and other related technical fields or equivalent practical experience• Significant experience in developing machine learning models and applying advanced analytics solutions to solve complex business problems• Experience with unsupervised and supervised machine learning methods• Experience processing large-scale data sets (using Hadoop, HBase, Pig, etc.)Skills:• Object-oriented programming languages: Java, Scala• Experience working in a team and deploying solutions in an iterative or agile software development environment is a plus• Database and Data Management - working with large unstructuredClearance Requirements:• TS/SCI with ability to obtain CBP Suitability OR TS with ability to obtain CBP SuitabilityLocation: Alexandria, VA or Sterling, VA or Washington DC


BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math or equivalent. 5-7 years of relevant work experience. Previous experience using R, Matlab, Python Scikit-learn or other statistical modeling packages, with a focus on machine learning; experience with NLP a plus. Previous experience developing production systems for processing large volumes of structured and unstructured data in Java, Python or similar technology stack. Previous experience with Hadoop technology stack (Map reduce, HIVE/PIG, etc. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong team player, capable of working collaboratively in customer teams.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
desc:
We are seeking a Healthcare Data Analyst to support the Air Force Medical Service (AFMS) analytics mission.  Successful candidate will conduct studies, perform data analysis, provide program support and implement corrective actions in support of the following medical activities: resource management, health plan management, group practice management and health systems design and delivery.

Candidate must have proven ability to synthesize disparate facts from multiple sources and coalesce into an accurate and useful analytic product.  Analyst must be able to demonstrate ability to provide accurate and timely analytical products containing well-reasoned and cogent discussion points providing Air Force leadership with substantiated options or courses of action.  Must have ability to communicate analytical discoveries and appropriate recommendations/mitigation strategies to senior AFMS leadership.

Requirements include:
Providing analytical support by evaluating and making recommendations from healthcare data.
Experience in concepts associated with presentation of quantitative information.
Experience with designing and developing information products, technical reports and presentations for higher headquarters, MAJCOMs, military treatment facilities (MTFs) and AFMS staff.
The ability to perform complex analysis of target populations, segmentation analysis and track performance of models created (e.g., Monte Carlo and SAS modeling and optimization software).
The ability to create queries to collect data from appropriate AFMS database systems (e.g., MHS Mart (M2) and/or CHCS).
Five (5) years of demonstrated ability to conduct thorough and comprehensive system-wide business case and return on investment analysis for healthcare operations within AFMS, Military Health System (MHS), Veterans Administration or private sector.
Five (5) years’ experience with the integration of performance planning goals to meet the objectives of the MHS or AFMS.
Five (5) years of technical experience in data presentation software and concepts associated with presentation of quantitative information.

title: Clinical Data Associate (SPSS Exp.)
desc:
The Defense & Veterans Brain Injury Center (DVBIC) is seeking a Data Associate to participate in TBI research in both the military and veteran population.DVBIC supports a multi-center network of military treatment facilities and Department of Veterans Affairs medical centers. The mission of the Research Division at DVBIC is to support researchers in this network in developing and conducting clinical investigations in traumatic brain injury (TBI). DVBIC’s extensive internal and external collaborations allow for clinical innovation and research along the entire continuum of care of TBI: from initial injury, whether in-theatre or outside of theater, through medical evacuation to acute and post-acute medical settings, rehabilitation, and ultimately a return to family, community and work or continued duty.Position Summary:S/he will plan, conduct, and complete investigations under the supervision of the lead of the project. S/he will participate in all aspects of research including data collection, organization, literature reviews, structured interviews, analysis and interpretation of basic data and will assist with the preparation of technical reports, summaries, and protocols. Primary Responsibilities:Plans, conducts, and completes investigations under the supervision of the head of the project. 
Participates in data collection and organization, literature reviews, structured interviews, provides basic data analysis and interpretation. 
Assists with the preparation of technical reports, summaries, and protocols. 
Maintains clear and accurate records, inventories and logbooks. 
Verifies and corrects data entry for research projects, supports senior staff in quality control and provides trouble shooting. 
Provides written updates to senior staff. 
Additional Responsibilities:                                                                                                                  Understand, update, and instruct staff on Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for hard copy quality assurance (QA), data entry, and data QA, per guidance of the Research Data Coordinator (RDC) and Scientific Directors.
Prepare and improve training materials for hard copy QA, data entry, and data QA and complete secondary QA checks of staff’s finished tasks. 
Assist RDC with cleaning of data and detection of missing data, including identifying, removing, and resolving errors encountered.
Update dataset properties across multiple databases and maintain database merging capability
Construct and QA syntax (under supervision of RDC) written for dataset creation, dataset updates/revision, and data cleaning.
Assist RDC with data export process for data collected electronically, including QA of syntax for import and recoding and troubleshooting PDF/web based errors.
QA of electronic data capture programming (e.g., format design, usability, testing skip patterns, checking data coding, etc.).
Complete checks of existing tracking systems (for recruitment, consent, and questionnaire completion), resolve discrepancies/errors, and create/update formulas for tracking
Note: All DVBIC contract staff working in VA Centers will work as NON-Personal Service contractors.


Knowledge of standard qualitative and quantitative data collection techniques. Ability to follow general instructions; work in a team; good communication, writing and analytical skills; familiarity with social science research methodology is required. Ability to follow detailed instructions. Excellent communication and analytical skills required. S/he must adhere to legal, professional and ethical codes with respect to confidentiality and privacy.
2-4 years’ experience in research required.
Prior experience within the DoD/VA systems of care strongly preferred.
As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors. With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services. desc:

title: Data Conversion Specialist
desc:
What sets Paylocity apart from its competitors in the industry is a willingness to get our hands dirty and electronically convert new companies from their existing payroll platform onto the Paylocity payroll processing platform. Over the past 17 years, we have used a multitude of technical approaches to extract, transform, and load necessary data from over 200 diverse payroll systems. Relying on strong technical skills combined with knowledge and ingenuity, we haven't met a system that we can't convert!Paylocity is looking for a technical resource with SQL skills and advanced MS Excel skills to be a resource for the Implementation Consultants and enhance Paylocity's electronic conversion function. This position combines technical ability with payroll knowledge, creativity, and can-do attitude to convert new companies onto the Paylocity payroll processing platform.  Performance Objectives/Job Duties Respond to internal and external requests during implementation
Work directly with clients to coordinate and schedule electronic data extraction
Use SQL, MS Excel and Access 
Coordinate the gathering and conversion of various types of customer data
Review and / or format client supplied data for accuracy prior to uploading
Responsible for analyzing and defining mapping rules
Assist in data cleanup where necessary
Must be willing to work the hours in the West, East and Central time zones.  
All other duties as assigned. 


Must have beginner to intermediate SQL skills. Experience in SQL server and ETL is also a plus.
Must have advanced Excel skills
Previous payroll experince is strongly recommended, as payroll knowledge will help you better analyze the quality and accuracy of the data
Bachelors degree preferred or related experience, preferable in a computer-related field
Multi-tasking – We work in a matrix environment meaning that you will be working on more than one client at a time although each client may be at a different phase in the project (i.e. start up, configuration, production). The ability to multi-task is essential as you shift focus from one client to another.
Attention to detail
Strong communication skills
Analytical/Problem solving ability
Ability to work within a team environment
Basic project management skills
Able to manage change
Customer focus – ability to manage client interactions
Proficiency in MS office – Our products are based upon Access and SQL databases. Knowledge of these will help you during electronic data conversions. As well as advanced MS Excel skillsT1

title: Master Data Manager
desc:
AAF International offers the most comprehensive clean air solutions available across the globe. Selling under the American Air Filter® and the AAF International® brand names, AAF International has been an industry pioneer since 1921 and has since grown to operations in over 22 countries with over 3000 employees. Founded in 1924, Daikin has grown into a diversified industrial manufacturing company offering solutions in clean, air, air conditioning, refrigeration, chemicals, oil hydraulics, defense systems and electronics. AAF and Daikin are powered by our investment in people, products, and our processes.
Our culture of continuous improvement, safety, and world class operations is powered by our people centered management philosophy. This is fueled by our belief in treating our people, our supply partners, our customers and our environment with the trust and respect we each require, and our passion to give back to our community for our success.

title: Manager of Big Data
desc:
Why HCA? HCA, a Fortune 100 company with more than 200,000 employees, is one of the nation's leading providers of healthcare services, operating over 170 locally managed hospitals and over 100 freestanding surgery centers in 20 states and the United Kingdom. With its founding in 1968, HCA created a new model for hospital care in the United States, using combined resources to strengthen hospitals, deliver patient-focused care and improve the practice of medicine. HCA is a learning healthcare system that uses more than 27 million annual patient encounters to advance science, improve patient care and save lives. HCA has been named one of the world's most ethical companies for eight years in a row. At HCA, we are driven by a single goal: the care and improvement of human life. JOB SUMMARY  Manager of Big Data is a critical customer facing role that requires the instinctive ability to recognize big data needs and provide portfolio level strategic and tactical oversight for the design, development, modification, and implementation of mid- and long-term solutions to solve customers’ most complex business and technical issues, making high-level tool choices and recommending solutions that align to customer’s advanced analytics need. This role will be responsible for end to end delivery of the Big Data platform capabilities ensuring the most effective, timely and appropriate solutions (application or infrastructure) are developed to fulfil the business and product requirements enabling benefits realization. Leadership skills to drive to closure on key functional and non-functional requirements while managing the relationships with new and existing business partners, product owners and other teams within the Big Data analytics ecosystem is key to the success of this role.  OUR PURPOSEHCA (Hospital Corporation of America), the leading healthcare provider in the US, is seeking a dynamic technologist focused on building world class distributed computing clusters. This role provides a unique opportunity to research, acquire, and implement leading technologies and processes, improving the quality and operations of an organization whose mission statement is nothing less than improving the care and quality of human life, a company consistently ranked both in ComputerWorld’s “100 Best Places to Work in IT” and Ethisphere’s “World’s Most Ethical Companies.”  CORE COMPETENCIES   The following are highlighted competencies and core expectations for the job/role:• Recruit, inspire and mentor team members in the distributed computing and big data solutions domain.• Establish collaborative working relationships with multiple stakeholder groups.• Build and maintain systems in a way that ensures compliance with certification, regulatory standards, and a technology based information security program;• Ensure teams follow best practices regarding coding standards, code reviews, and testing (including unit, integration, and system test).• Assess technological options and design offerings supporting scalable, high-performance, and highly available environments;• Partner with architects to ensure developed solutions adhere to established best patterns and our architectural target state;• Manage and grow the hardware and software infrastructure that runs high-volume, highly available data analytics solution hosted on various Big Data platforms.• Responsible for identifying, evaluating, testing and recommending various tooling around the Big Data and Advanced Analytics ecosystem.• Seasoned in DevOps Tools and IT Service management. • Manage, enhance and audit Security Policies to ensure compliance with best practices.• Proactively takes responsibility, owns any issues arising and follows through to resolve them (get the required result) and recognizes how individual responsibility impacts team delivery and inspires others to do the same.• Strong project management, planning, and organizational skills• Oversee administrative functions such as cluster monitoring, troubleshooting,  patching, load balancing, cluster configuration, automating maintenance, etc., • Anticipates internal and/or external business challenges and/or regulatory issues and leads innovation; Recommends process, product or service improvements; Solves unique and complex problems that have a broad effect on the business; Contributes to the development of strategy; leads teams; Operates with no supervision in a complex environment.

EXPERIENCE 1-3 years of experience required Knowledge of these areas would be preferred:Big Data Architecture, Development & Admin
Spark, Impala, Kafka, Solr, Zookeeper, Yarn
                    CERTIFICATIONS (OPTIONAL)Cloudera Developer Certification
Cloudera Administration Certification
EDUCATIONCollege Graduate Preferred

title: Integration & Data Specialist
desc:

banking market. As one of the Chicago metropolitan area's largest independent bank holding companies, First Midwest provides the full range of both business and retail banking and trust and investment management services.

title: Data Analyst Sr - Health Care Services
desc:
Data Analyst Sr.  Health Care Services


Long Beach, CA 
Full-time

Internal E6

About SCAN

Our mission is simple: Keeping Seniors Healthy and Independent–that’s been our mission for almost 40 years.  Rated as one of the top Medicare Advantage plans in California, SCAN Health Plan employees are passionate about what they do. Understanding that
success is based on achieving the mission, SCAN employees are afforded with the training and tools necessary to do their jobs and they are rewarded for their efforts and recognized as experts in their fields.  Ask anyone who works here and we’ll proudly tell
you that SCAN’s commitment has never wavered.  We are as steadfast in our pledge to help our members live healthy and independent lives. 

The job

Support organizational and departmental decision-making through report writing, analyzing organizational data, organizing findings into concise understandable presentations, and effectively communicating results to management. Primary focus is supporting
the organization’s initiatives around Health Care Services (HCS), including Special Needs Plans (SNPs), Care Management Programs and other HCS projects.

You will


Supports operational needs and Quality Improvement activities by constructing and analyzing queries and reports on a wide range of organizational data.

Assesses complex data systems and programs in support of ad-hoc and standing management or customer requests.

Translates business requests for data into accurate reports. 
Ensures understanding of customer needs by proactively clarifying scope and requirements and keeps customers apprised of project status through effective communication.

Creates programs, methodologies, and reports for analyzing and presenting data.

Examines data quality, applications, and functions in order to ensure quality and that data is representative of the operations of the organization.

Interprets data in order to identify trends and measure outcomes of HCS programs.

Contributes to new product development and improvement in product delivery and presentation. Conducts data analysis on subsets of populations served and identification of areas for improvement. Support customer needs for what-if scenario analysis by developing
analytical tools/models. 
Designs, generates and executes HCS-related reports for management and regulatory agencies. Manages multiple projects by effectively prioritizing work and escalating issues.

Achieves high-quality deliverables by assuring accuracy and thoroughness in executing projects. Develops and maintains up-to-date knowledge of the data warehouse and other organizational data sources.

Adheres to all quality, compliance and regulatory standards to achieve HCS and SCAN outcomes. Actively supports the achievement of SCAN’s Vision and Goals.





Your qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required. 
• 5+ years of proven analysis experience in healthcare required. 
• Experience with Microsoft SQL and Visual Studio required. 
• Superior analytical skills required. 
• Experience with managed care required. 
• Ability to document processes and analyses for reference required. 
• Ability to effectively interact with, and present findings to, customers various levels of the organization. Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI) products a plus.

• Expert skills in MS Office productivity software especially MS Excel.
What's in it for you? Qualified employees will receive
A competitive compensation and benefits program 
An annual employee bonus program 
Generous paid-time-off (PTO) 
Ten paid holidays per year
Excellent 403(b) Saving Plan, providing up to 4% match and vesting after three years
Casual attire
A work-life balance and much more!
We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!

title: Senior Data Scientist
desc:
At Web.com, we work on a broad range of business initiatives and objectives by leveraging a wide set of technologies and tools. As a Data Scientist you will have close collaboration with the engineering and design teams, as well as the product and data teams in business units. Your role will range from research experimentalist to technology innovator to consultative business facilitator. You must be comfortable partnering with those directly involved with big data infrastructure, software, and data warehousing, as well as product management.

In this role, you will:
Perform hands-on data analysis and modeling with huge data sets.
Apply data mining, NLP, and machine learning (both supervised and unsupervised) to improve relevance and personalization algorithms.
Work side-by-side with product managers, software engineers, and designers in designing experiments and minimum viable products.
Discover data sources, get access to them, import them, clean them up, and make them "model-ready". You need to be willing and able to do your own ETL.
Create and refine features from the underlying data. You'll enjoy developing just enough subject matter expertise to have an intuition about what features might make your model perform better, and then you'll lather, rinse and repeat.
Run regular A/B tests, gather data, perform statistical analysis, draw conclusions on the impact of your optimizations and communicate results to peers and leaders.
Explore new design or technology shifts in order to determine how they might connect with the customer

Qualifications:
MS or PHD in Math or related field with 3-5+ years of experience in data science
Deep knowledge of machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, statistics, NLP or related field
Solid programming skills that enable them to retrieve, analyze and process data, and build machine learning models from the ground up (SQL, Python, R, Java, Scala)
Familiarity with Agile engineering practices
Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing to scientists and non-scientists
Familiarity with big data ecosystems (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Pig) and NoSQL (MongoDB, ElasticSearch, HBase)

title: Senior Data Scientist
desc:
If you want to achieve more in your mission of health care, you have to be really smart about the business of health care. Challenge yourself, your peers and our industry by shaping what health care looks like and doing your life's best work.(sm)


Optum is seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join the team and guide work on numerous machine learning and data science initiatives within Optum. This individual will  support and advise teams utilizing big data across multiple health care environments to deliver value to different Optum businesses.  The work is complex in nature and crosses a wide range of business problems that utilize clinical, claims, pharmacy and other data sources.  

Primary Responsibilities:
Provide cutting edge data science thought leadership to a growing team that is developing new insights for Optum

Advance predictive modeling practices through pattern recognition, data manipulation, and analysis

Demonstrate excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as XGBoost, Random Forest, and SVM

Work with resource leader to develop project reviews process, establish guidelines for code reviews, and ensure the correct models are used, and correct conclusions drawn from work

Use excellent communication skills  to effectively explain complex concepts to business counterparts

Provide oversight for multiple projects at the same time, helping the team meet deadlines as agreed with our development and project partners

Work effectively on multidisciplinary teams

Create innovative solutions that solve the ever-changing needs of the health care system

Document findings, including assumptions and validation work in a clear structured manner

Use strong business, problem solving skills and programming knowledge to quickly cycle hypotheses through discovery

Utilize data from  multiple data sources to support solution features, train and drive test models 
Required Qualifications:
Degree in quantitative field, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics or similar

5+ years of Predictive Analytics experience

5+ years of data analytics experience

3+ years of Machine Learning/Data Science programming experience with Python (preferred), or  R,  SAS, Scala, Java or similar stack

Good probability and statistics skills as they relate to machine learning

Good scripting and programming skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Jupyter, H2o and others

Experience with Amazon Web Services or equivalent product in the machine learning space

Experience incorporating Machine Learning & Al concepts into solution development in a professional capacity

Experience with data visualization tools

Experience managing, mentoring or leading others

Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people’s lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We’re freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life’s best work.(sm)



Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.


Job Keywords: data scientist, machine learning, predictive analytics, R, Python, data analytics, Minnetonka, MN, Minnesota

title: Senior Director, Analytic Data Platform
desc:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California’s Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.  We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.


The Senior Director, Analytic Data Platform
is responsible for defining a common analytic data platform to support all
enterprise analytic needs.  The common
data platform delivers many enhancements to the administrative data to allow efficient
analytic operation and reporting.  The
enhancements include diagnosis grouping, inpatient grouping (MS-DRG, APR-DRG),
cost and utilization categorization, membership assignment to provider
organizations, product designation, provider specialty, drug therapeutic class,
and member risk scoring.  The Director
will also incorporate clinical data obtained from external parties to allow
analysis in clinical quality and outcomes.  This position reports to VP, Enterprise
Analytics and Informatics. 
The Director, leads a team of
analysts, has in-depth understanding of how information is consumed, and how analytics
support all types of business functions in the organization. He/she collaborates
with Data Services Organization to plan and to deliver the analytic data
platform.  
 Specific duties include, but not limited to: 
 
•    Compiles
enterprise analytic data needs, and partners in developing an enterprise
roadmap of analytic data platform.
•    Provides
detailed requirements for analytic data platform; works closely with Data
Services to deliver the roadmap. 
•    Creates,
maintains, and updates analytic enhancements, including software upgrade or
methodology modifications.
•    Develops,
maintains, and updates standard definitions of commonly used metrics.  Maintains a knowledge base for these
definitions for the enterprise.
•    Generates
routine health care cost and utilization reports and identify saving
opportunities
•    Provides
reports or data extracts for external organizations, in collaboration with Data
Services Team. 
•    Supports
ad-hoc data requests. Bachelor’s
degree in health care administration, business administration, public health,
economics, statistics, computer science, finance, or a relevant field. Master’s
preferred.
Minimum 10
years of analytic experience supporting functional areas (clinical, network
management, medical management) in health insurance industry.
Minimum 5
years of experience in analyzing health care insurance claims data.
Minimum 5
years of hands-on experience in data analysis tools, including but not limited
to SAS, SQL, SPSS, Access, Cognos, Tableau.
Minimum five
years of supervisory experience leading an analytics/ research team.

title: Machine Intelligence Data Scientist, Mid - Video Job Description Included
desc: WATCH OUR VIDEO & MEET THE TEAMJob Number: R0011910Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise.Machine Intelligence Data Scientist, MidThe Challenge:Collecting, analyzing, and communicating information isn’t new. Data science has been around for a long time, but not many people know exactly how to use it. You, however, know how to find and analyze all of the important data in an organization. You are able to draw conclusions and communicate them to the right people, in a way that will make their next steps clear. We’re looking for you, a data scientist who knows how to step back and understand the complete picture of an organization’s data and help them to use it effectively.On our team, you’ll have the opportunity to support aircraft readiness by working with the military to realize the answers hidden in their own data. You will examine current data stores, processes, and formats, to make recommendations on how to better collect, integrate, and use incoming data. As the data science expert, leadership will look to your guidance to help them answer their questions, as well as provide them with conclusions they didn’t know could be derived from their data. You will communicate changes that are needed, such as buying more parts, improve aircraft reliability, implement better training, or develop better processes, based on the story the data tells. Join our team and help improve national security by showing the military how powerful their data can be.The Perks:A great job isn’t all we have to offer – at Booz Allen, we’re constantly launching and supporting firmwide training and mentoring programs like the Data Science 5k Challenge, Data Science Bowl, hackathons, and meetups. You’ll be empowered by our latest tools and technology, and can take advantage of our tuition assistance. With an engaged community already thousands strong, we intend to continue to build on and offer new opportunities for our experts to grow while focused on solving the hard problems and supporting our client missions.Relocation: Don't live near the Lexington Park Maryland area and interested in relocation? No problem, we have relocation benefits available.You Have:-Experience with analytic software packages, including R, Python, and Mathematica-Experience with machine learning, data science, and accessing data from a wide variety of data stores, including Microsoft Access, Hadoop, and SQL and NoSQL-Knowledge of data visualization, statistics, and modeling-Ability to communicate technical concepts and results to a non–technical client-Ability to obtain a security clearance-BS degree in Mathematics, Science, or EngineeringNice If You Have:-Experience with time series analysis-Knowledge of equipment reliability, sustainment, and logistics analysis-Ability to interact as part of a project team working with domain experts, mathematicians, data experts, software developers, and clients-Secret clearance-MS degree in Mathematics, Science, Engineering, or a related fieldClearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and will need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems by their side to help them achieve their missions.  Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet.#LI-AH1, AFH16, AFH26, GD17, MPPC, CB13, TMJ16

title: Analyst III, Data Science
desc:
Are you passionate about improving the quality of healthcare? 
Are you interested in exploring a rapidly expanding universe of clinical data? 
Are you ready to leverage your talents to make healthcare better for everyone? 
Are you fascinated by the growing field of data science?
Then join the new Data Science & Advanced Analytics team at Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG) that is transforming the delivery of healthcare in the United States!
HSAG has been a pioneer in the field of healthcare quality improvement for over three decades, serving approximately:
25 percent of the nation’s Medicare population
46 percent of the nation’s Medicaid population
20 percent of the nation’s dialysis population
HSAG is nationally recognized as an industry leader in the areas of data analysis, measure development, and patient satisfaction surveys. We are in search of talented individuals that are interested in a career in analytics as an Analyst 3 in HSAG’s Data Science & Advanced Analytics division. Together we can spread positive change to make healthcare better.  
UNIQUE BENEFITS
An Analyst 3 in DSAA also benefits from HSAG’s desire to grow its staff into the future leaders of healthcare quality improvement in the nation. New HSAG analysts are provided formal training in statistics, clinical epidemiology, SAS, healthcare data, and an assortment of healthcare-related topics. 
HSAG offers:
A comfortable work-life balance, including half-day Fridays and flexible work schedules.
Three weeks of paid time off and 13 company-paid holidays where staff leave two hours early prior to each holiday just to get a “jump start” on holiday festivities.
HSAG offers a competitive benefit package which includes, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) and an employee stock ownership plan. 
DESCRIPTION
The Analyst 3 is a lead contributor to cutting edge analytic work that spans the broad spectrum of healthcare data projects at HSAG. Driven by intellectual curiosity and a passion for healthcare quality, the Analyst 3 leads the development and execution of innovative analytic plans that are intended to provide healthcare decision and policy makers with the necessary information to transform healthcare. The Analyst 3 will also lead a wide array of analytic studies and participate in all phases of the research design process. The Analyst 3 will have at his or her fingertips a wide array of data types to facilitate data exploration, including:
survey
case review
medical and prescription drug claims
eligibility
clinical
electronic health record
operational
Details regarding potential project assignments will be discussed with potential candidates during the interview process.  Beyond project assignment duties, the Analyst 3 will serve as a mentor to other analysts within the division and will work closely with the division’s leadership to fulfill HSAG’s analytic vision.
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as a leader within HSAG Data Science & Advanced Analytics division.
Demonstrate expertise in utilizing the primary types of healthcare data and methods for approaching data assessments.
Evaluate a wide array of data types.
Conduct and interpret analyses, develop appropriate statistical models, manipulate complex databases, and track and evaluate patterns of care and outcomes.
Develop analytic methodologies and analysis plans.
Attend and participates in team training meetings, including presenting at these meetings.
Present and communicate project results to nonanalytic staff members and customers. 
Represent HSAG in a professional manner at all times.

title: Data Support Analyst level IV
desc:
KellyMitchell matches the best IT and business talent with premier organizations nationwide. Our clients, ranging from Fortune 500 corporations to rapidly growing high-tech companies, are exceptionally served by our 1500+ IT and business consultants. Our industry is growing rapidly, and now is a great time to launch your career with the KellyMitchell team.Position Title:   Data Support Analyst level IV Position Summary: Create proposals for new GRC metrics on both a Business intelligence (trailing risk indicator) and Data Science basis (leading risk indicator); as well as through input from identified Company SMEs and stakeholders Develop and document hypothesis for new metrics, & estimate potential implications and consequences Ensure metrics are developed in alignment with the ITRM Strategic Goals and Objectives Maintain all GRC metrics in an automated and evergreen fashion Develop and maintain an indexed and searchable inventory of current GRC metrics with relevant metadata Ensure protection of individual and Company rights - comply with appropriate regulatory and policy guidance, including data privacy Confirm veracity of all the GRC metric information through research and data analysis/correlation Create and maintain presentation or visualization strategy for all GRC metrics suitable for senior Company stakeholders Report GRC metrics and status to ITRM management as required Collaborate with stakeholders as needed to further develop, test, and implement GRC metric enhancements
Required Skills/Experience:Strong IT, data analysis and/or data forensics capabilities and experience Experience working with large enterprise datasets and connecting them to build insights Strong data management and modeling skills including standard relational DB query language using technologies like SQL and PowerQuery Experience working with data visualization software Tableau and creating automated dashboards Demonstrated subject matter expertise in: governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) Working under a strict non-disclosure / confidentiality agreement Relevant educational background including computer science, computer information systems, or equivalent work experience Expertise handling sensitive subject matter as part of information security or GRC Web development experience using a shared/atomic design structure Strong oral and written communications skills – able to translate technical issues/concepts into insights for non-technical audiences including senior management or other stakeholders as needed Demonstrated subject matter expertise in information security (InfoSec) Experience with user behavior analytics and risk scoring programs Preferred experience addressing data privacy requirements Strong interpersonal capabilities with a proactive and collaborative orientation Extensive network of contacts in the GRC industry and field Able to influence without authority & work effectively across organizations/geographic boundaries Committed to learning and continuous improvement Strong organizational, coordination, planning, and interface skills Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities

title: Data Entry Representative
desc:
The CSI Companies is looking for a Senior Data Capture Associate for our client, a major health based non-profit, in Oklahoma City, OK. This is a short-term contract position and looking for candidates that can start immediately. The ideal candidate will be able to work 40 hours during the business week(M-F).-       The Senior Data Capture Associate is responsible for the daily data capture and submitting to export, from White Mail, and other data feeds, for its resulting delivery to all endpoint systems to include our accounting, Constituent Relationship Management, Image Repository systems and Depositary, Internal Ticketing Application or other vendor systems.-       Process all incoming donations and other data and submit it to export in a way that results in all data being sent to its respective endpoints while meeting our agreed quality & delivery standards. -       This position also assists Data Export and Data Capture Specialists functions as needed.Other Job Responsibilities: •Exhibit a behavior and general attitude that promotes, supports, and mentors the Shared Service Center's six core values; Focus On The Customer, Teamwork, Excellence, Integrity, Innovation, and Initiative. •Perform data entry tasks in all applications including, but not limited to, NHO White Mail donations, event donations, event forms, direct mail, and pledge contributions. •Perform data entry tasks into the Constituent Relationship Management application. •Perform staff training in all applications including, but not limited to NHO White Mail donations, event donations, event forms, direct mail, and pledge contributions. •Perform correction tasks on data previously entered in all applications. •Perform data correction tasks for entries that failed automated business rules application in both the Invalids and Staging Error Queues for all applications. •Perform batch & record reversal and correction tasks. •Maintain strong technical knowledge of applications relating to donations and document processing. •Maintain strong business process knowledge of all products and services provided by the department. •Maintain adequate knowledge of functional business purposes the department supports with its products and services. •Correct errors in FileNet. •Perform export/import functions for outsourced work, including work acceptance and audit tasks. •Keep their work area neat and orderly. •Support Data Export by posting batches daily to General Ledger in Lawson as needed.  •Support Data Export by researching and correcting error files returned from Lawson and Siebel as needed.  •Support Data Export by performing credit card donation transmittal uploads and downloads for payment, reversals, and reconcilement as needed.  •Support Data Export by managing the Customer Service/Verification inbox and working inbound and outbound exceptions as needed. •Research and analysis. Pay: $11.50-13.50/hr

title: QAPI Data Analyst / LVN
desc:
Bienvivir All-Inclusive Senior Health (“Bienvivir") is a community-based, participant-centered, comprehensive health care delivery program that advocates and promotes quality of life, optimum independence, and dignity for the frail elderly. Since 1987, Bienvivir has served the frail elderly population of El Paso, Texas by utilizing the Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly model. Currently, Bienvivir provides comprehensive health care services to over 800 participants at three facilities in the El Paso area.

 
Bienvivir is currently accepting applications for the following position:

 
QAPI DATA ANALYST - LVN

 
General Description:



Under the supervision of the QAPI Manager, the QAPI Data Analyst is responsible for the creation and maintenance of excel databases and the collection, measurement, reconciliation, trending and statistical analysis of data appropriate for determining Bienvivir Senior Health Services outcomes and assisting and making recommendations to departments with corrective action plans that support improvement activities. The QAPI Data Analyst will work collaboratively with employees, contractors, participants and the general public to plan and implement initiatives that support improved organizational and participant outcomes. The QAPI Data Analyst will be evaluated by the QAPI Manager. 


 

Qualifications:



Associates
degree from an accredited University with current LVN licensure in the state of
Texas and a minimum of 3 years clinical experience. 


Prior
experience in use of Excel for creating and maintaining databases. Knowledge in
the collection, measurement, trending, reconciliation, and analysis of data. 

Previous
experience in quality programs (preferred)

Understanding
of Six Sigma methodology (preferred).
Bilingual
verbal and written communications (English/Spanish) desired.











Hours of work:

Generally, Monday through Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. May require some extra hours, depending on business needs.


 


An Employer of Choice, Bienvivir offers eligible employees: medical insurance, a prescription drug plan, dental insurance, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, paid holidays, paid time off, a retirement plan, an employee assistance program, education assistance, and disability plans. 






Please visit our website for more information on how to apply at:


 


www.bienvivir.org/employment/


 


A COMPLETED APPLICATION MUST BE SUBMITTED FOR CONSIDERATION.





Bienvivir is an Equal Opportunity Employer / Affirmative Action Employer.
Bienvivir participates in the E-Verify program.


* As a condition of employment all new hires (and rehires) must satisfactorily clear a series of screening and background checks that includes, but is not limited to; references, criminal history search, employee misconduct registry search, employability status check search, exclusions lists search, drug testing, and other required checks. All new hires (and rehires) are required to satisfactorily complete the mandatory new employee Orientation Program and job-specific training. The Orientation Program may be delivered in a classroom setting, online, computer-based, using demonstrations, one-on-one, on-the-job, or in any other manner required.

title: Senior Software Engineer/Data Scientist
desc:
Senior Software Engineer/Data ScientistCompensation is Open based on experience.Interested In a Industry Leading Information Security Start Up! Join one of the fastest growing Computer Software Startups in Boston. We are looking for extremely gifted Software Engineers to assist in building and maintaining backend web services. We are looking for more then just the average Software Engineer. We are interested in engineers with the computer science fundamentals to use a variety of technologies & languages and pick up new ones when needed. As a engineer, your mission is to deliver robust, high quality code in a continues delivery environment. You will work on a small, cross-functional Agile team to design & ship features and evolve their infrastructure. You will do this in development & Production environments writing code in Java, Scala & Python, and using technologies such as Jersey/Jetty, Scalatra, Flask, Docker, Hadoop/HBase, and Spark, all running in the cloud and delivered as a SaaS application.Backing our web services, our core data processing engine exemplifies Big Data. It already processes tens of billions of records daily; We are revamping it to be more scalable, in execution time, data volume and resource usage. We are improving our operational infrastructure & processes to support a rapidly increasing, global customer base and expanding data volume. We are continuing to introduce new features, enhancements and even entirely new products, by finding innovative, new insights in the ocean of data they ingest. We are looking for Engineers with great interest in Data Science that embrace the challenge of tackling large problems and want to construct the foundation that the engineering team will use for the next 3-5 years.RequirementsBachelors in Computer Science or a related field (PhD. preferred)
Strong in data structures, algorithms, and software design
Deep knowledge of at least one modern language. Your ability to pick up new concepts and ideas rapidly is more important to us than mastery of a specific language. 
Track record of consistently shipping products to customers
Ability to work independently yet collaboratively in a dynamic environment
Nice to haveExperience withMicroservice architectures, REST APIs and related technologies
Software development & continuous delivery in a SaaS environment
Public cloud platforms such as AWS
Technical project leadership
Cyber-security or information security
This is a Full-Time, Direct Hire Opportunity. Compensation is Open for the Right Candidate.

desc:
Direct Hire Data Entry Specialists
Doherty Top Talent is currently partnering with a leading supplier in banner and display creation located in Brooklyn Center, MN!  We are seeking Direct Hire Data Entry Specialists to work from 9:30am-6:00pm for these exciting opportunities that offer an opportunity to gain experience and grow with a company.  Data Entry Specialists earn $15 per hour.  
 
Data Entry Specialist Responsibilities:

Same day data entry of customer purchase orders into the system. Order receipt can come in the form of e-mail, fax, or phone. 
Provide same day order confirmations and clarify order discrepancies.
Support order status requests, limited processing of return material authorizations, credits/debits, and answering customer questions.
Expedite requests as necessary.
Obtain 100% accuracy entering customer Purchase Orders. Ensure all pertinent fields are entered accurately, in a timely manner, and adhering to any unique customer requirements. 
Actively work to streamline Purchase Order entry with focus on creating consistency among customers.
Meet established productivity rates.


Data Entry Specialist Requirements:
Previous order entry experience preferred
Minimum level of education is a High School diploma or equivalent.
A background in supporting manufacturing processes is a plus.
Proficient typing skills with high level of accuracy (at least 50 wpm).

title: Hadoop Big Data Engineer
desc:
Leverage modern and emerging platforms to house data for the many reporting and analytics needs that we have.  Be at the forefront of building out the environment, inventing new processes, configuring and developing components where necessary, and being an all-around Hadoop generalist.

Essential Functions:
Install and configure Hadoop components and related utilities
Develop processes for source data ingestion, transformation, and database loading
Develop processes for data quality monitoring
Develop processes to support “Data as a Service (DaaS)"
File system management, monitoring, support and maintenance for HDFS, KUDU, and HBASE
Create scalable and high-performance web services for data tracking
Assisting with data lake folder design
Recommending and establishing security policies and procedures for the Hadoop environment
Assisting in the development and implementation of various strategic initiatives.
Contribute to development of Architecture Policies, Standards and Governance for the Hadoop and Big Data environment
Research and development with promising leading edge big data technologies
Participating in data architecture design and review processes, including planning and monitoring efforts, reviewing deliverables, and communicating to management
Responding to change and engaging in multiple projects simultaneously
Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks


Education: 

Bachelor’s degree in related field is required 
  
Experience: 

7+ years of experience as an IT professional 
2+ years working with Hadoop Cloudera

3+ years working with data design or database development 

Experience with reporting tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, Datameer, etc would be a plus 

Prior experience in a complex, highly integrated services environment 
  
Knowledge: 

Working knowledge of Red Hat LINUX 
Good aptitude in multi-threading and concurrency concepts
Understanding of and experience developing in Hadoop
Working knowledge of Kafka, Flume, Hive, Spark, Impala, Sqoop Oozie, Hbase, Zookeeper, HUE
Expert level SQL knowledge and experience with a relational database
Working knowledge of Pig Latin, HiveQL, Python or Java
Substantial understanding of reporting and analytics tools
Experience working with data lakes
Pre and post installation of Hadoop software and good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems dependencies
Implementing data ingress and egress-Facilitating generic input/output, moving bulk data into and out of Hadoop
Expertise in setting up, configuration and management of data security

Familiarity with Cloudera, Kafka, Spark, data lakes, and Flume is desired
 Skills: 

Excellent written and oral communication skills 

Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Visio) 

Strong consultative and presentation skills 
Assertive (yet diplomatic) personality and the ability to handle change

Candidates need to work well in extended project teams with little oversight

desc:

title: Technical Data Analyst
desc:
Overview/Risks
Conducts the gathering and documentation of data for purposes of monitoring donor referral and recovery performance and final outcome of tissues with a focus on interdepartmental communication and related projects. Interacts closely with other MTF departments to compile donor-related information necessary to accurately plan and monitor MTF’s performance. Develops and maintains data collection tools for the Donor Services Division. 

Responsibilities

Tracks and generates routine and special reports related to donor activity and outcome of donated tissues. Communicates that information to appropriate departments for follow up and any required action. 
Creates and generates reports studying the Technical Operations work flow to assist in decreasing cycle time and improve department process efficiency.
Creates and generates reports for the DSD and Recovery Partners to evaluate and improve recovery performance.
Primary Recovery Partner contact for data and reporting relating to recovery of skin tissues, including distribution of recovery feedback and reimbursement reports and interaction with other MTF departments to troubleshoot reporting problems.
Design and maintain data collection and reporting tools, including modifications to current databases and interactive reporting mechanisms.   
Work closely with the IT department and other relevant departments to streamline data entry and transfer process and to ensure web-based reporting is accurate and timely.
Tracks OA/OC graft statistics and generates monthly/quarterly reports regarding actual vs. potential donors, recovery issues, and grafts requested but not received as well as received but not processed.
Acts as SharePoint site administrator for the MTF Partner Portal and relevant sections of the Donor Services and Technical Operations pages of InSite.
Acts as a resource to other departments in regards to OA/OC recoveries and status.
Tracks accuracy of information in the Soft Tissue Database.
Tracks Tissue Trace cards and provides recipient information/ reports to MTF Partners on an as-needed basis.
Participates in meetings as a representative of the Technical Operations department. 
Initiates new projects by analyzing, planning, and estimating based on department needs.
Interacts with Marketing, Planning, and Processing to anticipate and evaluate changes in recovered tissue demand. Monitors and reports on the recovery of new and special grafts.
Studies existing work flows to evaluate effectiveness by determining and communicating what reports are available through different departments.
Assists Manager, Technical Data with projects and assumes all workgroup job responsibilities during Manager’s absence
        Assists on special projects and performs additional duties as assigned 




Education:High School diploma; College Degree preferredExperience: Prior experience in accessing, reporting, and analyzing data and informationSpecific Licenses and/or Certifications:N/ASpecialized Knowledge, Skill, and Abilities*:Excellent computer data reporting skills, including Excel
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Fast learner who exhibits creativity and flexibility
Strong interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
Excellent time management skills
Work Environment:OfficePhysical Demands: (if applicable)Sedentary work: involves sitting majority of the time, may lift up to 10 lbs

title: Performance and Data Manager
desc:
DIVISION PROFILE Community Based Initiatives (CBI) is a division of BakerRipley that builds on the unique economic and social assets of individuals and their neighborhoods, moving them to self-sufficiency and an improved quality of life. Largely supported by private philanthropic investment, our community-based programs engage and connect individuals to the resources that meet their emerging needs and aspirations. We provide a continuum of services including free tax preparation, family health and education, immigration and citizenship services, financial assistance and programs for youth and seniors.JOB DESCRIPTIONJOB SUMMARY: The CBI division is committed to effective and comprehensive reporting mechanisms that will showcase the transformative work we do in the communities we serve. The Performance and Data Manager is a key member of the Performance Management team responsible for creating a culture of accountability and data driven decisions. This position will be responsible for the collection, management, and integrity of CBI data across programs and services.CORE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Data ManagementAssist with the ongoing maintenance and improvements of database management system
Manage the data mining and data analysis of all data related to CBI outputs and outcomes
Conduct quality assurance checks on data; request corrections and edits as needed
Coordinate and facilitate staff technical trainings and assistance, and provide support, instruction, and guidance for data entry
Report ManagementLead annual United Way reporting process
Create reports as needed for internal and external audiences, including funders, agency leadership, and program staff
Oversee the year-round collection and submission of all CBI surveys and pre/post tests
Prepare monthly accountability reports and quarterly program performance reports
Data AnalysisServe as member of the division Continuous Quality improvement team; make recommendations for improvements to program operations or service delivery based on analysis of data
Prepare assessments of individual programs' effectiveness and results
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLSMINIMUM EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in related field required, preferably computer scienceYEARS OF EXPERIENCE: Minimum 3 years of experience in data analysis required.SKILLS:Excellent logical and analytical skills
Strong communication skills, oral and written
Understanding of mathematical concepts such as percentages, fractions, addition, and subtraction
Working knowledge of database systems and reporting tools, such as Crystal and SQL reports
Works well in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities
COMPUTER PROFICIENCY: Advanced Microsoft Excel and AccessLANGUAGE REQUIREMENTS: English, written and oral

title: Quality and Data Management Coordinator
desc:
Quality and Data Management Coordinator

LONG ISLAND ASSOCIATION FOR AIDS CARE, INC

QUALITY AND DATA MANAGEMENT COORDINATOR

BASIC FUNCTION
To provide administrative support to the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Program Officer.
 SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIESProvide administrative support to the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Program Officer's day to day activities and programmatic oversight of Health Home, Mobile Outreach, Client Services and Prevention Education.

Manage contracts, work plans, and related objectives pertaining to federally funded initiatives.

Organize all grant information, files, and flowcharts to manage all grants and grant proposal information.

Organize and maintain CFA work plans, contracts, reports, amendments, updates, revisions, and related materials.

Coordinate, compile, and edit program-related grant applications, proposals, and related reports to current and potential funders. Ensure all information is sent out before the due date and confirm the arrival of each delivery to current and potential funders.

Coordinate the continuation of funding for any and all new contracts pertaining to the program departments.

Conduct data entry and related activities to ensure data integrity.

Maintain and coordinate calendar of appointments for the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Program Officer, including daily appointments, supervisions, meetings, conference calls, business trips, conferences, job interviews, etc.

Create and maintain files for the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Program Officer. Compose (as required) and type correspondence, reports, and memoranda as needed.

Serve as back up for the Executive Assistant, when needed.

In the absence of the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Program Officerr, screen telephone calls, e-mails and correspondence for issues that need follow-up.

Work with the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Program Officer and the Director of Grants Management on scheduling program audits to provide quality assurance monitoring for agency programs.

Schedule and take minutes at focus groups with clients to ascertain their perspectives, opinions, and experiences with respect to the services they receive.

Maintain and update as necessary ongoing evaluation tools, tracking and monitoring systems.

Work with the Director of Grants Management on the scheduling of agency meetings such as: Quality Management Committee. Take minutes of meetings as assigned.

Provide additional coverage for reception and switchboard when necessary.
Other duties as assigned.

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIP
Report to the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Program Officer



Quality and Data Management Coordinator
QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's Degree preferred.

May be substituted by three years' administrative experience.

Business school certificate is preferred.

Two (2) years experience in an administrative support staff position required.

Word processing, programming, and data base management essential.

Knowledge of EXCEL preferred.

title: Data Engineer
desc:
Overview
Based in Utah, Idaho, and Arizona, Progrexion leads the credit repair industry with groundbreaking technologies and services that help consumers access and understand information contained in their credit reports, verify whether that information is fair, accurate and substantiated, and correct inaccuracies with individual creditors, other data furnishers and the national credit bureaus.  Progrexion technology and services are used by Lexington Law, an independently-operated law firm, and CreditRepair.com, its wholly-owned subsidiary.The Customer Experience Group is looking for an outstanding Data Engineer to join its growing analytics team. This individual will play a central role in one of our organization’s most highly visible divisions, helping pull insights from the data warehouse to guide strategic decisions of c-level executives and shape the way that we serve our customers.The Data Engineer will work closely with the Director of Analytics to clean, create, and evaluate data related to key business questions. To this end, most of your time will be spent working within SQL Server and MySQL databases. You will be involved in supporting the wide range of analyses carried out by our group using every available tool, from machine learning techniques like support vector machines and random forests to simple t-tests and power analyses.

Responsibilities

Ensure data quality and availability for ongoing analytics projects through stable ETL processes.
Develop and maintain a query library to support recurring data requests.
Carry out ad-hoc data extracts and analyses as needed.
Help design and deliver long-term analytics projects.

Qualifications

3-5 years of experience as data engineer / BI developer or an advanced degree (MS, MBA, PhD) in a related field.
Fluent in at least one language related to data management, preferably SQL, or basic computing such as C++, Java, or Python.
Attention to detail and overarching curiosity are both essential.
Willingness to learn new techniques and programming languages.
Responsible and reliable; able to set and meet deadlines.
Fluent in English

title: Senior Associate Human Resources Data Analysis
