title: Asset Management, Machine Learning Engineer, Associate
desc:
Job description
                    
Business Area Description:
J.P. Morgan Asset Management (AM) is a leading asset manager for individuals, advisors and institutions. As one of the largest asset and wealth managers in the world, we provide global market insights and a range of investment capabilities that few other firms can match.

The AM Architecture organization provides Technology and Architecture support covering the following areas.




·Architecture & Strategy
·Application Security


·Technical Consultation
·Drive Innovation

The Architecture group develops toolkits and architecture patterns, provides specific guidance and recommendations, and establishes architectural standards and practices, designed to improve the quality and resiliency of the applications we build or acquire from 3rd-parties. The team works closely with stakeholders on various teams including: Application Development, Technology Control Office, Infrastructure, Application Service Delivery, and Audit to ensure technology are managed effectively and efficiently. 


Job Description:
This Machine Learning Engineer role is aligned to the Asset Management line of business. The role will drive the adoption of Machine Learning on different technology portfolios and processes across Asset Management. As a Machine Learning engineer, you are at the forefront of advancing our core artificial intelligence efforts, building solutions powered by big data architecture, state of the art machine learning, and cloud native microservices architecture. The role will report to the technology architecture team, and work closely with technology control office and application development teams to execute the vision of enhancing the line of business with various machine learning solutions.

Responsibilities:

Apply appropriate machine learning techniques to new or existing business problems for Asset Management line of business.
Knowledge representation, articulation and visualization
Drive consistency in standards, best practices, reusable application building blocks.
Derive the strategic target state as well as transition states to deliver in agile fashion.
Conduct periodic engagement and knowledge sharing forums with technology teams and various SMEs about the best practices and trends of machine learning technologies
Participate in technology strategy discussions to understand future technology drivers, machine learning frameworks and engage corporate teams to deliver appropriate solutions to address potential gaps.

University degree in Mathematics, Engineering, or related disciplines.
Strong coding skill in Python/Java/Scala.
Knowledge of Classification, Regression, Clustering, Cross Validation and Optimization
Hands-on experience on machine learning frameworks such as Keras, Tensorflow or Theano will be an advantage.
Experience in applying machine learning technologies in real-life business projects is highly desirable.
Familiar with Agile development and Continuous Integration and Delivery using tools Git, JIRA, Sonar and Jenkins is a definite plus.
Ability to work both independently as well as collaborating in a team environment utilizing Agile as the software development practice.
Hands-on experience on private/public cloud (e.g. Cloud Foundry / AWS), microservices architecture, DevOps is a definite advantage
Excellent communication skills to articulate complex concept into layman terms to the business.
Good Influencing skills, with demonstrable ability to debate issues, stand firm on principles yet remain sensitive to business/technology drivers.
Highly motivated, comfortable taking the initiative and able to work collaboratively.
J.P. Morgan is a place for talented people from all backgrounds and perspectives because our clients come from all backgrounds and perspectives. We encourage a culture of inclusion, where everyone's opinion counts and all employees have the freedom to deliver their absolute best. This is why we work hard and invest in attracting and developing a diverse workforce. Learn more about our Business Resource Groups in how they help our employees build successful careers and reach their greatest potential.

title: Data Scientist (e-Commerce/ Machine Learning/ Python/ Zalon)
desc:
Job description
                    
Zalon is the successful story of curated shopping experience, part of Zalando SE. Being part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent data and software engineering.As a Senior Data Scientist at Zalon, you will be at the heart of business, data and technology; your work having an immediate impact on customer satisfaction and company profitability.As part of our empowering technology culture - Radically Agile - you will have the autonomy to develop innovative and complex algorithms for novel use-cases from scratch, while leveraging our rich data, spread across a large range of topics. From data exploration and model building, to algorithm implementation or data engineering, you will have our trust to choose the optimal approach to solve problems. Our wide range of topics to touch upon include several different areas of machine learning and statistics, such as ranking algorithms, supervised and unsupervised learning, Bayesian inference, and any approach that will help you shine in your role. WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
A degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.).
+4 years experience in the analysis of real data with the tools of Machine Learning.
Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analysing and modelling data sets and an interest in statistics.
Ideally, at least three years of professional / academic programming experience in an object-oriented language, Python or Scala.
Willingness to work with microservices architecture, distributed systems and RESTful APIs.
Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services.
Effective communication skills, ability to understand business requirements and an interest in being a touch point for product, software development and commercial.
Deep scepticism, plus the ability to identify and debunk buzzwords, false assumptions and analysis.
English language fluency.
YOUR ROLE
Research, design, and implement algorithms to improve our various machine learning driven systems.
Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability.
Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis, to testing and deployment.
Play a critical role in the team as a creative input, working on key results. Your role will span over a number of various topics; therefore, a curious nature would be advantageous.
Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders.
Think in an abstract manner and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.
Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update research direction according to business goals and constraints.
Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery.
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM USCommunity. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5 year old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.

title: Senior Data Scientist => Paid Relocation to Amsterdam <=
desc:
Job description
                    
Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to translate business needs into tangible data science projects. You will be hands on and act as a thought leader in a particular domain of expertise. You’ll also mentor new and more junior co-workers on the skills they need to build successful careers at Booking.com. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business strategist, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.
The Data Scientists at Booking.com support all areas of our business: Customer Service, Accommodation Partners, Front End, Security… Even our newer products like Booking Home and Business Bookers. Your challenge will be utilizing our petabyte scale data to support business decisions and improve our products. Joining a cross functional team of developers, designers, and product owners, we invite you to help us crunch the data to ensure our place as the planet’s #1 accommodation site.
B.responsible
Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights.  
Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.
Ability to see beyond the numbers – be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.
Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.
Challenge ideas and methods while working with talented, highly skilled team members.
Contribute to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, mentoring and being the external ambassador of Booking.com
B.skilled
Minimum 5 years of experience in a relevant role
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.)
An all around data scientist: strong statistics background, experience in algorithm programming, experimentation, data visualization, machine learning, optimization and big data
Experience applying Data Science to commercial problems.
Experience collaborating cross functionally (i.e. Developers, UX Experts, Product Owners, etc.)
Strong working knowledge of Python, Hadoop, SQL, R or similar technologies.
Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all stakeholder levels
Interest and experience in coaching, mentoring and technical leadership
For this position we also require strong expertise in applying at least one of the following fields or problem domains:
Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Speech Recognition, Computer Vision, Recommender Systems, Information Retrieval, Game Theory, Econometrics, Operations Research, Causal Inference / Experimentation, Forecasting, or another area of your choice that you think will help us to give our customers the best experience in the world!
B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.
This position is open to worldwide candidates and, in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.

title: Manager, Episode Analytics
desc:
Job description
                    
Remedy Partners is seeking an experienced Manager, Episode Analytics to conduct detailed analyses of data from our payer and provider partners, to improve healthcare quality, enhance the patient experience, and reduce Medicare spending.   
Why this role?
The role will work directly with the Director, Episode Analytics to aide in developing a first-rate team and infrastructure that can develop and implement superior bundled payment performance measurement and support analytic needs for all Remedy stakeholders, (i.e., provider partners, government partners, internal Remedy users, etc.).
Major areas of analytical and operational focus include: development and refinement of bundle definitions, bundle pricing methods and models, clinical data analysis

Are you right for this job?
We are looking for someone with: 
B.S. or higher in the fields of statistics, applied mathematics, actuarial science, or related field.
Demonstrated experience applying a data science skill set (i.e., data management, data analysis, data visualization) to industry specific problems, prior health care analytics experience is a plus
Experience using a programming language such as Python or a statistical programming language (SAS, SPSS, Stata or R) is desired; Experience with more than one language including proficiency with software development technologies (e.g. Python, Java, C/C++, .Net) 
Experience with collaboration tools and version control systems (e.g. Git).
Experience working with database languages such as SQL or MySQL
Innovative and strong analytical and algorithmic problem solving. Experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches (e.g. Bayesian Analysis and Multi-scale Feature Identification is a plus);
Excellent critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present your beliefs clearly and compellingly verbally and in written form, particularly the ability to convey technical information in an accessible and understandable manner.
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-­‐technical audiences
What will you do?
Solve technical data-driven healthcare problems using computer science, mathematical, predictive modeling and statistical methods and knowledge.
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for model development, model validation, model implementation and large scale data analysis.
Develop metrics and prototypes that can be used to drive business decisions.
Maintenance of data systems including administrative claims data from Medicare, clinical data from partner providers, and care management data from our staff
Regular processing of large scale claims data and episode construction that conforms with established rules

title: Senior Data Scientist (Python, Java, SQL & Spark)
desc:
Job description
                    
You Are Ready To Make An Impact
Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. As a Senior Data Scientist at Zalando adtech lab, you will be part of a cross-functional team of Data and Software Engineers with the aim to develop machine learning methods to better understand customer behavior in the e-commerce field.
We live Radical Agility, a software development methodology that allows you to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles – Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose – we entrust you to be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.
Zalando’s adtech lab spearheads our data-driven media buying efforts with a focus on fashion-oriented buying strategies for accurate and relevant consumer targeting. Machine learning, high-level database modeling, metrics definition, trend analysis and report generation are crucial to our business. We are Zalando’s ad-technology forge and an integral contributor to Zalando Media Solutions.
You Are Setting Standards
Ownership. You will work cross-functionally with other Data Scientists and Engineers bringing prototypical research work to production.
Variety. You and your team will work on gathering data to analyze, understand and extract knowledge from textual data and media to deliver fashion trend insights to our consumers.
Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality. You will add value by leveraging and setting new trends in Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Natural Language Processing to extract fashion trends and insights.
You Are Skilled
Experience. Strong understanding of working with statistics and cutting-edge machine learning algorithms in a Big Data environment. A scientific background with computational skills is a plus.
Methodologies. Hands-on experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning or related field and their application to real products.
Big Data. Delivering scalable real-world data science solutions. Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analyzing and modeling large data sets. Closely collaborate with Software Developers, Product Managers and other Data Scientists.
Technologies. Understanding of Java, Python, R or SQL are a plus.
You Are Offered
Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and feedback, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos. A dynamic, international team where collaboration is the core mindset.
Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.de and discounts from external partners.
Development. Extensive onboarding, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.
Technologies. Opportunity to work with a range of different and cutting-edge technologies such as Cuda, GPU accelerated ML, TensorFlow, Spark, Python
Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!
If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Georg Petersen.

title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer, Consumer Hardware Startup
desc:
Job description
                    
Sense is building hardware and mobile apps to help people analyze their home energy consumption, see what is going on in their homes, and ultimately reduce their energy footprint -- all powered by cutting-edge machine learning technology that can tell which appliances are on in your house and how much power they're using, in real time.
We are looking for Machine Learning Engineers/Data Scientists to join our team. The ideal Engineer/Scientist will mine energy data, design algorithms, and develop models which improve Sense's automated disaggregation platform. The right person for this role will enjoy diving into messy time-series, designing high-performance models, and developing robust code that scales on live data.
Why we think you will love working with us:
Be a part of building something that will make a difference in the world
Have a big impact at an early-stage, VC-backed consumer startup
Work with a small team of experienced entrepreneurs creating revolutionary technology
Competitive compensation, benefits, and a great office in Central Square
Skills & Requirements
Degree in computer science, machine learning, statistics & applied math, engineering (especially electrical engineering), physics, or similar field. Masters or PhD degree a plus.
Excellent understanding of signal processing, time-series and frequency analysis, algorithms, and data structures
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Experience with software development in C/C++ or Python
Experience with diving into data, finding insights, and presenting them
Comfortable working in a team and individually
Eager to work in a young, fast-paced, and exciting startup

title: Data Scientists wanted!
desc:
Job description
                    
The Data Science Consultant (DSC) works directly with clients and project teams, providing essential insight and leverage on problems where data science expertise is essential.  S/he works to understand, describe and manage the lifecycle of analytics on a project from start to finish.  While deeply involved with the technical solution, a DSC works equally on the execution, communication and delivery of a client project, often acting as the team’s de facto tech lead.
As DSCs progress professionally, they tend towards greater depth in both data scientific principles and skills as well as domain-specific expertise, ‘majoring’ in a subset of industries and becoming increasingly recognized as pivotal individuals in pushing forward the frontier of our capabilities to crack increasingly broad problems – and, in doing so, to shape the evolution of the firm and the industries it serves.
DSCs thus develop the expertise to know which quantitative problems are the most valuable in a certain industry, to understand which features and model structures are best suited to solving them, and to know how to tune such solutions in light of industry specific requirements and ecosystems.  Ultimately, DSCs thus act as a crucial engine of progress, designing and maintaining assets and problem solving platforms.
Skills & Requirements
Technical background in computer science, data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistics or other quantitative and computational science
Professional experience building and delivering data science and statistics based solutions and products, with an emphasis on creating measurable results and lasting impact
Demonstrated ability to deliver technical projects with a team, often working under tight time constraints to deliver value
An ‘engineering’ mindset, willing to make rapid, pragmatic decisions to improve performance, accelerate progress or magnify impact; recognizing that the ‘good’ is not the enemy of the ‘perfect’
Direct, hands-on experience managing the process of building a model, incorporating features, tuning performance, and deploying into production
Knowing how and when to make trade-offs between incremental accuracy and exception-free performance
An ability to communicate the solution, its parameters, its assumptions and its inner workings to heterogeneous audiences, who vary widely in their levels of technical fluency and seniority
Comfort with working with distributed teams on code-based deliverables, using version control systems and code reviews

Solid and battle-tested understanding of the standard canon of machine learning practices, including but not limited to:
Linear and Logistic Regression
Decision Tree classification and regression
Neural Networks
Dimensionality Reduction
Clustering
Bagging, Boosting, and other non-parametric methods

Demonstrated expertise working with and maintaining open source data analysis platforms, including but not limited to:
Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib, TensorFlow, Jupyter and other Python data tools
Spark, HDFS, Kafka and other high volume data tools
SQL and NoSQL storage tools, such as MySQL, Postgres, Cassandra, MongoDB and ElasticSearch

title: Data Science Solutions Tier II Support Professional
desc:

As a member of the Data Science Solutions Support team, you will be responsible for the implementation and operational support of Experian DSS Customer Solutions in our managed hosting environment and in customer hosted solutions.  Employees in this role primarily support and maintain the application servers our customers use within their solutions.  This is a hands-on position that will require directly interacting with customers and other internal teams performing system analysis, build deployment and automation, solution design, system configuration maintenance activities.  The successful candidate is a senior level resource and will possess a solid understanding of enterprise environments including VMware virtualization and be able to troubleshoot and resolve software, hardware, configuration and operational problems across the VMware, Wintel, x86‑64 Linux platforms. Knowledge of multiple vendor technologies and platforms including VMware, Microsoft Windows, MS SQL Server, Linux variants (SLES11, RHEL6/7) and SQL queries and supporting Java as well as scripting languages such as Powershell or batch are required. Candidates should be team players with excellent communication skills and have the ability to manage assignments independently.

title: Fast-Growing Startup looking for a Mixpanel / Google Analytics Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.
We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.
Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.
About our company
We are an ambitious team of around 25 people, covering 14 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world. After closing a strategic partnership in Japan we are quickly building out our team.
Having recently raised a total of $10+MM from private and strategic corporate investors, we have plenty of fuel in the tank to build out our product, our team and to fund our global expansion.
To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.
At Creatubbles, you will be helping to build a product that serves not only the future of the world, but the parents and the teachers that guide them as well.
Personality-wise, you should:

Have the self-discipline to roll with a fully-remote team. You are responsible for keeping yourself focused, motivated, effective, without the social reinforcement that comes from working together in a physically co-located office.


Do what works, and not get caught up chasing after the latest trends. Keeping an eye on the future is great, but not at the expense of getting work done in the present.


Do the right thing, even when it's hard. We don't cut corners or do a sloppy job, even when there is a lot of pressure because somebody is in a hurry.


Collaborate by default. You have no problem showing in-progress work, or asking for help whenever you get stuck.


Express disagreement, but be able to accept a decision made by the product manager or engineering director and work productively towards executing that decision.


Leave work stuff at work, and home stuff at home.


Be kind and considerate. Our culture focuses on helping people fix mistakes and learn from them, rather than playing "pin the tail on the scapegoat".

On the skills front, you:

Are comfortable remotely pairing up with engineers and looking through code, both in order to understand how our tracking and analytics currently work, and to help teach engineers what they need to know to support you.


Know Mixpanel, Google Analytics, and other analytics tools like Katniss Everdeen knows archery.


Can craft reports, including appropriate visualizations, to convey not just the raw numbers, but the meaning behind them and their relevance to our mission.


Communicate effectively with people coming from very different backgrounds: marketers, engineers, account managers, designers, product managers, executives, etc.


Know how to use Google, Slack, StackOverflow, Quora, smoke signals, or any other channel to get the answers you need when you get stuck.

Bonus points are awarded for:

An academic background in statistics or a related fuzzy-math field (computational biology, quantum physics, tax accounting, etc.)


Software engineering experience, especially with a team that practices Extreme Programming (XP).


Giving talks, writing articles, and other contributions to your professional community.

title: Revenue Modeling & Data Science Lead
desc:
Job description
                    
Requisition: R0018108ORGANIZATION: StubHub
StubHub connects people through inspiring event experiences. We connect fans with their favorite teams, shows and artists and introduce them to the ones they will love next. As the largest ticket marketplace in the world, we enable fans to buy and sell tickets to tens of thousands of events, whenever they want, through our desktop and mobile experiences, including our StubHub app for iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch and Android.  For more information on StubHub, visitStubHub.com or follow @StubHub on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram or YouTube.com/StubHub.
StubHub is seeking an Operations Research practitioner to design, develop and implement a Revenue Optimization program that leverages econometrics and other core Revenue Mangement principles to drive increased sales at profitable margins. This person will be responsible for building StubHub’s pricing models and partnering with other members of the Revenue Optimization & Growth team to deliver results at scale. This person will also work cross-functionally with business GMs, product & tech, finance and senior leadership to achieve KPIs.  This position will be based in our SF headquarters.PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Design and develop Revenue Management strategies and tactics to maximize key business objectives
	Lead a team of Revenue Modeling & Data Science resources in Revenue Management best practices and industry-standard techniques.
	Collaborate with fellow Revenue Optimization & Growth team members to provide holistic insights and recommendations for managing top-line growth and operating income
	Partner with senior executives & cross-functional colleagues to ensure pricing tactics balance growth with profitability
	Provide data-driven insight and strategic recommendations for all pricing, promotion and growthdrivin business opportunities
	Partner with Business Development and Corporate Strategy resources to help inform the evaluation of partnership and affiliate deals
	Provide thought leadership and strategic guidance on all revenue-related initiatives including revenueshar and fee-based solutions
	Partner with the Revenue Portfolio Management team to proactively identify options to North America GMs to manage their P&L
	Identify new opportunities for growth based on insights from other industries relevant to StubHub’s business
EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

5-7+ years of demonstrated experience building revenue management models and pricing frameworks.
	Experience solving revenue-related business problems using stochastic, heuristic or deterministic methodologies using R, SAS or other similar analytical tools
	Deep understanding of Revenue Management principles including but not limited to statistical segmentation, data normalization, market response modeling and price optimization.
	Demonstrated ability to measure price sensitivity and build pricing frameworks to capture additional volume while maintaining healthy profitability.
	Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to understand and evaluate business constraints to ensure models and pricing frameworks are operationally executable.
	Collaborative personality with the ability to build relationships both within the team and across the organization to drive results.
	Master’s in Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or other applied mathematical discipline required, Doctorate preferred.

title: Solutions Architect, AdTech Platform
desc:
Job description
                    
Looking for an opportunity to actually use the knowledge and problem solving creativity you spent years acquiring? Take a look at Catalina. We are seeking candidates who want to join the Agency/Ad Platform team focused on building integrated, scalable systems that integrate across multiple sources.
We are seeking an experienced solutions architect to join our AdTech team. The ideal candidate will use their AdTech and Video expertise to design innovative solutions to create significant value while owning the architecture of the end to end platform. Working directly with Product solutions, the Solutions Architect is a role of critical importance and the candidate should thrive in a fast paced environment globally across multiple teams. Take a second look at Catalina. Self-managing teams, open workspaces, collaboration – you’ll get it all in this fast-paced environment where technology is not an afterthought, but has been a key part of our strategic direction for 30+ years… and we are just getting started. All that is missing is you!
What You’ll Do:
There are certainly some benefits to working on a system that has a handful of users in the same building as the engineering team. However, if you really want your skills as a software engineer to be challenged, consider working on products that are touching real consumers in the real world. You’ll get that on Catalina’s Platform engineering team, where you’ll be working on distributed, highly available cloud applications that interact with millions of consumers every day around the world to deliver personalized marketing content.
What you’ve done:
10+ years of experience working in a technical customer facing Solutions Architect role at an AdTech company designing high availability and scalability solutions
Deep technical understanding of the AdTech industry and technologies
3+ years working with a DSP or DSP adoptions
Comfort traversing the whole stack: client-side through the persistence layer
Experience designing, architecting, implementing and/or operating within a cloud platform (Amazon, Azure, etc..)
Experience with DoubleClick, AdWords, Google Analytics or similar platforms
Understanding of search marketing, ad serving platforms and API development/management
Experience in automation (Puppet, Chef, Vagrant)
Experience with In-Memory Caching, Queues, Protocols, SOLR, Avro, Protocol Buffers, Thrift
Experience with terabytes of information on big data (hadoop, hbase, hive) for aggregation and rollup
What You’ll Bring:
A passion for building software and delivering technology for business.  If you are looking for an average 9 to 5 job, this might not be the one for you.
Commitment to quality over quantity.  When consumers are your end-user, you can’t afford to launch with issues.
A desire to collaborate, more often than not.  You won’t spend much time in isolation here at Catalina.
An ability to create streamlined applications that perform under load.  Our systems have less than a second to respond or revenue is lost.
A good working knowledge of Agile software engineering processes.  Bonus points if you have helped another organization make the transition.
Clear communication skills.  We are looking for someone who is comfortable talking to peers about a design solution on the same day they are explaining a new technology to an executive.
A desire to focus on results, less on non-value activities.  As a lean IT professional on the team, you’ll have goals to meet, and the freedom to meet those goals in the most effective manner possible.
Nice to have in your bag of tricks (not required, but let us know):
Community developer presence (github, apache, open source projects, etc..)
Scalable Microservice design experience
TDD/BDD expert

title: Senior Customer Solutions Architect | Data Science Platform
desc:
Job description
                    
About us
Contiamo is a VC backed, fast-growing B2B software company based in Berlin. We offer a flexible data platform enabling businesses to create interactive, data-driven decision tools and automations. Our international customers range from big corporations to ambitious startups. To expand our sales team and accelerate our growth, we’re looking for a Customer Solution Architect.
As our Solution Architect, you work closely with the sales team as their technical partner in all phases of the sales process – from evangelizing and demonstrating the technology to prospects, to defining and executing proof of concepts and answering any technical questions around Contiamo and how it solves the client’s data challenges.
Your responsibilities

Partner with sales to translate Contiamo’s capabilities to a solution for the customer’s specific challenges


Establish technical credibility and build relationships with key business and technical contact partner on the customer side


Present solution proposals to executive-level customers in a clear and compelling way


Work closely with the product team on delivering POCs for key accounts


Be our customer's voice to the product team and ensure that what we build will solve our customer's most challenging problems


Work closely with marketing on thought leadership content

Your background

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Informatics (or equivalent education or work experience)


Strong BI/Analytics background with experience in solutions design and delivery


Excellent communication skills and understanding of enterprise sales processes


Experience presenting to and achieving buy-in from senior executives in an enterprise B2B context


Experience in defining and executing proof of concepts


Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, analytical and development skills


Background in vertical industries such as retail, telecommunications or media is a plus


Ability to quickly understand the specifics of different industries


Willingness to travel up to 30% of the time

Our benefits

Competitive salary


Professional development budget for books, conferences etc.


Custom workstation incl. a fully height-adjustable desk


Weekly team lunch


Flexible working hours


Drinks and fresh fruits


Free public transportation


Full relocation support incl. visa sponsorship

Interested? Get in touch with Lucia, we’re looking forward to get to know you.

title: Product Engineer - Machine Learning
desc:
Job description
                    
At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to real time Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.
Machine Learning at Elastic
With the recent release of Machine Learning (ML) for the Elastic Stack, we now have a fully dedicated Machine Learning team in house. Our goal is to further expand our capabilities in developing technologies that allow users to better understand the behavior of their data. Our team has developed an unsupervised machine learning engine that can plow through large amounts of data and automatically find those insights our users today have been proactively finding using search. Current use cases include finding anomalies within transactions / operational metrics, detecting uncharacteristic user behavior, finding a population of attacking IP addresses but we are looking forward to expanding our capabilities to many more in the future. And in order to get there, our team is looking to hire an extraordinary individual with a multi-disciplinary skill set to join them. This is an amazing opportunity to join a small, highly experienced team where you can make an immediate impact and contribution to the core of our new machine learning offering.
Your Role
As a member of the ML team within Elastic you are responsible for the full life-cycle development of packaged use-cases. These are domain specific sets of analysis configurations that are released as part of ML.
You will turn data into valuable business insights that will show the practical applications of machine learning techniques. Your tasks will be dynamic, and will include running the end-to-end process from idea to packaged use-case, prioritising work based on business value, performing analysis on large and complex datasets, working with the engineering team to identify enhancements to feature detection, testing, and presenting findings effectively and clearly to various audiences.
To succeed in this role, you will have a deep understanding of statistics and be motivated by a genuine interest in understanding and exploring data. You are able to interpret customer requirements and map these to deliver real business value. You think on your feet and find innovative ways to showcase machine learning techniques. Our ideal colleague strives to seek answers to questions about data that the customer has both asked for, or didn’t yet know they needed.
Typical projects you will be involved in will include
Extracting valuable insight from real-world datasets. For example,
Understanding customer use cases
Transforming customer data
Analysing customer data using the Elastic Stack and/or other statistical tools
Examining mathematical models and results
Summarise dataset and valuable insights extracted from these.
Data extract, transform and load activity on large datasets
Generate test data sets for validating analytical functions and methods
Support engineers in development of big data anomaly detection analytic systems
Your Background
BS, MS or PhD in a numerate discipline such as Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Neuroscience, Machine Learning or similar
Solid practical experience (3+ years) working in a role requiring data analysis
Demonstrated ability to create business focussed use cases
Shown experience working with large data sets; analyze, explore and interpret results, present conclusions to peers
Experience with statistical packages and tools (e.g. R, Octave, MATLAB, SAS etc)
Experience with scripting languages (e.g. Python, Unix Shell scripts, Perl, Ruby, etc)
Experience with NoSQL or relational databases
Experience collaborating with software teams
Ability to work on a distributed team: work in a structured focused manner and document data and results effectively
Able to work collaboratively, good communication skills, personable
Knowledge, interest and a real passion for topics in big data, machine learning, data mining and statistical analysis
Additional Information
Competitive pay and benefits
Stock options
Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
Passionate people building great products
Employees with a wide variety of interests
Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 19 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)
Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

title: Senior Product Manager
desc:
Job description
                    
We’re looking for a user-experience oriented Senior Product Manager with deep customer focus and a proven track record for researching and determining internal and external customer needs.
You’ll be the first true product hire to join our friendly, mission-driven team, and you’ll have a huge hand in building and shaping our design and product culture. You’ll be instrumental in evolving the vision and roadmap, and you’ll work closely with key stakeholders across Engineering, Design, and Outreach to synthesize feedback, define product requirements, and prioritize bugs, features, and enhancements.
These are some of the challenges you’ll be involved in:
Freemium models: How do we restructure our product offerings to align with our business model in ways that immediately add value for our clients while simultaneously communicating the value of our paid premium tiers?
Rich analytic dashboards: We need to tell the right stories with data for our enterprise clients to effectively manage and grow their programs.
Simple and intuitive workflows: Successful usage of our consumer facing apps is measured by how quickly someone is able to get in and get out. How can we build a product that people depend on and enjoy using while removing all friction?
Data correlation: Things will start to get really interesting when we begin to dynamically correlate our data against other meaningful sets of data like academic records, social and emotional survey results, or fitness goals.
Tech debt: We’re a startup and we’ve been iterating over the past few years. How do we build necessary refactoring and large migrations into the roadmap to ensure our foundation stays strong?

                "Skills & requirements
                        
You’re a respectful and collaborative Product Manager with a track record of launching successful products/features into a production environment.
You have excellent analytic skills and understand the technical issues related to your products. You can speak intelligently with engineers about the pros and cons of different solutions, and you’re not afraid to learn something you don’t fully understand.
You have experience defining and managing the implementation of metrics and reporting that are key to monitoring your products.
You’re self motivated, enjoy autonomy, and have an entrepreneurial mindset.
Startup experience is highly valued, as is experience working within the data collection/visualization product category.
You want to help. Help build our company culture. Help a coworker understand the need for a change of course. Help us understand our customers better so we can all help them do their jobs better.

title: Software Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Responsibilities





The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation.  The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense.  The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes.  The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. The need to maintain our core Computer Science group is vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. The increased complexity of supporting NSA's mission requires world class researchers, programmers, and developers who operate in teams in areas such as software engineering, information technology infrastructure, high performance computing, data science, architectures, computer security, and networking in order to design and develop advanced tools, techniques, and systems.Given the pace of technologies and myriad of adversaries in the cyber realm and foreign nation state actors, Software Engineers at the NSA develop the technologies and abilities to maintain our advantage in both national defense and information gathering. Software Engineers help collect data, extract value, route and manage at scale, build user interfaces, protect our systems, and identify and develop support infrastructure as a service provider to the Agency and Intelligence Community. As a Software Engineer, your responsibilities can include: - creating applications that scale across an entire data center- identifying and retrieving the most important pieces of information out of 100s of petabytes of data- leveraging open source software- integrating off-the-shelf and government developed software- leading new advances in computer science and riding the bleeding edge of computing technologies: - microprocessor-based advances- beyond the horizon supercomputers- signals processing (including analog control)- user interfaces- deep learning- information security- the design and implementation of encryption- advanced algorithms





Skills





The ideal candidate is someone with excellent problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills who is able to:- work in a team environment to build software- handle multiple assignments- synthesize information to solve complex problems- apply knowledge data structures and algorithms to software engineering problems- develop, diagnose, and operate complex computer systems- identify customer needs and validate product design- deliver software that others WANT to use- deal with conflict within a team Knowledge and experience in one or more of the following is desired: - programming with a high-level language (e.g., C, C++, Java, python, ruby,) - building user facing services, middleware, and backend systems- Full-stack development- operating systems administration and advanced user functions, site reliability engineering- computer networking (e.g., communication protocols, distributed systems, , Internet of Things, real-time systems, routing and switching)- data spaces, data modeling, data analysis, storage design, and administration- information retrieval, machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistics and analytics- vulnerability analysis





Qualifications





Salary Range: $68,586 - $85,464 (Entry/Developmental)*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position. Entry is with a Bachelor's degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 2 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position.Degree must be in Computer Science (CS). Related fields (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics) may be considered relevant if the programs contain, at minimum, a concentration of courses in the following foundational CS areas: algorithms; computer architecture (not network architecture); programming methodologies and languages; data structures; logic and computation; and advanced mathematics (for example, calculus, discrete mathematics). Information Technology (IT) or Information Systems (IS) degrees may be considered relevant if the programs contain the amount and type of coursework equivalent to a CS major.Relevant experience must be in the software development process (i.e., requirements analysis, software design, implementation, testing, integration, deployment/installation, and maintenance) and programming.Salary Range:  $79,334 -$105,663 (Full Performance)*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position. Entry is with a Bachelor's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience or a Master's degree plus 1 year of relevant experience or a Doctoral degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 5 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position.Degree must be in Computer Science (CS). Related fields (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics) may be considered relevant if the programs contain, at minimum, a concentration of courses in the following foundational CS areas: algorithms; computer architecture (not network architecture); programming methodologies and languages; data structures; logic and computation; and advanced mathematics (for example, calculus, discrete mathematics). Information Technology (IT) or Information Systems (IS) degrees may be considered relevant if the programs contain the amount and type of coursework equivalent to a CS major.Relevant experience must be in the software development process (i.e., requirements analysis, software design, implementation, testing, integration, deployment/installation, and maintenance) and programming.





Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule





On-the job training, Internal NSA courses, and external training will be made available based on the need and experience of the selectee.

title: Computer Systems Researcher
desc:
Job description
                    
Responsibilities





The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation.  The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense.  The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes.  The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive  classified national security information. The need to maintain our core Computer Science group is vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. The increased complexity of supporting NSA's mission requires world class researchers, programmers, and developers who operate in teams in areas such as software engineering, reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, high performance computing, data science, architectures, computer security, and networking in order to design and develop advanced tools, techniques, and systems.Description of PositionComputer Scientists design, develop, deliver, and/or operate solutions to hard computer science problems within a scientific framework. The solutions may arise in the forms of forensics and attack attribution, protection of critical networks, active systems warnings and indicators, active penetration into target systems, knowledge discovery of passive and active systems, or other computer science mission support. Computer Scientists are hired into positions directly supporting a research office, technical mission office or the Computer Science Development Program (CDP). The CDP is a 3 year development program designed to produce professional level Computer Scientists through an intensive, structured program of formal training courses and diverse work assignments.  The purpose of the Computer Science Development Program (CDP) is to develop a network of computer science professionals prepared to discover, design, develop, deliver, and operate solutions to hard computer science problems throughout NSA. Highly qualified early career computer scientists are provided opportunities for career broadening assignments and systematic development of knowledge, skills, and experience necessary to excel in the computer science skill field at NSA. Successful graduates of the program are expected to be agents of change in the Agency's adaptation to rapidly emerging and evolving technology in its mission space and in its approach to information technology management.   As a Computer Scientist, other responsibilities may include:- using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions- applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications- developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities- designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems





Skills





The ideal candidate is someone with a desire for continual learning and strong problem-solving, analytic and interpersonal skills who is able to: - work in a team environment - communicate effectively - handle multiple assignments- synthesize information to solve complex problems-- apply knowledge data structures and algorithms to software engineering problems- develop, diagnose, and/or operate complex computer systemsSpecialized skills and experience in one or more of the following is required: - Programming (low level, high level, parallel)- Computer systems research- Simulation/model development and prototyping- Software engineering - Hardware engineering- Computational science- Algorithm analysis and design- Reverse engineering





Qualifications





Salary Range: $68,586 - $85,464 (Entry/Developmental)*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position. Entry is with a Bachelor's degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 2 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position.Degree must be in Computer Science (CS). Related fields (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics) may be considered relevant if the programs contain, at minimum, a concentration of courses in the following foundational CS areas: algorithms; computer architecture (not network architecture); programming methodologies and languages; data structures; logic and computation; and advanced mathematics (for example, calculus, discrete mathematics). Information Technology (IT) or Information Systems (IS) degrees may be considered relevant if the programs contain the amount and type of coursework equivalent to a CS major.Relevant experience must be in computer systems research; simulation/model development and prototyping; software design; programming; computational science; algorithm analysis and design; reverse engineering; and/or designing/developing computer or information systems, including engineering hardware and/or software.Salary Range: $79,334 - $105,663 (Full Performance)*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position. Entry is with a Bachelor's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience or a Master's degree plus 1 year of relevant experience or a Doctoral degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 5 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position.Degree must be in Computer Science (CS). Related fields (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics) may be considered relevant if the programs contain, at minimum, a concentration of courses in the following foundational CS areas: algorithms; computer architecture (not network architecture); programming methodologies and languages; data structures; logic and computation; and advanced mathematics (for example, calculus, discrete mathematics). Information Technology (IT) or Information Systems (IS) degrees may be considered relevant if the programs contain the amount and type of coursework equivalent to a CS major.Relevant experience must be in computer systems research; simulation/model development and prototyping; software design; programming; computational science; algorithm analysis and design; reverse engineering; and/or designing/developing computer or information systems, including engineering hardware and/or software.





Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule





On-the job training, Internal NSA courses, and external training will be made available based on the need and experience of the selectee.Monday - Friday, with basic 8hr/day work requirements between 0600 and 1800 (flexible).

title: Digital Network Exploitation Analyst - Entry/Mid-Level

title: Cryptanalytic Computer Scientist
desc:
Job description
                    
Responsibilities





The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation.  The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense.  The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes.  The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. The need to maintain our core Computer Science group is vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. The increased complexity of supporting NSA's mission requires world class researchers, programmers, and developers who operate in teams in areas such as software engineering, information technology infrastructure, high performance computing, data science, architectures, computer security, and networking in order to design and develop advanced tools, techniques, and systems.Description of PositionCryptanalytic Computer Scientists employ the hybrid skill-set of advanced computer science, electrical engineering and mathematics to ensure solutions to the most difficult cryptanalytic problems and take full advantage of the NSA's software and hardware capabilities.Cryptanalytic Computer Scientists are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office or the Cryptanalytic Computer Network Operations Development Program (C2DP). The NSA/CSS Cryptanalytic Computer Network Operations Development Program is a 3 year development program designed to produce professional level Cryptanalytic Computer Scientists through an intensive, structured program of formal training courses and diverse work assignments.  NSA's Computer Science field offers participation in a vast array of challenging projects, systems, networks and applications necessary to manipulate and analyze enormous volumes of data at staggering speeds. As a member of a technical mission office or the C2DP, Cryptanalytic Computer Scientists solve challenging cryptanalytic, high-performance computing, and computer network operations problems of critical importance to protecting the nation's interests in cyberspace. Other responsibilities may include:- using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions- applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications- developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities- designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems

title: Senior Systems Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
About the Position:
This is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly growing financial technology social impact business as a Senior Systems Engineer. You will play an important role in supporting and transforming the core technology of a leading alternative credit scoring SaaS product company. We are looking for a driven individual who has a passion for the art and science of DevOps, release management, security and production environments.
The Senior Systems Engineer will play a key role in supporting existing infrastructure and developing the strategy for our next generation efforts. This person will support and augment the current team, bridge the technologies between current and next, and help lead the strategy and implementation of new technologies. These improved tools, technologies, and processes will enable us to deliver our products and services more quickly, more safely, and more effectively.
Primary Responsibilities:
Infrastructure, Systems, and Deployments
Design and implement future state SaaS infrastructure.


Analyze a variety of approaches to a DevOps problem – provide pros and cons of different approaches to the team to arrive at an agreed upon direction.


Enable and implement future state continuous delivery and continuous integration.


Collaborate to incorporate automated unit, integration, functional, and performance testing into the continuous integration pipelines across multiple projects.


Collaborate with the Development, Project Management, and Product Management teams to align projects, releases, patches, and other efforts.


Evolve and automate our processes to provide increased flexibility related to the development and testing of multiple simultaneous projects.


Build and deploy the application level software in our development and test regions.


Maintain and migrate existing Jenkins+Ansible CI pipelines.

Monitoring & Security
Configure alerts, monitor systems, prioritize and troubleshoot development and test region issues.


Keep up-to-date with security patches and proactively address security vulnerabilities in EFL systems.

Management
Manage cloud hosting services and budget.


Create operations handbook and playbook as required for others to assist in the administration.


Manage remote junior DevOps engineer based in Jakarta, including providing regular feedback, semi-annual coaching, and fostering development.

Who’s a good fit?
The right candidate is competent, friendly, driven, and autonomous. They desire ownership of whole areas of responsibility, can define team goals based on company and group goals, and can manage and grow direct reports.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years previous experience in DevOps / Systems Engineer role


Experience with AWS


Experience with the Ansible configuration management tool


Experience with the Jenkins continuous integration system


Experience with VM and Docker containers


Experience deploying Django/python apps


Linux systems admin (Ubuntu preferred)


2+ years experience managing direct reports

Preferred Qualifications:
Puppet, Chef, Travis CI, Bamboo, TeamCity


Ubuntu, Zabbix, Debian packaging, Python, MySQL, MongoDB


Any level of proficiency in Spanish

What is it like to work at EFL?
We’re a group of motivated, smart people trying to tackle a big problem! Our team is driven to make a big social impact. As a fast-growing, innovative, company, our culture is entrepreneurial, progressive, fast-paced, and multicultural. With offices in Lima, Boston, Mexico City, Jakarta, Nairobi, and Bangalore we are truly a multinational.  You’ll gain significant exposure to the world of entrepreneurship, emerging market finance and big data, and enjoy an awesome annual company retreat in Peru! We encourage our staff to think of EFL not just as their employer, but also as their own company. Have an idea to do things better? Implement it. Want flexibility in your schedule? Enjoy it. Want to make an impact? Own it.
We Offer Some Great Perks:
Flexible work schedule and generous time off, paid sabbatical and parental leave


Down-to-earth, motivated, collaborative team!


Annual company retreat in Latin America


Opportunities for international travel

title: Frontend Web Developer
desc:
Job description
                    
Gigantum is building an open-source software platform to enable reproducible, collaborative, and extensible science. We are looking for a front end web developer who wants to help us create a simple, beautiful, and professional user interface for the platform.
Responsibilities include:
Contributing to the UI/UX while working closely with other developers and designers
Designing, writing, and testing production UI code using modern, interactive design standards
Investigating new and emerging libraries and frameworks
Participating in an agile development process while delivering product on deadlines
A high-five with one of the other team members, from time to time
We are looking for developers that have the following:
Experience with React and ES6
Experience with, or desire to learn Relay and GraphQL
Good understanding of Flux, Redux, or MVC
Familiarity with CSS preprocessors (Sass, Less or Stylus)
Experience with Webpack and Node
A solid understanding of design and testing
Expected hours: Full time, with brief periods of increased intensity around the dates of major deliverables. Flexible work schedule.
Interested? Send an email (and a resume) to jobs@gigantum.io.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Python)
desc:
Job description
                    
About the Position:
The Senior Software Engineer (Python) leads the design and development of new software and extensive software revisions. This individual reports directly to the Director of Product to plan the architecture and implementation of new products and features that will help EFL to accomplish its strategic goals.  Additionally, this position is responsible for managing and coaching a team of engineers.
Through their design, development and management efforts, the Senior Software Engineer's contributions play a major role in EFL’s success.
Primary Responsibilities:
Software Design and Development
Defines product requirements and creates high-level architectural specifications, ensuring that designs are feasible and functional, integrate with existing systems and platforms, and can be adapted easily to accommodate changing business needs.


Designs and builds companion SDKs and libraries to enable other developers to interact with core systems and frameworks.


Responsible for ensuring that all software is delivered free of security vulnerabilities, and that any security issues that are discovered are addressed in a timely manner.


Responsible for ensuring that all codebases maintain an appropriate level of automated test coverage.

Strategic Planning
Stays current on company strategic objectives to design systems that can be modified to meet future needs with minimal refactoring required.

Management
Manages one or more engineers, including providing regular feedback and coaching.


Provides consultation on complex projects and considered to be the top-level contributor/specialist.

Who’s a good fit?
We are looking for someone who is passionate about the quality of the products they design and build.  They enjoy digging into code (no matter how complex) to learn how it works, and they are driven to build the best solution to every problem.  The right candidate is a conceptual thinker, able to distill any complex problem into its essential elements and communicate them effectively.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years experience developing real-world B2B or B2C applications, including 3 or more years in a senior role.


5+ years experience with Python.


5+ years experience with MySQL.  Any other relational database (PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server) may be considered.


Experience building APIs and SDKs.


Experience with Git.


Strong verbal and written communication skills.


Exceptional attention to detail.


Plays well with others; able to actively participate in lively engineering debates; able to listen to, appreciate, and effectively critique peers’ opinions.


Fluency in English.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Java, JavaScript and other programming languages


Management experience.


Experience with MongoDB.


Android, AWS, Django and/or R development experience.


Experience designing web-based applications for devices with slow and/or unreliable internet connections.

What is it like to work at EFL?
We’re a group of motivated, smart people trying to tackle a big problem! Our team is driven to make a big social impact. As a fast-growing, innovative, company, our culture is entrepreneurial, progressive, fast-paced, and multicultural. With offices in Lima, Boston, Mexico City, Jakarta, Nairobi, and Bangalore we are truly a multinational.  You’ll gain significant exposure to the world of entrepreneurship, emerging market finance and big data, and enjoy an awesome annual company retreat in Peru! We encourage our staff to think of EFL not just as their employer, but also as their own company. Have an idea to do things better? Implement it. Want flexibility in your schedule? Enjoy it. Want to make an impact? Own it.
We Offer Some Great Perks:
Flexible work schedule and generous time off, paid sabbatical and parental leave


Down-to-earth, motivated, collaborative team!


Annual company retreat in Latin America


Opportunities for international travel

title: Software Engineer, Data Platform
desc:
Job description
                    
You are a backend engineer who will help build out the Cortico platform. Your role will be focused on core infrastructure, from devops through data pipelines and APIs. Typical day-to-day activities will include: evaluating and deploying new and emerging data-management technologies, coding at all levels of the data stack, and integrating the latest advances in machine-learning-based data analysis as developed by MIT Media Lab researchers. You will have access to the Media Lab to learn the latest methods home brewed at the lab.
Python is our go-to language because it offers good support for core use-cases of applied machine learning, API development, data pipelines, and devops tooling. We use elasticsearch for search and for text analytics, and evaluate other data-management technologies (Hadoop/Hive, Spark, PrestoDB) for inclusion in the platform as our requirements evolve. We appreciate AWS’s power and flexibility, if not all its warts, so we use AWS services extensively. Familiarity with all of these technologies is not required, but interest and willingness to learn certainly is.

title: Full Stack Scala Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Who We Are
We are a cross-section of engineers to architects with experience in everything from DevOps in a world of microservices to data analytics in a world of machine-learning and simulation modeling.  We’ve come together for a critical challenge of building an AI system to help companies navigate cybersecurity within, around and at their borders.
Whether it’s advanced data analytics, simulations, or deep learning, we factor in risk calculations and cyberdefense along with the occasional late-night Red Bull run :)
In the end, we’re having fun.  Come help us redistribute the future!
Who You Are
You develop Scala applications and services using tools such as Liftweb and Scala.js
You are an expert in Javascript with strong experience building responsive web applications
You are adaptive toward learning and applying new technologies as well as blending analytic and simulation modeling approaches for tackling problems
Your ideal day begins with breakfast and a discussion about state-of-the-art analytics tools to use in supporting ad hoc analysis for customer applications. In the afternoon, you have lunch people from Fractal’s man-made-peril insurance underwriting team. Thereafter, you contribute to key user interactions and interfaces for tools you are developing that will improve the ease of use of algorithms and data science tools. By the end of the day, you’ve learned some cool things about amazing technology and you’ve contributed in a meaningful way to making us all a little better at what we do.
Think you might be interested?This is all pretty high-level, obviously but if you’re curious to learn more or are already sure this is for you, then we look forward to receiving your application.
To learn more about Fractal Industries, visit http://www.fractalindustries.com

The Director of Engineering, reports to the VP of Engineering, is the steward of software development talent and engineering culture, and is responsible for the oversight, and mentorship of the US Human Digital Interfaces (HDI) team. This role will be responsible for identifying new talent, coordinating and conducting onboarding and training programs (such as Mobiquity’s Onramp program), as well as oversee resource management and ensure ongoing professional development opportunities for all engineers on the HDI team.  In addition this position works with the staffing team to match skills with project needs and oversee the deployment of resources to project assignments.  The key performance indicators for this role are measured in quality, velocity, unit cost, and overall customer satisfaction.

title: Technical Product Owner - SUPERCRUNCH by GfK
desc:
Job description
                    
HERE YOU ARE. Another day in the office. Time to wrap up and hit the traffic home. Remember how excited you were when you got that great job in this brilliant IT team? And now? We guess the job is ok, your colleagues are nice too, and the coffee breaks are timed to perfection. All in all, a comfortable gig. Of course, you're keeping an eye out for other roles. You're still ambitious. Still want to go places and try out new stuff. Looking for a fresh challenge. Something to get your teeth into.
At SUPERCRUNCH by GfK, Data Science driven by next level technology takes center stage. Not just a fuzzy business power talk Management hears and thinks, "Yeah, that sounds great, next topic". Everyone gets it, lives it, and breathes it. It's an agile start up within an established, global organisation – the best from both worlds!
More than 40 experts from 15 nations share the same vision: To develop best-in-class tech and analytics solutions addressing todays biggest marketing challenges. Why just be a number cruncher, if you could be a SUPERCRUNCHER!
With GfK's incredible global data landscape at our disposal, we might have an unfair advantage – not many players can say they collect granular sales data in more than 100 countries, or measure cross-media behavior using state-of-the-art technology for tens of thousands of consumers. Our other major USPs are our team and our values. Close, cross-functional collaboration of Data Scientists, IT Engineers, and Commercial experts is in our DNA. Our radically agile and dynamic startup setup enables everyone to learn at a fast pace, contribute to our solutions and get recognized for the hard work they do.
You'll be looked after by Stefanie and Ralph. Ralph is an outdoor enthusiast, music & food lover and Crossfitter who likes to think big and has a proven track record in pulling together, leading and developing exceptional international expert teams.  
Stefanie is a Set Theorist, philosopher and amateur linguist who loves to cycle and travel. She has spent most of her career managing cross functional teams and connecting the dots between different units to deliver relevant data products.                    
                "Skills & requirements
                        
Now we should add an endless list of what you will be expected to do, followed by another endless list of what experience, qualifications and skills you should possess, in order to be successful.
But we know: As an experienced Technical Product Owner with a strong background in data management, technology and agile methodologies you’ll know what is key to this role:
responsibility for the development and delivery of an analytical end-to-end software product that combines GfK data assets with state of the art Data Science as well as Big Data engineering,
connecting the dots between product managers, engineers, Data Scientists, UX experts and other important stakeholders during product development,
managing the translation of User needs into requirements for the development team,
managing the backlog, define meaningful product iterations and manage the implementation teams.
collaborating with people of different backgrounds and be interested in delivering automated software products that generate relevant insights from our valuable data assets.
We don't have to tell you how to do your job. You know that you've got what it takes to be a SUPERCRUNCHER.
Hit apply to find out more!
Hit apply to find out more or visit Supercrunch.io
