title: Senior Data Engineering
desc:
Job description
                    
Revinate is seeking an experienced Data Engineer/ETL specialist to join our data services team. From internal decision-making, to the core services we provide for our customers, data drives our business. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will make an immediate impact on our ability to collect, store, process, and analyze huge sets of data. The ideal candidate is hands-on with significant experience building and maintaining scalable data platforms, data services/APIs, and data science / BI tools.
Our capable and versatile team takes pride in ownership and our engineers are involved right from the start in the architecture and design process. Test-driven development, continuous deployment, pair programming, and a supportive environment are key priorities. Our microservice-based infrastructure includes tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Cassandra, Spark, and Kafka. This means you can design, develop and deploy your own services and create value right away.
We are looking for self-motivated and intelligent individuals who are both skilled collaborators and capable of working independently, who take initiative, and have strong CS fundamentals,.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain a distributed data processing platform
Agile software development using Java 8 or Scala
Collaborate with product managers, data analysts/scientists, engineers, and other business users to understand data needs
Define and manage SLAs for the data platform and its data sets
Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science
5+ years experience in data warehousing and ETL pipeline design, implementation, and maintenance
5+ years experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling
Expert knowledge of Java 8 and/or Scala
Familiarity with distributed computing clusters like Spark or Hadoop.
Advanced knowledge of SQL, and experience with NoSQL databases, such as Cassandra, HBase, or MongoDB.
Knowledge of web services ecosystem, including: REST, SOAP, XML, JSON and HTTP(S)
Experience with messaging systems such as Kafka, Qpid or ActiveMQ preferable.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google, or Azure preferable.
Intuitive sense for spotting and investigating inconsistencies/anomalies in data. Unwavering standards for data quality and consistency.
Familiarity with Agile & XP practices, such as TDD, pair programming, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
Accustomed to using with automated testing best practices (e.g. JUnit, Mockito)
Strong desire for highest quality code and craftsmanship.
Any minimal front-end dev experience (React, Angular, D3) considered a plus.
About Revinate
Revinate is a SaaS company that helps hotels know more about their guests so they can deliver personalized experiences that create valuable relationships and lifelong customers. Using guest data combined with our marketing engagement platform, hotels can better understand and engage their audiences, increasing loyalty and revenue. 30,000 of the world's leading hotels trust Revinate to help them reinvent the guest experience.
Headquartered in The Presidio of San Francisco with offices in Amsterdam and Singapore, Revinate is backed by leading investors Sozo Ventures, Benchmark Capital, Tenaya Capital, Formation 8, Northgate Capital, Tao Capital, GC Hotel Tech, and Industry Ventures.
Revinate values a challenging, fun and balanced culture that rewards innovation. We offer competitive salaries, stock options, great benefits, and thorough training and support. Recognized by Forbes as one of the top 10 Best Enterprise Software Startups To Work For in 2016, our commitment to people and culture speaks for itself.

title: Software Developer (m/w) mit Herzblut für Big Data
desc:
Job description
                    
Dabei können Sie uns unterstützen:
Sie übernehmen die fachliche und technische Beratung unserer Kunden hinsichtlich Big Data-Konzepten und Technologien und übernehmen optional die Rolle des Projektleiters oder Teilprojektleiters
Nach der Aufnahme und Analyse der Kundeanforderungen, entwerfen Sie passende, innovative und individuelle Hands-On-Entwicklungen von Softwarelösungen, Softwarearchitekturen und Frameworks auf Hadoop-Basis und migrieren existierende relationale Lösungen
Dabei unterstützen Sie oder sind verantwortlich für die technische Planung der Projekte, Steuerung der operativen Aufgaben sowie für die fachliche und technische Implementierung von Geschäfts-/Teillösungen und Services
Anschließend unterstützen Sie den Kunden beim Einsatz der Technologien und führen ggf. Schulungen bzw. Coachings für Projektmitarbeiter und Anwender durch
Bei Bedarf nehmen Sie an internen und externen Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen teil
Das bringen Sie mit:
Nach einem erfolgreichen Studium im Informatikumfeld, bringen Sie mehrjährige Erfahrung in den modernen Softwareentwicklungsmethoden wie z.B. Scrum oder Kanban mit und hegen rege Neugierde und Offenheit gegenüber Big Data Technologien
Dabei haben Sie die Anwendung wesentlicher Big Data Tools wie Hadoop, Spark, Storm, Flink, Elastic und/oder Data Science Algorithmen verinnerlicht
Zudem können Sie sehr sichere mathematische und statistische Kenntnisse vorweisen sowie explizites Know-how bei der Analyse von großen Datenmengen und der Anwendung von Algorithmen des maschinellen Lernens
Sie haben Kenntnisse im Bereich relationaler und NoSQL Datenbanken und Erfahrung im Einsatz gängiger Entwicklungsprozessmodelle
Wichtig sind Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Ein sicherer Umgang mit modernen Test-Verfahren ist für Sie genauso selbstverständlich wie die Kenntnis über verschiedene Präsentationstechniken
Loyales, kundenorientiertes und vorbildliches Verhalten, gute Präsentations-Skills, ein hoher Qualitätsanspruch sowie Reisebereitschaft bei Bedarf runden Ihr Profil ab
Was Sie erwartet:
Wir sind ein inhabergeführtes Familienunternehmen mit dynamischen Team, flachen Hierarchien, kurzen Kommunikationswegen, viel Raum für Eigeninitiative und hervorragenden Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Die Unternehmenskultur basiert auf Hilfsbereitschaft und Teamgeist, unterstützt durch Vertrauensarbeitszeit
Ein unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag, ein lukratives Bonusprogramm, Incentives (wie kostenlose Getränke, Sport- und Teamaktivitäten), sympathische Kollegen sowie die neuste Hardware und Technologien warten auf Sie!

title: Product Support (m/f)
desc:
Job description
                    
Who you are
You are highly motivated to deliver high quality support as part of our customer service
You are interested in becoming a technical expert and consultant for the users of our high performance parallel in-memory  database
You are highly knowledgeable about IT, especially in the fields of databases, BI solutions and complex SQL queries
Good written and spoken German and English paired with a positive communicative personality
What you can expect from us

Close collaboration with our operations engineers and our development team
The newest developments in the analytics, data science and big data field, as well as being able to work on the world’s fastest parallel in-memory database
Exciting development opportunities due to EXASOL’s international growth
Co-operative and open culture, flat hierarchy making it easy to contribute to EXASOL’s success and core values
A competitive, performance-related salary

title: WEYV Software Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Come join the WEYV team to make visible difference in the digital content streaming space! WEYV is an entertainment app allowing you to easily listen, read, and watch content, as well as share with others. We are looking for a motivated, enthusiastic and flexible Software Engineer who can design and develop highly scalable, maintainable software solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to make a difference in the next generation of digital content streaming platform and applications.
As a WEYV Software Engineer, you will contribute to the design and development of our database that is cloud native.  Developing faster, more reliable processes is how you will measure success.  Your communication with other engineers will help find the most efficient solutions to complex problems.
Responsibilities:
Build technology for the WEYV application and platform based on customer-driven and market requirements (aka “design solutions”).
Write and shepherd designs through the entire software development process, from requirements and use cases to shipping product (aka “write code”).
Apply best practices in software engineering, delivering projects on time, on budget, and with excellent quality.
Modify existing software technology to correct errors and/or improve performance (aka “fix bugs”).
Provide expertise to the support organizations as well as other software engineers (Code Reviews).
Requirements:
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
Enjoys automating and optimizing critical processes.
Practical Core Java programming (OOP) and debugging experience.
Practical experience in SQL and query optimization.
Knowledgeable in RDBMS, ORDBMS, OODBMS and Column-oriented DBMS.
Demonstrated ability to learn new languages.
Comfortable writing developer tests.
Excellent communication especially in technical/design articulation.
Desirable experience in the following areas: Data Science, AWS S3 and RDS, Elastic Search, PDF and XML formats.
An Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
We are a fun and exciting web application and Big Data company. In order to meet an ever- increasing public demand, we are looking to hire a driven Quality Assurance Engineer to join our Ruby on Rails product development hosted on AWS. This is an exceptional opportunity to join our small, growing and profitable, venture-backed company.

This position will work from our offices in Worcester, MA. (Read further about our location, below!) Relocation assistance will be offered for the right out-of-area candidate.

What’s in it For You?
Help large and small businesses of all stripes make informed decisions by predicting future opportunities and risks at any location – crime, fires, investing futures, and more.
A casual, fun working environment, solving some of the most exhilarating Big Data problems in the industry, alongside a team that’s as passionate as you are about this stuff!
Competitive salary and great benefits (401(k), medical coverage, 5 weeks paid personal time each year)
Great work/life balance, with 40-45 hour work weeks the norm!
Long-term stability with a venture backed start up that is already profitable and growing
Investors include the Founders of MapQuest and CoreLogic
Responsibilities:
Create and maintain test plans for new and existing features.
Test browser based applications from UX/UI as well functional testing.
Ability to triage issues as they arise from customer support, management or your teammates.
Lead and Support efforts to automate testing.
Keep all departments updated on status of release and communicate obstacles and testing risks.
Contribute to the development and release of NeighborhoodScout and SecurityGauge
Support IT functions hosting services on AWS, continuous integration, test automation and manual testing.
Use modern infrastructure tools and platforms to automate our systems
Solve challenging problems working with massive datasets that include crime statistics, schools, predicting real estate values years into the future, predict fire and water damage, and more
Collaborate with PhD Geographers and Statisticians to deliver new, disruptive products
Requirements:
3+ years professional work experience
Proficient with Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, SQS, CloudFront), Route53, ELB
Tools: JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, HipChat, Github, Chef, Puppet
Continuous integration, Version Control Systems (Semaphore, Jenkins), Test Automation
Experience or exposure to Agile/SCRUM is ideal
RSpec, Capabara, Selenium, Code coverage tools
Experience with API testing
Passion for breaking things!
Familiarity with the following is a strong plus:
MVC frameworks (Ruby on Rails, Symfony, Spring, Grails) a strong plus
HTML/JS frameworks (jQuery, Bootstrap, Foundation)
Frameworks: Ruby on Rails, Bootstrap, etc.
Jira for Bug Tracking and Reporting
Our Location:
Yards away from commuter rail hub, highway, pubs, restaurants and coffee shops.
5 miles in any direction and you are in quaint New England towns with nationally-ranked schools, historic charm, and great housing options (and we would know, we’re the experts!).
Interested?
Tell us about yourself and why you would like to work with us! Email careers at locationinc dot com and include a link to your website / portfolio / GitHub / LinkedIn.
Company Description
Location, Inc. is a small, high-end geospatial analysis Company born of university research, specializing in location-based decision-making tools: analytics, information and data. We license geospatial risk analytics and SaaS products for a host of business to business applications, and run NeighborhoodScout.com, the largest neighborhood search engine in the world, and _“the most trusted source for choosing a neighborhood,”_ according to *Money* ® *Magazine* .
Location, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Engineer, Data Warehouse
desc:
Job description
                    
The Data Engineering (DE) team is looking for a Data Warehouse engineer to help us architect, design and implement a scalable, reliable and automated Data Warehouse for the managing of all the data that drives our products. The ideal candidate will be comfortable going from the whiteboard design of a system all the way to the nuances of implementation.
This is an opportunity to join a growing company, and be a part of a team of folks accomplished in diverse engineering disciplines; focused on using the best of what lies at the forefront of technology and skills to address complex, real-world problems in the Healthcare and Life Science space. Some of the tools we use are: Python, Spark, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Postgres, Git, Airflow and Flask.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and develop state of the art data warehouses for the core data that drives our products.
Design and develop data models and schemas for our core data using big data technologies.
Work across multiple teams to automate and orchestrate the flow of data into our data warehouse.
Evaluate new technologies for continuous improvements in Data Engineering.
Produce high quality production ready code in an agile environment.
Collaborate closely with the product team to build new data features for our core product.
Work with the data scientists to implement data warehouse artifacts that would allow us to generate the data science .
Develop tools to monitor, debug and analyze the data pipeline.
Develop tools to automate, configure and operate our data pipelines.
Minimum
BS or MS in Computer Science or related degrees.
5+ years of relevant professional experience with demonstrated use of similar skills and technologies required.
2+ years of experience developing data warehouses using big data technologies like Hadoop, Redshift, Spark, AWS, etc.
Experience with...
Designing and implementing data warehouses using big data technologies.
Python, Scala or Java coding experience, proficiency with at least one of them is required.
Distributed systems for data processing tools such as Spark, Hadoop, Kubernetes, etc.
SQL and Relational Databases, like PostgreSQL.

You've been through the planning, launching and refactoring phases of data warehouses you have built.
A serious passion for data.
History of excellence and responsibility in previous engineering positions.
Ability to work as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.
Sincere interest in working at a startup and scaling with the company as we grow.

title: Web / Rails Developer
desc:
Job description
                    
We are a fun and exciting web application and Big Data company. In order to meet an ever-increasing public demand, we are looking to hire a Lead Ruby on Rails Developer with outstanding web development and leadership experience. This is an exceptional opportunity for a great developer to become the lead engineer of a small, growing and profitable, venture-backed company. 
Looking to make a move? This position will work from our offices in Worcester, MA. (Read further about our location, below!) Relocation assistance will be offered for the right out-of-area candidate.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Leading the incorporation of new features to our newly rearchitected and most popular product.
Serving as the Sr. developer and team lead in the technical development of our other real estate and map-based information products 
Solving challenging problems working with massive datasets that include crime statistics, schools, lifestyles, neighborhoods and more 
Working in an Agile environment writing code and tests you can be proud of 
Keeping existing products up-to-date with the latest technologies, architectures, and standards 
Advise other parts of the business on technical capabilities and options
Working alongside a nimble, cohesive engineering team 
Collaborating with PhD Geographers and Statisticians to create new, disruptive products

What’s In it For You?
Help people improve their lives, and businesses improve their bottom lines, by helping them find their ideal locations.
A casual, fun working environment, solving some of the most exhilarating Big Data problems in the industry, alongside a team that’s as passionate as you are about this stuff!
Competitive salary and great benefits (401(k), medical coverage, 5 weeks paid personal time each year)
Great work/life balance, with 40-45 hour work weeks the norm!
Long-term stability with a venture backed start up that is already profitable and growing
Investors include the Founders of MapQuest and CoreLogic

Required Skills & Experience:
5+ years designing and implementing complex, data-heavy web applications 
5+ years’ experience with Ruby on Rails and PostgreSQL / relational databases, AWS
3+ years’ front end development experience with JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS
Experience with design and building Web API development
Experience as a small team leader, tech-lead or similar role 
Self-directed time management, documentation and communication skills 
Proven, effective ability to work with others
To be passionate about your craft and entrepreneurial in thinking about how engineering can solve business problems

An ideal candidate would also possess:  
Experience HAML, SASS
DevOps experience particularly with Chef and Engine Yard
Data mining experience 
Scaling and performance tuning of high-traffic, data-heavy sites;  Google Maps JavaScript APIs

Our Environment
Hand coded Rails 4 & 5, Ruby 2.3, 2.4, HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript/jQuery 
OpenStreetMap, Google Maps API, Engine Yard, Amazon AWS, PostgreSQL/PostGIS 
We use all of your favorite tools: JIRA, Confluence,  Bitbucket, HipChat, GitHub, Chef, Puppet, Basecamp, Pivotal Tracker, etc.

Our Location
Yards away from commuter rail hub, highway, pubs, restaurants and coffee shops.
5 miles in any direction and you are in quaint New England towns with nationally-ranked schools, historic charm, and great housing options (and we would know, we’re the experts!).
Company Description
Our client is a small, high-end geospatial analysis Company born of university research, specializing in location-based decision-making tools:  analytics, information and data.  We license geospatial risk analytics and SaaS products for a host of business to business applications, and run the largest neighborhood search engine in the world, and “the most trusted source for choosing a neighborhood,” according to Money® Magazine.

title: DBA (Database Administrator)
desc:
Job description
                    
Term:  This is a full-time in-house administrator position.  This is not a consulting, contractor, or remote position.
Project Scope:  Architect a database structure for an ever-growing number of 3rd party vendors feeding data to us.   We need a strategy to store daily, weekly monthly, quarterly, annual data sets so we can quickly present this compiled data in historical trending charts including things like quarter over quarter, year over year data.  We also want to cross-pollinate this disparate data to help our clients see the correlations between these different 3rd party vendor data.  Serving up all these different silos of data to quickly render into charts requires a data delivery strategy we need our consultant to devise for us.  You’ll be in charge of building this strategy from ground zero and we will not be keeping any processes we are currently using.
 Requirements For Experience:  Hands on recent projects showing proof of the skill sets we need to guide us through big data expansion.  Proven examples of strategy building from the ground up on a proven big data platform.  In other words, we don’t’ want our projects to be your virgin voyage.
You will co-engineer sustainable solutions with our data science team to build big data models thinking proactively to scale ahead, integrated with a provisioned infrastructure to serve data via APIs and streams to integrate analytics with product platforms.  You will help architect, design and build a data pipeline that serves hundreds of thousands of data points.  We will be utilizing shared services on the AZURE platform unless you have a different recommendation.
Requirements
3-4 years of experience administering database technologies (i.e., SQL Server, Postgres, Oracle, etc)Proficient in designing efficient ETL workflows.
Extreme programming fluency with one or more of the following languages Java, Scala, R, Python.Leverage data processing technologies like Hadoop, Kafka, Presto, Spark, Cassandra and Neo4J in our infrastructure. We will expect you to make a recommendation of the data processing technology you would recommend we use after we brief you on the project.Experience supporting and architecting data models for distributed systems and large-scale applications. Independent, self-starter, strong communication, collaboration and mentoring skills
Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to tune the data processing technology you recommend to improve performance and end-user experience.
Associates degree plus 5 years of experience in Computer Science or other related fields; or BS Degree
Performance Tuning, including documenting all requirements and steps for reference by the in-house programming team.
Benefits Package: competitive time-off package, competitive (employer subsidized) medical insurance package offered after the 60th day of full-time employment in addition to dental, vision, and life insurance, on-site fitness center, media center, indoor basketball court, full-service coffee bar, and many more office perks.
Salary:  Salary is negotiable and dependent on experience. Spherexx.com® is always looking for passionate developers who crave new challenges.

title: Product Manager
desc:
Job description
                    
Product Manager
About You:
You are a product manager with at least 3 years experience in the programmatic advertising space, ideally by owning premium inventory product solutions in a mobile environment.  You have a passion for understanding and solving business needs in this space by working directly with internal programmatic Sales and demand- and supply-side partners, incorporating their requirements, and launching implementations. You have taken an existing product and made it better, using data, product performance research, and a little bit of intuition.  You have worked with cross-functional teams (e.g. Sales, engineers) to successfully ship product improvements and bug fixes against critical deadlines, and have figured out how to get the best work out of everyone you collaborate with. You are thoughtful, analytical, and optimistic.
Responsibilities:
Create programmatic solutions that maximize key business metrics.
Decisively lead a cross-functional team including Sales, Operations, Engineering, and third-party partners toward successful and high-quality releases in a fast-paced and open environment.
Lead development of the programmatic feature roadmap through conducting demand- and supply-side research, analyzing the competitive environment, and understanding key product metrics.
Exhibit sound product judgment and present clear, measurable objectives that will lead to achieving business goals.
Clearly communicate product ideas and benefits to internal stakeholders, including those at the executive level.
Drive new feature development from start to finish, including taking ownership of writing specs, working cross-functionally with related business and engineering teams, launching features, analyzing results, and synthesizing learnings.
Create and test thoughtful assumptions using market research, internal business input, partner specifications, data science findings, and limited releases / A/B testing.
Key Qualifications:
3+ years product management experience at a programmatic adtech internet software company. Experience in building experiences for iOS and Android.
Comfort with technical concepts in order to better manage trade-offs and project scoping.
Exceptional analytical skills with a focus on data-driven decision-making; demonstrated ability to use metrics and A/B testing to back up assumptions and develop business cases.
Ability to operate in an entrepreneurial environment, to thrive at an extremely fast pace, and to find creative ways to get things done.
Outstanding communication and presentation skills (ability to sell an idea internally).
Demonstrated passion for what we do.
BA or BS in technical field (computer science, engineering) ideal, MBA a plus.
Applicants must already have permission to work in the US and be able to work from our SF Office. We are a very diverse organization and welcome applications regardless of gender, ethnicity, sexuality etc. 
What we Offer
Free employee health insurance 
Catered daily lunches
Investment in professional development and training opportunities
Flexible work schedules
Dog friendly office
Quarterly employee events
A celebrity or two sprinkled here and there
As a Kiiper, you'd be able to have a huge impact from day one. Kiip is all about flexibility and letting people excel so there's no micro-managing, no facetime and lots of freedom. We get a lot of press such as this recent NY Times article and this coverage of our very favorable Nielsen report.
About Kiip (pronounced "keep"):
Every app has its moments, and Kiip’s mission is to reward users during those times of achievement with valuable offers from major brands.  
We were named to Fast Company's Top 50 Most Innovative Companies list in 2013, a mobile titan by AdWeek, and a winner of Ad Week's 2016 Project Isaac Award. As a Kiiper, you'd be able to have a huge impact from day one.

title: Scala Developer (m/f)
desc:
Job description
                    
We are currently looking for Scala Developers (m/f) to support our development teams. Two of our cross-functional and international teams are looking for support and both have many interesting challenges waiting for you: One team is developing a large scale cloud service for fraud prevention, building distributed responsive and resilient solutions which evaluate transactions in real-time. The second team is building a customizable SaaS solution which can also be deployed on premise for business customers, ingesting wide varieties of data for automatic classification of events, as well as providing a presentation layer for manual review / classification. 
Your Tasks
Development and maintenance of our main software components
Bringing in your ideas of how to improve our software by new technologies
Code reviews of your fellow developers
Supporting the release and deployment process
Working together with our data science team to develop and integrate new approaches for fraud detection
Skill Set
Experience in functional programming and / or OO, ideally on the JVM
Thorough knowledge of Scala, feeling comfortable with SBT and testing frameworks
Experience with agile software development processes
A team player, able to communicate in an open, constructive and friendly manner
Good English language skills (German is not required)
Hands-on experience with SQL, NoSQL and key-value stores, especially MongoDB and PostGreSQL, is a plus
Experience with Akka is a plus
Knowledge of search and information retrieval is a plus

title: Senior / Lead Data Engineer - Einstein
desc:
Job description
                    
Senior / Lead Data Engineer - Einstein Data Science Team
The Einstein AI Data Science team at Salesforce is looking for both Senior AND Lead Data Engineers with Scala and/or Spark experience, to help us take one of the world's most extensive data sets and transform it into amazing products that feel like magic.
A typical day for you might include the following:
Developing data infrastructure that is able to ingest and transform data at huge scale coming from many different sources, different customers, and in many different varieties.
Developing machine learning infrastructure that can generalize across hundreds of thousands of Salesforce customers, but is expressive enough to actually generate high lift.
Brainstorming data product ideas with the data scientists and engineers that built some of the most exciting data products that hundreds of millions people use every day.
Working with internal product teams to ingest their data and sprinkle machine learning fairy dust on their products.
Participating in meal conversations with your team members about really important topics, such as: Should the cuteness of panda bears be a factor in their survivability? Is love a decision tree or a regression model? How far ahead would society be today if we had 12 fingers instead of 10?
What we care about:
Please note that this is NOT an entry level, college graduate role; you MUST have industry experience, preferrably with Scala and/or Spark. Advanced degrees alone do not replace real world experience.
We're a growing, diverse team and we work together on projects. We love to collaborate and help each other, and we want someone to share that ideology.
You have to be a very quick learner - we face new challenges every day, anything that ranges between the operating model of a financial services companies to how to make Spark work with the S3 file system. No school could prepare you for all of these, so you need to be very quick on your feet.
We develop real products. You need to be an expert in coding. We use Scala and functional programming principles, great if you do too or are willing to learn.
We have massive scale. You need to have experience in distributed, scalable systems. Consistency / availability tradeoffs are made here. You've tinkered with modern data storage, messaging, and processing tools (Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.)
We run on AWS. We dockerize applications. You should have some notion of how to build, test, and deploy code to run on cloud infrastructure.
You have to be self sufficient - we operate like a startup, so everyone might do a bit of everything to get things done. You have to want to make a difference - we don't like status quo. We are looking for people who want to excel at everything they do, while still being able to prioritize between the must-haves and nice-to-haves.

title: Front-end Software Engineer- UI Developer
desc:
Job description
                    
Company Description:
Who is Intuitive Surgical? The numbers tell an amazing story. Learn more about our company.
Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority.Position Overview:The idea of surgical robotics was little more than a curiosity until 1999, the year Intuitive Surgical introduced the da Vinci® Surgical System. Today, Intuitive Surgical is the global leader in the rapidly emerging field of robotic-assisted minimally invasive surgery, helping surgeons offer their patients minimally invasive surgery more often and with better outcomes then conventional approaches for those patients who can benefit from it. As our company has grown in product reach and geography, our opportunity to improve our customer’s experience and our business operations using digital technologies is substantial and growing quickly.Primary Function of the Position:We’re embarking on an organizational transformation, extending our current offerings to include an immersive digital customer engagement. We are partnering with teams from analytics, data science and product engineering to deliver exceptional customer engagement, using deep insights from data to support executive decisions, streamline operations, and improve health outcomes. Areas of focus may include, but are not limited to: 
• Omni-channel patient and surgeon digital journeys• Achieving administrative efficiencies for internal stakeholders• Supporting new and emerging products and service offerings worldwide
We seek a strong Front-end UI Developer to help us build out our Digital platform. The individual will be responsible for leveraging current and emerging technologies to build out rich interactions for Web and Mobile solutions.Key Responsibilities:
• Work with product owners to build efficient, robust reusable front-end systems and abstractions• Develop functional and appealing web and mobile-based applications working with UI/UX designers• Evaluate new technologies and software for feasibility and desirability of incorporating them with the company's products• Work with third party vendors to develop software or integrate into company's products• Deliver front-end web strategy and development (including but not limited to responsive, e-Commerce, and mobile development), content management system integration and administration• Work collaboratively with marketing, designers and back-end developers • Code efficient, maintainable, scalable and cross-browser compatible CSS• Support the design and development process through creation and improvement of style guides and pattern libraries.

Coding for various browsers and versions, cross-browser testing with knowledge of compatibility concerns
Familiarity with API and Web services such as SOAP AND RESTWe are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer.

title: Senior Backend Engineer, Attribution
desc:
Job description
                    
About the Role:
AdRoll’s Attribution Team is seeking a Senior Backend Engineer to develop a data pipeline that is designed to clearly exhibit the value of AdRoll’s marketing platform and all it provides for the client’s bottom line. You will join a ground floor effort, working closely with a small team of Engineers and Product Managers, to implement complex attribution models. This will give clients granular insights into their customer’s actions and pathway to conversion.
In this role, your mission will be to build out a massive data processing pipeline over terabytes of daily generated data. You will work with AWS infrastructure and data jobs yielding insights into how AdRoll’s advertising platform directly leads to customer purchase events. You will collaborate with our data science team to help them develop models against our attribution data set, which will bear an understanding into what marketing mixes lead the greatest results for our diverse client base. If you are a backend engineer who loves data, then you will be a great fit for this position.
At AdRoll Engineering, we value the freedom and autonomy we give to our employees and urge everyone to use a multitude of different technologies based on their interests. In this position, you have the chance to create, build, and own complex infrastructural pipelines.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with various teams in order to gather requirements, design architectural solutions, and execute on plans
Make well-founded decisions on new technology and processes to adopt
Bring a curiosity to work every single day, and a willingness to ask questions of your coworkers; communication is key to team productivity
Mentor, teach, hire and share your knowledge to make our engineering team stronger
Qualifications:
Computer science degree
3+ years working in professional backend development
Experience with (or willingness to master) big data processing pipelines
Experience with (or willingness to master) our stack, in order of importance: Python, Docker, and AWS
Bonus Points:
Contributions to the open source community
Experience in a low level programming language and optimization
Compensation:
Competitive salary and equity
Medical / Dental / Vision benefits
Paid time off and generous holiday schedule
The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

title: Software Engineer - Scala (m/f) | Hamburg
FBI Special Agent - STEM Careers
desc:
Job description
                    
Use your technology expertise in a career like no other! As an FBI Special Agent, you will bring your skills, talents and integrity to a dedicated team working at the highest level to get ahead of threats, protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States.
A “routine” day may include interviewing a subject for an ongoing investigation in the morning, testifying in court about a computer breach before lunch, planning an operation in the afternoon and speaking about cyber threats at a community event in the evening. You may participate in arrests or raids, and execute search warrants and other dangerous assignments. You must maintain a high level of physical fitness, think on your feet, and be able to effectively respond to life-threatening situations. In an organization made up of careers like no other, being a Special Agent can be a lifelong career of uncommon days and amazing experiences — as part of a mission-focused family that is One FBI.
Special Agents are responsible for enforcing more than 300 federal statutes, as well as conducting sensitive national security investigations. You’ll work to develop relationships within and across communities and educate fellow law enforcement and national security partners at local, state, federal, and international levels, all to support our mission: To protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States.
DUTIES
You are a problem solver with great analytical skills and leadership experience; you know how to get things done both in a demanding team environment and independently. Your ability to adapt to changing situations and clearly communicate across management, peer groups, external communities and stakeholders contributes to your ability to keep our nation safe. You’re naturally curious and always driven to find a solution. You notice minute details, yet remain strategic. You objectively evaluate information and make sound judgments. Honesty and integrity are more than just words to you — they are the foundation of who you are. You take pride in making a difference in the communities you serve, and bringing your background and unique skills to initiatives that impact our most important stakeholders: the American people.
In this role, you’ll be expected to use both established and innovative approaches to tackle some of the toughest challenges of our age. This opportunity should not be taken lightly. The FBI Special Agent position requires significant commitment and dedication from you and your family, but you’ll go home every night knowing you’re making a difference. Being an FBI Special Agent is an experience you'll never forget.
Though individuals of all backgrounds are highly encouraged to apply, we’re specifically seeking the following skills:
SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATH (STEM): Accounting, forensic science, computer technology, cyber security, electronics, economics, finance, biometrics, encryption, data science, information technology, mathematics, chemistry, computer forensics, biology, and more. When people say STEM, you perk up because you know they are talking about you.
FOREIGN LANGUAGES: You may have been raised speaking a language other than English, taught it for a few years or even participated in intensive learning before going overseas to use it. You know that your language skills can make a difference: Arabic, Yoruba, Mandarin, Tagalog, Russian, Spanish, Farsi, Punjabi, Pashtu, Urdu and more.
Skills & Requirements
KEY REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Qualifications: 
Must be at least age 23 and not yet 37 at the time of your appointment. (Age waivers are available.)
Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Clearance.
Must possess a valid driver's license.
Must meet the FBI’s physical fitness requirements.
Must commit to serving as a Special Agent for a minimum of three (3) years.
Work Experience: All Special Agent applicants must also have at least three (3) years of full-time professional work experience unless they qualify for a waiver. Work experience showing progressive growth, leadership and responsibility is preferred. Certain specified experiences and/or abilities waive the three-year full-time work experience requirement. These include applicants with degrees in Computer Science, Information Technology, a Juris Doctorate (J.D.) degree and Certified Public Accountants (CPAs). Applicants with masters’ and/or doctorate degrees require two (2) years of full-time work experience. NOTE: Meeting the requirements for a waiver does not guarantee that you will be deemed "Most Competitive."
Physical Requirements: Applicants must pass FBI Special Agent Physical Requirements, including medical and hearing standards. Applicants must also pass the Physical Fitness Test (PFT) and be physically fit to complete a Basic Field Training Course at Quantico and effectively respond to life-threatening situations in the field.
For more information about the Special Agent Selection System (SASS) physical fitness requirements and work experience waivers, please visit https://fbijobs.gov/career-paths/special-agents.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EVALUATIONS
Special Agent candidates must go through an extensive testing and interview process. Learn more about this on www.fbijobs.gov.
AUTOMATIC DISQUALIFIERS
Applicants convicted of a felony, who use illegal drugs in violation of the FBI Employment Drug Policy, who are in default of a student loan insured by the U.S. Government, who fail an FBI urinalysis drug test or who fail to register with the Selective Service System (males only) are not eligible for employment with the FBI.
Applicants should consider that the average processing time to complete all stages of the selection process may take approximately one (1) year. The FBI may disqualify applicants at any time during the process, should it be determined that they will reach age 37 before appointment to the Basic Field Training Course.
SECURITY
Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Clearance.
HOW TO APPLY
When submitting applications, please follow the Federal Resume Template available at www.fbijobs.gov under the “Documents for Application” tab. This page also gives many details about the application process.    
Learn more about the special agent career, fitness requirements, and the Physical Fitness Test (PFT) here.
Learn more about the job posting on apply.fbijobs.gov.
Equal Employment Opportunity 
The FBI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer; our employees come from diverse backgrounds but share a common mission that makes us One FBI — and all qualified applicants will receive consideration. Except where otherwise provided by law, selection will be made without regard to, and with no discrimination based on color, race, religion, national origin, political affiliation, marital status, parental status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, age, sex, sexual orientation, membership or non-membership in an employee organization, personal favoritism or any other non-merit factors.

title: Senior Java Developer (Remote)
desc:
Job description
                    
IdeaScale, offers a unique opportunity for talented, passionate, and highly-creative engineers to have a wide-ranging impact on our organization's products, operations, and services.  We're looking for developers who are passionate about writing great software, have a love for solving difficult problems, enjoy learning about new technologies and contributing to products used by millions.

title: Java and Go Senior Developer (m/f) | Warsaw
Lead Product Manager, Social and Display
desc:
Job description
                    
Requisition: R0017999ORGANIZATION: StubHub,http://www.stubhub.com (an eBay company NASDAQ: EBAY)
StubHub connects people through inspiring event experiences. We connect fans with their favorite teams, shows and artists and introduce them to the ones they will love next. As the largest ticket marketplace in the world, we enable fans to buy and sell tickets to tens of thousands of events, whenever they want, through our desktop and mobile experiences, including our StubHub app for iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch and Android. Offering a superior fan experience at its core, StubHub reinvented the ticket resale market in 2000 and continues to lead it through innovation. Our industry firsts include the introduction of the first ticketing application, the first interactive seat mapping tool and the first live entertainment rewards program, Fan Rewards™. 
We are looking for a Lead Product Manager to head up our Social and Display Technology Team. The role reports to the Head of Marketing and Distribution Technology and will work closely with their business and marketing counterparts to define and execute a cohesive business, marketing and technology strategy for the global paid social and display channel.  This position will be based in our San Francisco headquarters.Key responsibilities include:

Understanding the business, competitive, technology and customer environment as it relates to paid social and display advertising in the ticketing, live events and eCommerce space.
	Defining the tech strategy and roadmap in partnership with marketing and business stakeholders, including the long term vision, tactical roadmap and specific requirements for social and display products.
	Writing epics and stories that clearly translate business needs into specific technical requirements and managing backlog end to end in Jira.
	Executing on roadmap in partnership with the engineering and project management leads to deliver products that enable target business results on time, on scope and budget.
	Sharing business accountability with business and marketing stakeholders, together defining KPI’s both for business and tech and co-owning accountability for achieving these goals.
	Using data to develop a development process centered around rapid iterative testing with tuning based on data
	Developing a Global Platform by defining the technology, roadmap and strategy to support a global business.
	Communicating strategy, vision, status and technology clearly and concisely to all levels of management and stakeholders.
EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

10+ years of experience in technical product management as a product owner in an agile environment, leading products with proven business success.
	5+ years of hands on experience with social and display technology with proven business success, preferably at a F500 company in the ticketing, eCommerce or related industry.
	Deep technical understanding of the paid advertising space and the technology used in the industry, ideally with SFMC, Omniture, Google Tag Manager, Flashtalking and Doubleclick Campaign Manager.
	Familiarity with automated AI driven bidding including bid optimization, data science models and technology used to power this in the paid social and display channel.
	Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills with previous experience structuring and performing complex analysis in the digital marketing space.
	Polished communication skills in email, presentation, powerpoint
	Passion for live events - sports/concert/entertainment enthusiast a plus

title: Software Engineer @ IDEO / Creatively Build Beautiful Products
desc:
Job description
                    
In a nutshell:
Creative Difference is a new venture borne out of IDEO’s Design for Change studio.  It is an enterprise tool used to assess an organization’s creative competencies in the areas of innovation, competitiveness, and adaptability.  We are in search for a mid-level Software Engineer to join our team to help us build and evolve the Creative Difference platform.  
Why is this role important for IDEO’s work?
Our Design for Change studio’s Product Team, based out of our San Francisco office, is looking to scale up its engineering on the Creative Difference product team so we can impact thousands to millions of organizations to help them become more innovative. We need your help to streamline the product, iterate on features, and improve the customer experience. It is a small team with a big goal.
Once you are here, you will:
Build on existing codebase to implement new features, fix bugs, and evolve the product
Work on the full application stack: front-end marketing site, front-end user application, back-end API, administration, and data modeling
Work closely with the product owner, interaction designers, and engineering team to uncover new customer needs, prioritize tasks, and implement new features
Work with a data analyst to analyze and provide solutions to data questions
Collaborate with other developers via code reviews and occasional pair programming
Collaborate with IDEO’s talented design team to help shape the product roadmap
Relevant Experience
Must Haves
5+ years experience working on production-quality software in a team environment
3+ years experience working on production-quality Ruby on Rails apps
Fluency and comfort working with:
Javascript and Angular (or other Javascript frameworks)
Databases (data modeling, optimization)
Automated testing (we use RSpec + Capybara)
Git
Good sense of visual design with an emphasis on building beautiful products with the user in mind
Able to easily dive in, understand, and build on an existing codebase
A passion for readable, extensible, beautiful and simple code.
Above and Beyond
BS / MS in computer science or related engineering field
Stay current with latest development best practices -- able to share industry insights with the team and provide input on process and/or architectural decisions
Experience refactoring large codebases or building out service components
Interest in ML/AI/data science - algorithms, modeling, TensorFlow, etc
Going from coding to a brainstorm then diving back into code is the perfect day
Contributing to great visual design alongside world-class designers sounds blissful
You’re excited to be at IDEO, learn more about Design Thinking, and work amongst super creative people
What does IDEO offer you?
IDEO is a place unlike any other. It’s a place where you can solve diverse, complex challenges for our clients or the organization, alongside thoughtful, intelligent individuals who lead with curiosity, empathy, and optimism. Sure we work hard, but we also intentionally craft moments that allow our community to pause, create, and connect. We encourage our community to bring their whole selves to work, respect the need for work-life balance, and allow for autonomy in the design process and your career.
IDEO San Francisco’s Design for Change Studio focuses on helping organizations adapt to and drive change. At times we’re redesigning the employee and customer experience, other times we’re helping to build innovation engines within organizations, and sometimes even unifying large companies with a common purpose.
Check out some of our work:
Creative Difference - We designed a tool to assess an organization's creative competitiveness.  
IDEO U: An online school where anyone can unlock their creative potential through design thinking and collaboration
OI Engine: An innovation software product, helping organizations engage their people and networks in creative problem-solving online
Intercorp: Launching an innovation lab to benefit Peruvians
Team Rubicon: Designing a Global plan for disaster response

title: Sr Software Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Apple’s Applied Machine Learning team has built systems for a number of large-scale data science applications. We work on many high-impact projects that serve various Apple lines of business. We use the latest in open source technology and as committers on some of these projects, we are pushing the envelope. Working with multiple lines of business we manage many streams of Apple-scale data. We bring it all together and unleash business value. We do all this with an exceptional group of software engineers, data scientists, dev-ops engineers and managers.Key Qualifications:•The position requires a solid knowledge of secure coding practices and experience with open source technologies.•Strong Object Oriented Programming skills and proficiency in Java.•Experience in distributed systems, design and implementation of high throughput, low latency applications.•Solid CS background, concurrent programming, and data structures.•Solid understanding of NoSQL technologies like Cassandra.•Solid understanding and working knowledge of Hadoop.•Exposure to other languages such as Lua, C++, Lisp, Scala, Haskell, etc., would be desirable.•Deep understanding of TCP, websockets, and libraries like Netty.•Excellent problem solving skills, critical thinking, and communication skills.•Strong ability to learn new technologies in a short time.Description:Join Apple's Applied Machine Learning Team, as a Senior Software Engineer, to build innovative software applications. Candidates should have development and implementation experience on large scale mission critical applications. The main responsibilities for this position include:Designing innovative solutions while playing a hands-on development role to deliver products in a rapid and dynamic environment.Involvement in challenging and fast paced projects supporting Apple's business by delivering innovative solutions to given challenges.Develop tools to monitor system health, performance, and reliability.The candidate is expected to be self-motivated, proactive, and a solution-oriented individual.Education:BS in computer science with 7-10 years or MS plus 5-7 years experience or related experience.Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Commerce Software Engineer, Apple Media Products
desc:
Job description
                    
The iTunes Store Commerce engineering team is looking for a proven Software Engineer for payment processing and related functions in commerce interactions on the iTunes Store, including Account Creation, Manage Payment Info, Content Purchase, In-App purchase, subscriptions and more. Join our exciting engineering team that has been leading the digital distribution industry by constantly developing innovative features since its launch. The position requires someone who's comfortable with all aspects of the software design cycle. The role has a focus on developing and maintaining fraud detection and prevention of payment processing and related functions in a high performance distributed system.Key Qualifications:•Exceptional Java programming skills•Object-oriented programming•Deep experience in Unix/Linux•Entity relationship modeling•Experience with Key/Value Stores•Experience programming for eventual consistency•Experience or interest in fraud detectionDescription:This position covers all aspects of engineering solution for fraud detection and prevention related to payment processing and related functions in iTunes store. We are looking for a self starting, energetic individual who is not afraid to question assumptions and with excellent written and oral skills.You will cover fraud detection and prevention related to functions for all kinds of payment types worldwide, to ensure secure signup of payment method in iTunes store and purchasing of all types of content on the iTunes Store (from ringtones, songs to apps, in-apps and subscriptions) using such payment methods.You will be responsible for features of payment method signup with iTunes account, including payment method verification, risk evaluation and business policy definition and implementation etc.You will be responsible for features to safeguard purchasing of all types of content on the iTunes Store using different payment methods, including account authentication, multiple factor of verification to verify account & payment identity, risk decision of transaction.You will work on features of commerce interaction to ensure best user experience while ensuring payment security with each different payment types.You will work on features to enable management of permission and usage of iTunes accounts and their associated payment methods.You will work closely with other teams in iTunes Store as well as other departments of Apple, including business, operation, data science etc., for features related to fraud integration to ensure free flow of commerce data and fraud decision across systems.You will work with different kinds of payment providers worldwide for fraud related integration between iTunes store and payment providers, for fraud related data exchange.Education:BS in STEM, or equivalent work experienceApple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: FBI Special Agent - STEM Careers
desc:
Job description
                    
Use your technology expertise in a career like no other! As an FBI Special Agent, you will bring your skills, talents and integrity to a dedicated team working at the highest level to get ahead of threats, protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States.
A “routine” day may include interviewing a subject for an ongoing investigation in the morning, testifying in court about a computer breach before lunch, planning an operation in the afternoon and speaking about cyber threats at a community event in the evening. You may participate in arrests or raids, and execute search warrants and other dangerous assignments. You must maintain a high level of physical fitness, think on your feet, and be able to effectively respond to life-threatening situations. In an organization made up of careers like no other, being a Special Agent can be a lifelong career of uncommon days and amazing experiences — as part of a mission-focused family that is One FBI.
Special Agents are responsible for enforcing more than 300 federal statutes, as well as conducting sensitive national security investigations. You’ll work to develop relationships within and across communities and educate fellow law enforcement and national security partners at local, state, federal, and international levels, all to support our mission: To protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States.
DUTIES
You are a problem solver with great analytical skills and leadership experience; you know how to get things done both in a demanding team environment and independently. Your ability to adapt to changing situations and clearly communicate across management, peer groups, external communities and stakeholders contributes to your ability to keep our nation safe. You’re naturally curious and always driven to find a solution. You notice minute details, yet remain strategic. You objectively evaluate information and make sound judgments. Honesty and integrity are more than just words to you — they are the foundation of who you are. You take pride in making a difference in the communities you serve, and bringing your background and unique skills to initiatives that impact our most important stakeholders: the American people.
In this role, you’ll be expected to use both established and innovative approaches to tackle some of the toughest challenges of our age. This opportunity should not be taken lightly. The FBI Special Agent position requires significant commitment and dedication from you and your family, but you’ll go home every night knowing you’re making a difference. Being an FBI Special Agent is an experience you'll never forget.
Though individuals of all backgrounds are highly encouraged to apply, we’re specifically seeking the following skills:
SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATH (STEM): Accounting, forensic science, computer technology, cyber security, electronics, economics, finance, biometrics, encryption, data science, information technology, mathematics, chemistry, computer forensics, biology, and more. When people say STEM, you perk up because you know they are talking about you.
FOREIGN LANGUAGES: You may have been raised speaking a language other than English, taught it for a few years or even participated in intensive learning before going overseas to use it. You know that your language skills can make a difference: Arabic, Yoruba, Mandarin, Tagalog, Russian, Spanish, Farsi, Punjabi, Pashtu, Urdu and more.
Skills & Requirements
KEY REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Qualifications: 
Must be at least age 23 and not yet 37 at the time of your appointment. (Age waivers are available.)
Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Clearance.
Must possess a valid driver's license.
Must meet the FBI’s physical fitness requirements.
Must commit to serving as a Special Agent for a minimum of three (3) years.
Work Experience: All Special Agent applicants must also have at least three (3) years of full-time professional work experience unless they qualify for a waiver. Work experience showing progressive growth, leadership and responsibility is preferred. Certain specified experiences and/or abilities waive the three-year full-time work experience requirement. These include applicants with degrees in Computer Science, Information Technology, a Juris Doctorate (J.D.) degree and Certified Public Accountants (CPAs). Applicants with masters’ and/or doctorate degrees require two (2) years of full-time work experience. NOTE: Meeting the requirements for a waiver does not guarantee that you will be deemed "Most Competitive."
Physical Requirements: Applicants must pass FBI Special Agent Physical Requirements, including medical and hearing standards. Applicants must also pass the Physical Fitness Test (PFT) and be physically fit to complete a Basic Field Training Course at Quantico and effectively respond to life-threatening situations in the field.
For more information about the Special Agent Selection System (SASS) physical fitness requirements and work experience waivers, please visit https://fbijobs.gov/career-paths/special-agents.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EVALUATIONS
Special Agent candidates must go through an extensive testing and interview process. Learn more about this on www.fbijobs.gov.
AUTOMATIC DISQUALIFIERS
Applicants convicted of a felony, who use illegal drugs in violation of the FBI Employment Drug Policy, who are in default of a student loan insured by the U.S. Government, who fail an FBI urinalysis drug test or who fail to register with the Selective Service System (males only) are not eligible for employment with the FBI.
Applicants should consider that the average processing time to complete all stages of the selection process may take approximately one (1) year. The FBI may disqualify applicants at any time during the process, should it be determined that they will reach age 37 before appointment to the Basic Field Training Course.
SECURITY
Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Clearance.
HOW TO APPLY
When submitting applications, please follow the Federal Resume Template available at www.fbijobs.gov under the “Documents for Application” tab. This page also gives many details about the application process.    
Learn more about the special agent career, fitness requirements, and the Physical Fitness Test (PFT) here.
Learn more about the job posting on apply.fbijobs.gov.
Equal Employment Opportunity
The FBI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer; our employees come from diverse backgrounds but share a common mission that makes us One FBI — and all qualified applicants will receive consideration. Except where otherwise provided by law, selection will be made without regard to, and with no discrimination based on color, race, religion, national origin, political affiliation, marital status, parental status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, age, sex, sexual orientation, membership or non-membership in an employee organization, personal favoritism or any other non-merit factors.
