title: Medical Science Liaison
desc: Medical LiaisonMedical Science Liaison (MSL)The Medical Science Liaison (MSL) will be responsible for providing non-promotional scientific, educational, and research support for the Genzyme Rare Disease portfolio in the respective territory.  The MSL position is a field based member of the Medical Affairs team. The MSL should be highly trained in a health care field and well versed in clinical practice and basic science. The MSL should be able to deliver cutting edge data and technical/practical education to Health Care Professionals (HCPs).The MSL will be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with key Rare Disease experts and building a well-informed advocacy base for Genzyme's Rare Disease franchise, including compounds in the development program. The MSL will act as a conduit for providing accurate and updated clinical, scientific and medical information to Rare Disease Experts, health care professionals, treatments decision makers and other members of the scientific, provider and payer community (private insurance, payers, medical groups, government agencies, and health systems with drug formularies), in compliance with all relevant company policies.This territory is based in the Southeast covering FL, TN, AL, MS and Puerto Rico. Candidate must live in either FL or TN.Travel 60% +Job ResponsibilitiesMaintains business and clinical knowledge of the Rare Disease treatment landscape including current treatment strategies, current and pending competitors, and new therapeutic developments.Increases Genzyme's visibility among leaders in the therapeutic field of Rare Diseases including Genetics, Cardiovascular, and Endocrinology. Identifies, establishes and maintains collaborative relationships with key experts, investigators and institutions strategic to product development.Participates in medical education for healthcare professionals through presentations at office visits, investigator meetings, advisory boards, medical meetings, and other appropriate venues to enhance product and disease state knowledge.Collaborates with clinical team and CRA's to coordinate and optimize educational and research support for sites/investigators participating in Genzyme's clinical trials.Responds to unsolicited requests regarding interest in investigator sponsored studies (ISS), and supports ISS submissions through appropriate internal processes. Responds to unsolicited request for medical information associated with supported products and disease state areas.Provides effective clinical presentations to internal and external audiences and tailors presentations to meet specific needs of the audience (appropriate response to unsolicited requests).Identifies and communicates key clinical and research issues and insights from industry leaders to appropriate departments to help shape company research, development, and strategies for investigational and commercialized products.Facilitates the identification of medical community educational needs around disease state management, including awareness and understanding of appropriate/inappropriate use of company products. Collaborates  with internal and external stakeholders in support of needs of Key Opinion leaders (KOLs). Maintains clinical expertise through comprehensive education including attendance at relevant symposia, scientific workshops, and review of key journals. Participation in required internal training, presentations and journal clubs.Maintains appropriate communication with Medical, Regulatory, and Legal personnel within the company to ensure appropriate timelines and procedures are met. Adheres to regulatory and compliance guidelines and company policies in all aspects of scientific dissemination of information to include responses to unsolicited requests for medical information.Enhances clinical/scientific knowledge of customers and colleagues through education and appropriate scientific exchange.Works collaboratively with relevant internal stakeholders to identify local/regional educational gaps/needs and apply appropriate field medical support that is aligned with medical strategy.Provides field updates regarding topics of interest.Addresses administrative and reporting needs on a timely basis or as requested by management.Provides clinical presentations to Payer groups as requested.·      Travel 60% or greater, including domestic and international travel as needed.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Minimum requirements include:Master's degree in a life science subject and 3 or more years related pharma/biotech experience title: Medical Science Liaison
desc: Medical Science LiaisonTerritory: Washington and AlaskaThe Medical Science Liaison (MSL) will be responsible for providing non-promotional scientific, educational, and research support for the Sanofi Genzyme Multiple Sclerosis and Neurology portfolio in the respective territory. The MSL position is a field based member of the Medical Affairs team. The MSL should be highly trained in a health care field and well-versed in clinical and for basic science to be able to deliver cutting edge data and technical/practical education to Health Care Professionals (HCP).The MSL will be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with key MS experts and building a well-informed advocacy base for Sanofi Genzyme's MS franchise, including compounds in the development program. The MSL will act as a conduit for providing accurate and updated clinical, scientific and medical information to MS Experts, health care professionals, treatments decision makers and other members of the scientific, provider and payer community (private insurance, payers, medical groups, government agencies, and health systems with drug formularies), in compliance with all relevant company policies.Job Responsibilities• Maintains business and clinical knowledge of the Multiple Sclerosis treatment landscape including current treatment strategies, current and pending competitors, and new therapeutic developments.• Increases Sanofi Genzyme's visibility among leaders in the therapeutic field of Multiple Sclerosis. Identifies, establishes and maintains collaborative relationships with key MS/neurology Experts, investigators and institutions strategic to product development.• Participates in medical education for healthcare professionals through presentations at office visits, investigator meetings, advisory boards, medical meetings, and other appropriate venues to enhance product and disease state knowledge.• Collaborates with clinical team and CRA's to coordinate and optimize educational and research support for sites/investigators participating in Sanofi Genzyme's clinical trials.• Responds to unsolicited requests regarding interest in investigator sponsored studies (ISS), and supports ISS submissions through appropriate internal processes.• Responds to unsolicited request for medical information associated with supported products and disease state areas.• Provides effective clinical presentations to internal and external audiences and tailors presentations to meet specific needs of the audience (appropriate response to unsolicited requests).• Identifies and communicates key clinical and research issues and insights from industry leaders to appropriate departments to help shape company research, development, and strategies for investigational and commercialized products.• Facilitates the identification of medical community educational needs around MS disease state management, including awareness and understanding of appropriate/inappropriate use of company products.• Collaboration with internal and external stakeholders in support of needs of Key Opinion leaders (KOLs).• Maintains clinical expertise through comprehensive education including attendance at relevant symposium, scientific workshops, and review of key journals. Participation in required internal training, presentations and journal clubs.• Maintains appropriate communication with Medical, Regulatory, and Legal personnel within the company to ensure appropriate timelines and procedures are met.• Adheres to regulatory and compliance guidelines and company policies in all aspects of scientific dissemination of information to include responses to unsolicited requests for medical information.• Enhances clinical/scientific knowledge of customers and colleagues through education and appropriate scientific exchange.• Works collaboratively with title: Medical Science Liaison LC2AT04S
desc: The Medical Science Liaison (MSL) will be responsible for providing non-promotional scientific, educational, and research support for the Genzyme MS and Neurology portfolio in the respective territory.  The MSL position is a field based member of the Medical Affairs team. The MSL should be highly trained in a health care field and well-versed in clinical and for basic science to be able to deliver cutting edge data and technical/practical education to Health Care Professionals (HCP).The MSL will be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with key MS experts and building a well-informed advocacy base for Genzyme's MS franchise, including compounds in the development program. The MSL will act as a conduit for providing accurate and updated clinical, scientific and medical information to MS Experts, health care professionals, treatments decision makers and other members of the scientific, provider and payer community (private insurance, payers, medical groups, government agencies, and health systems with drug formularies), in compliance with all relevant company policies.Territory: NY based territory including - Albany and points South to West Chester, Hudson Valley, Long Island and Brooklyn. title: Head of BPIV Clinical Sciences
desc: Head of BPIV Clinical Sciences (Clinical Team Leader)The Sanofi Pasteur organization's vision is a world in which no one suffers or dies from a vaccine-preventable disease. The Company:Produces more than 1 billion doses of vaccines yearly to immunize more than 500 million people in the worldIs the world’s largest producer of seasonal influenza vaccinesIs the world’s leading provider of inactivated poliomyelitis vaccineHas broadest range of modern pediatric combination vaccines for children throughout the worldIs the world’s main provider of meningococcal vaccines with an unfaltering commitment to provide meningococcal vaccine for outbreaks control in West AfricaHas largest portfolio of vaccines for travelers and people living in tropical areas: typhoid, rabies, yellow fever, Japanese encephalitis, meningococcal meningitis, cholera, hepatitis A, hepatitis BToday, according to the World Health Organization (WHO), vaccines are available to protect against more than 26 infectious diseases.  Sanofi Pasteur has the broadest available range of vaccines, protecting against 20 infectious diseases:Bacterial diseases:CholeraDiphtheriaHaemophilus influenzae type b InfectionsMeningococcal InfectionsPertussisPneumococcal InfectionsTetanusTuberculosisTyphoid FeverViral diseases:Hepatitis AHepatitis BInfluenzaJapanese EncephalitisMeaslesMumpsPoliomyelitisRabiesRubellaYellow Feverand smallpox, eradicated in 1980 (vaccine produced as a measure in response to the threat of bioterrorism)Worldwide, Sanofi Pasteur is at the forefront of developing immunological solutions to prevent diseases for every stage of life. We are continuously harnessing new scientific knowledge and technologies to design safe and effective single-entity and combination vaccines against complex diseases for the world’s population.Working alone or in collaboration with third parties, the Company is developing vaccines against diseases for which there are pressing needs. Many are currently in development or submitted for approval, focusing on new targets and improved vaccines for every stage of life including:new vaccines against infectious diseases for which no vaccines are currently available, such as hospital-acquired infections, e.g. Clostridium difficile and enterotoxigenic Escherichia coli (ETEC) infections;new vaccines against the diseases that plague emerging countries, such as Zika;new combination vaccines vaccines to face a potential influenza pandemicQuadrivalent influenza vaccines adapted for the elderly.The Head of BPIV Clinical Sciences is a key position to develop a clinical strategy for the broadly protective influenza vaccine (BPIV) project within the R&D organization.  The position will be a dual reporting relationship to a biotech-like unit within Sanofi Pasteur R&D to develop BPIV, and the Clinical Sciences team.  As BPIV has not entered into the clinic yet, novel, creative areas of clinical research are deemed necessary to complement our already successful and proven pipeline and portfolio of influenza vaccines by Sanofi Pasteur.  The candidate should feel comfortable between the translational science space between discovery and proof of concept Phase 1/2 clinical trials. A track record in successful proof-of-concept achievement is a plus.This newly-created position has been established to primarily contribute to the strategic planning, design, management and execution of BPIV clinical trials covering all age groups and on a global scale.    The Director of Clinical Research for BPIV will work with the Clinical Sciences team, in conjunction with the Clinical Programs team, and be responsible for conducting BPIV Phase I – III clinical trials on a global scale.  Clinical trials are conducted to support vaccine products in the development pipeline and are conducted internationally, depending upon the geographic location of the affected areas and populations. It is essential that the right candidate believes in the positive impact that industry can make in the advancement of vaccines.Duties:        The primary responsibilities for this position are:Be able to work in preclinical space to design impactful and meaningful proof of concept influenza clinical trial designs and create the clinical and regulatory pathway through licensure of BPIV including discovery of biomarkers from the clinical trialsMedical monitoring of individual clinical trials or set of studies within a program to maintain patient safety and secure:Compliance with ICH-GCP guidelines and internal proceduresCommunication with principal investigators and study site coordinators in order to address any scientific and medically-related inquiriesThe Director of Clinical Research is the medical expert on call for all relevant aspects associated with the trial and the program (including during site audits and inspections)Clinical trial management from research to licensing, including ownership and strategic direction of Clinical Development Plans (CDP) and the subsets of the Common Technical Document (CTD)Contribution to the strategic vision of the project and support of the project team as Clinical Sciences representativeAlignment of the CDP with Franchise objectives by working with the respective Clinical Franchise Leader or Clinical Portfolio HeadClear, timely and consistent strategy across the clinical trials, reflected in the CDP and communicated internally in the organizationLead the interpretation and critical evaluation of study resultsContribute to the generation and submission of documentation to Regulatory and Health Authorities including submission files, study reports, program dossiers, etc.Oversee the operational aspects of the clinical trials and interact with internal team members and external clientsReview safety data from ongoing clinical trials as a key member of a Safety Management TeamEnsure the timelines and quality requirements of trials are clearly communicated and followedBe a contributing member of the BPIV biotech unit and the Clinical Sciences organizationsTimely and accurate accomplishment of key project milestones including the design of the clinical development strategy, licensure submissions, and integration of clinical data for milestone decision processesParticipate actively in process improvement and other initiativesInteract with members of the Program/Project Teams and other internal members (Research and Development, Chief Medical Office, Commercial Operations, Industrial Operations) in a positive and collaborative mannerPresent Clinical data internally to senior management and externally to investigators, outside partners, regulatory agencies and public health agenciesAs appropriate, serve as an ambassador for Sanofi Pasteur:Representing the Company at scientific meetingsAuthor publicationsEstablish, develop and maintain a network of Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) and leading scientists in the fieldPerformance expectations in the first year include:Assimilate into the internal Clinical R&D team on a global scale - this includes working well with Central and Regional Clinical Sciences and Clinical Programs representativesAssimilate into the BPIV biotech unit and the BPIV project team as the clinical representative to design and implement clinical studies for the broadly protective influenza vaccine project. Ensure that project timelines and quality milestones are metContribute to the strategy for the clinical proof of concept and advanced development of BPIV and other assigned vaccinesMaintain the state of the art knowledge on clinical development for infectious diseases vaccines and particularly for influenzaContribute to the internal and external distribution and communication of clinical dataPosition Location:  This position is based in Cambridge Massachusetts. Compensation:  This role will consist of a competitive overall package including base and bonus. THE ORGANIZATION: Sanofi, a global and diversified healthcare leader, discovers, develops and distributes therapeutic solutions focused on patients’ needs. Sanofi has core strengths in the field of healthcare with seven growth platforms:  diabetes solutions, oncology, innovative drugs, human vaccines, consumer healthcare, orphan products, emerging markets and animal health. Sanofi Pasteur is the vaccines division of Sanofi.  A world leader in the vaccine industry, Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines protecting against 20 infectious diseases.  The company is the largest in the world that is entirely devoted and dedicated to vaccines.  Every day, the company invests more than €1 million in Research and Development.     The mission of Sanofi Pasteur is to protect and improve human health worldwide by providing superior, innovative vaccines for the prevention and treatment of disease and by playing an active role in the immunization community to maximize vaccination coverage rates. Sanofi Pasteur is committed to providing vaccines to persons of all ages, developing technologies to facilitate the distribution and administration of vaccines locally, participating in the training of personnel who administer vaccines in the field, and conducting research on needed vaccines, especially including those that are needed primarily in developing countries, e.g. dengue fever and pandemic influenza. Sanofi Pasteur is continuously investing in state-of-the-art technologies to meet the anticipated growing demand of new and existing vaccines, expected to double over the next 5-10 years.  The organization has 14 major production sites on 4 continents. Sanofi Pasteur has a strong commitment to Research and Development partnerships with major universities, research institutes, government bodies, biotechnology companies and contract research organizations. The Company's collaborations cover virtually all aspects of vaccine development, including early-stage research.  Sanofi is listed in Paris (EURONEXT: SAN) and in New York (NYSE: SNY).www.sanofipasteur.comTHE PERSON:   Education: Medical Degree RequiredInfectious Diseases certification highly desirable; Immunology acceptable Specific Skills & Experience: Experience in Infectious Diseases, vaccines, adjuvants, and influenza preferred; experience in Immunology acceptableExperience in conducting clinical trials preferred; clinical trial protocol and writing, working knowledge of ICH/GCP guidelines and clinical research ethics preferredExperience designing and conducting clinical trials to understand immune mechanism of action or to demonstrate proof of concept in vaccine development a plusExperience conducting and designing non-clinical experiments a plusEIS training very advantageousBiotech or start-up experience a plusSome regulatory experience a plusFamiliarity with IND submission processPersonal Characteristics: Team player, independent and with demonstrated initiativeDemonstrated organizational skillsAbility to network and communicate clearlyPersonal drive to surpass timelines on projectsPolitically astute, able to successfully architect internal and external networks to support the team missionAbility to work well under pressurePositive and welcoming personalityIntuitive drive for novel scienceInquisitive and willing to try novel approachesSanofi is a global healthcare leader focused on patients' needs, engaged in the research, development, manufacturing and marketing of therapeutic solutions focused on patients’ needs. Sanofi has core strengths in diabetes solutions, human vaccines, innovative drugs, consumer healthcare, emerging markets and Sanofi Genzyme.At Sanofi, our ambition is to be an integrated global healthcare company, focused on patients’ needs. Much more than just a leading pharmaceutical company, Sanofi is committed to transforming scientific innovations into solutions and services that protect health, enhance life, and respond to the needs of the 7 billion people in the world. We trust our ambition to guide and inspire us as we work to create a future with optimal health and wellness for everyone.

As a Sanofi company, Genzyme benefits from the reach and resources of one of the world's largest pharmaceutical companies, with a shared commitment to improving the lives of patients.Sanofi, an integrated global healthcare leader, discovers, develops and distributes therapeutic solutions focused on patients’ needs. 								Job facts
							
	Expertly lead ongoing analyses of systems, data, reporting and compliance/business processes, to identify USMA compliance needs and recommend improvements
	Expertly drive process improvements with key stakeholders
	Perform compliance and business landscape assessment(s) to propose strategic solutions and recommendations that advance and streamline processes
	Perform gap analyses to help the business understand impact and benefits in a broader context and drive alignment and decisions
	Monitor business processes for compliance with established policies, SOPs and other guidances
	Manage the end-to-end healthcare and/or medical compliance training program for U.S. Medical Affairs Compliance which includes collaborating with local and global training partners on the appropriate assignment of healthcare compliance and/or medical compliance training and training compliance monitoring
	Expertly manage gMAC monitoring and training deliverables to enable best-in-class medical affairs compliance operations
	Provide timely, accurate and adequate reporting to support the work of others within gMAC, and across business partners, stakeholders and the broader USMA organization and/or beyond.
	Expertly lead analytical efforts to assess and evaluate monitoring data and make informed recommendations for corrective action and/or broader business process change
	Participate in or lead special projects.  Includes managing moderate- to high-level projects with minimal guidance; leading teams in mid- and large-scale projects independently and/or with minimal guidance
	Exercise discretion and independent judgment in resolving escalated inquiries or issues
	Ensure assigned goals and objectives are met and that assigned projects and other work are completed on time, to high standards and within budget
	Maintain current knowledge and understanding of Genentech products, medical and business strategies, and external factors that could potentially impact quality practices
	Maintain current knowledge and understanding of the learning landscape, including trends, tools, and techniques
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.Bachelors Degree (business administration, computer/management information systems, computer science or other related discipline) or equivalent experience Graduate-level Degree or higher in related disciplines is a plusProject Management Professional (PMP) or other related certification is preferred Experience working in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or related industry Significant project or program management experience with responsibilities for cross-functional problem-solving and driving change through to successful implementationSignificant experience working with business stakeholders, running business stakeholders/users/customers meetings and proactively developing recommendationsExperience managing and working with external vendorsExperience in leading and managing training programs strongly preferred.  Abilities:Proven track record of meeting or exceeding objectives and goalsOutstanding attention to detailUnderstands and navigate through organizational dynamics, particularly as they relate to quality and complianceUnderstands life sciences regulatory and compliance landscapesImpeccable work ethic and commitment to integrity and qualityAbility to work independently and with minimal supervisionAbility to handle complex business situations and obstacles in a systematic and/or creative manner that produces useful alternatives and solutions.Excellent interpersonal and partnering skills; ability to work collaboratively/effectively with internal & external partners/stakeholders and cross-functional teamsStrong organizational and prioritization skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects of different levels of complexityStrong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skillsExcellent project management skills; proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and goals to ensure timely completion within allotted timelines/deadlines, and without compromise to quality of work output Independent judgment and discretion to evaluate and interpret “gray areas” and matters of significance and make appropriate recommendations on course of actionStrong understanding of multiple customer needs and capable of creating focused responsesStrong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skills, and excellent decision making skillsStrong interpersonal and influencing skills: can effectively and quickly establish rapport with all key internal/external customers, partners and other stakeholders. Can influence without authorityExcellent partnering skills: works well within teams and is effective in collaborating with others internally and externallyStrong customer orientation/focusWorking knowledge of Genentech’s core business practices, principles, procedures, processes and primary business toolsExcellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong technical writing skills. Can provide information through various communication channels meeting the needs of colleagues up to and including SVP level leadersStrong business presentation skills: is comfortable and effective when presenting to others at varying levelsAdvanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint; ability to create slides to visually represent data
											
										
									
								
							
	Bachelors Degree (business administration, computer/management information systems, computer science or other related discipline) or equivalent experience Graduate-level Degree or higher in related disciplines is a plus
	Project Management Professional (PMP) or other related certification is preferred Experience working in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or related industry Significant project or program management experience with responsibilities for cross-functional problem-solving and driving change through to successful implementation
	Significant experience working with business stakeholders, running business stakeholders/users/customers meetings and proactively developing recommendations
	Experience managing and working with external vendors
	Experience in leading and managing training programs strongly preferred.  
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding objectives and goals
	Outstanding attention to detail
	Understands and navigate through organizational dynamics, particularly as they relate to quality and compliance
	Understands life sciences regulatory and compliance landscapes
	Impeccable work ethic and commitment to integrity and quality
	Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision
	Ability to handle complex business situations and obstacles in a systematic and/or creative manner that produces useful alternatives and solutions.
	Excellent interpersonal and partnering skills; ability to work collaboratively/effectively with internal & external partners/stakeholders and cross-functional teams
	Strong organizational and prioritization skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects of different levels of complexity
	Strong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skills
	Excellent project management skills; proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and goals to ensure timely completion within allotted timelines/deadlines, and without compromise to quality of work output 
	Independent judgment and discretion to evaluate and interpret “gray areas” and matters of significance and make appropriate recommendations on course of action
	Strong understanding of multiple customer needs and capable of creating focused responses
	Strong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skills, and excellent decision making skills
	Strong interpersonal and influencing skills: can effectively and quickly establish rapport with all key internal/external customers, partners and other stakeholders. Can influence without authority
	Excellent partnering skills: works well within teams and is effective in collaborating with others internally and externally
	Strong customer orientation/focus
	Working knowledge of Genentech’s core business practices, principles, procedures, processes and primary business tools
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong technical writing skills. Can provide information through various communication channels meeting the needs of colleagues up to and including SVP level leaders
	Strong business presentation skills: is comfortable and effective when presenting to others at varying levels
	Advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint; ability to create slides to visually represent data
	
								
									Who we are
									
										
											A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you have a disability and need an accommodation in connection with the on-line application process, please email us at US.Accommodation@roche.com.
				EEO is the Law
				PAY TRANSPARENCY NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION
				The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

		Working at Roche
	
	
								Job facts
							
	Provide technical support for downstream recovery and purification manufacturing processes and equipment, including but not limited to buffer prep, column packing and chromatography, viral filtration, UFDF, and disposable technology. 
	Design and execute studies, using agreed protocols to support manufacturing operations. Own and drive change implementation over entire life cycle for both temporary and permanent changes.
	Provide cross-functional leadership working closely with Manufacturing, Process Engineering, Quality, and other interdepartmental staff to meet department and company goals.
	Lead advancement in technological and organizational capabilities.
	Promote safety culture that support continuous improvement through active communication and functional area participation in site safety teams.
	Demonstrate understanding of protein purification with advanced mechanical aptitude, problem solving, communication skills, statistics, process monitoring and initiative.
	Provide technical support for manufacturing operations and respond quickly and capably to emergent events that could interrupt manufacturing.
	Serve as subject matter expert (SME) within and across groups on significant technical matters, troubleshooting of on-floor problems including off-hours on-call rotation.
	Own discrepancy impact assessments and support Quality Investigations, CAPAs, and Tracking Actions.
	Provide advanced technical training for campaign, equipment and automation changes.
	Implementation of changes, products, and projects including;
	Change management and owner responsibilities for manufacturing changes.
	Support shutdown planning and campaign readiness activities.
	Provide input for protocol development and on-floor support during debug.
	Champions assigned projects within the context of company objectives and justifies goals to upper management.
	Provide leadership for cross functional teams dedicated to process improvement, efficiency and optimization.
	Presents ideas, project goals, and results across departments and senior leadership.
	Fosters teamwork, and drives project/process improvements.
	Expected to lead cross-functional projects or teams.
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.
Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical engineering, and or equivalent science degree with mfg. downstream experience
8+ years experience troubleshooting complex processes/equipment issues in biotech/pharmaceutical industry
8+ years experience successfully managing, executing and/or delivering projects in the biotech/pharmaceutical industryKnowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Ability to organize, prioritize and solve complex problems through hands on approach and regular use of ingenuity and innovation including Lean Manufacturing tools.
Extensive practical and theoretical engineering expertise in biopharmaceutical manufacturing processes and process development.
Contact with collaborators, regulatory agencies, and vendors inside and outside the company including coordination across organizational lines, advising and influencing upper management on advanced technical matters.
Strong understanding and development of automated manufacturing systems (PLC’s, MCS, MES, etc.)
Exceptional leadership, interpersonal, communication (written and oral), negotiation, collaboration, and management skills.
Demonstrated process knowledge in protein purification, Clean-In-Place, Steam-In-Place, sterile operations, and analytical equipment. 
Knowledge of validation principles, GMP manufacturing processes, quality systems, advanced engineering design fundamentals, regulatory agency expectations and industry trends.         
											
										
									
								
							
	

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical engineering, and or equivalent science degree with mfg. downstream experience
	8+ years experience troubleshooting complex processes/equipment issues in biotech/pharmaceutical industry
	8+ years experience successfully managing, executing and/or delivering projects in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry
	Ability to organize, prioritize and solve complex problems through hands on approach and regular use of ingenuity and innovation including Lean Manufacturing tools.
	Extensive practical and theoretical engineering expertise in biopharmaceutical manufacturing processes and process development.
	Contact with collaborators, regulatory agencies, and vendors inside and outside the company including coordination across organizational lines, advising and influencing upper management on advanced technical matters.
	Strong understanding and development of automated manufacturing systems (PLC’s, MCS, MES, etc.)
	Exceptional leadership, interpersonal, communication (written and oral), negotiation, collaboration, and management skills.
	Demonstrated process knowledge in protein purification, Clean-In-Place, Steam-In-Place, sterile operations, and analytical equipment. 
	Knowledge of validation principles, GMP manufacturing processes, quality systems, advanced engineering design fundamentals, regulatory agency expectations and industry trends. 
	
								
									Who we are
									
										
											A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you have a disability and need an accommodation in connection with the on-line application process, please email us at US.Accommodation@roche.com.

However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

		Working at Roche
	
	
								Job facts
							
	Project Delivery: leading the team through delivery milestones by working with key stakeholders as well as doing hands on work to complete documentation deliverables for the Quality Management System (QMS).
	Leads cross-functional teams for new product development as well as other high priority programs. Ensures project teams achieve commercialization objectives, coordinates collaborations with partners/evaluators, facilitates communications, and develop, drive and maintain schedules for project deliverables. Leads teams and meetings, plans for short- and long-term projects, implements project plans, and provides progress reports.  Works closely with Development, Operations, Quality, Marketing, Regulatory, Medical Affairs and other departments to ensure project priorities and decisions are consistent between teams and corporate strategic plans.   
	Leads a cross-functional project team for complex projects at various stages of research, development and deployment through the product launch.  Monitors, facilitates and prioritizes activities to meet project schedules.  Activities include: communicating project status and critical path items to Sr. Management, developing and implementing timeline plans for product availability, monitoring project resources, convening periodic meetings, issuing meeting agendas and minutes, monitoring team performance goals, and assisting in resolution of problems/critical issues.  Works with and leads cross-functional team consisting of 7 -20 people.  
	Process Champion: working with colleagues in Quality and Regulatory to ensure the processes we use meet all quality and regulatory requirements, but also are lean and efficient for our software business
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.Minimum Qualifications:
Have successfully led large-scale software projects (with multiple tracks of work and teams in multiple locations) from concept to delivery 
A technical or quality management background, with software development experience and an understanding of SaaS 
Strong communication, with the ability to identify and clearly explain challenges, risks, and mitigations and track issues to closure 
Experience in healthcare is required with familiarity working in regulatory environments.
BS degree or equivalent in a directly related discipline (CS, Eng, etc.) 
8 to 10+ years experience

desc:
Careers

	Home
	
		About Roche

		Code4Life
	
	
		Career magazine
	
	
		Service
	
	
		My Career
	
	
		Job search
	
	
		Your application
	
	
		Working at Roche
	
	
								Job facts
							
	Expertly lead ongoing analyses of systems, data, reporting and compliance/business processes, to identify USMA compliance needs and recommend improvements
	Expertly drive process improvements with key stakeholders
	Perform compliance and business landscape assessment(s) to propose strategic solutions and recommendations that advance and streamline processes
	Perform gap analyses to help the business understand impact and benefits in a broader context and drive alignment and decisions
	Monitor business processes for compliance with established policies, SOPs and other guidances
	Manage the end-to-end healthcare and/or medical compliance training program for U.S. Medical Affairs Compliance which includes collaborating with local and global training partners on the appropriate assignment of healthcare compliance and/or medical compliance training and training compliance monitoring
	Expertly manage gMAC monitoring and training deliverables to enable best-in-class medical affairs compliance operations
	Provide timely, accurate and adequate reporting to support the work of others within gMAC, and across business partners, stakeholders and the broader USMA organization and/or beyond.
	Expertly lead analytical efforts to assess and evaluate monitoring data and make informed recommendations for corrective action and/or broader business process change
	Participate in or lead special projects.  Includes managing moderate- to high-level projects with minimal guidance; leading teams in mid- and large-scale projects independently and/or with minimal guidance
	Exercise discretion and independent judgment in resolving escalated inquiries or issues
	Ensure assigned goals and objectives are met and that assigned projects and other work are completed on time, to high standards and within budget
	Maintain current knowledge and understanding of Genentech products, medical and business strategies, and external factors that could potentially impact quality practices
	Maintain current knowledge and understanding of the learning landscape, including trends, tools, and techniques
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.Bachelors Degree (business administration, computer/management information systems, computer science or other related discipline) or equivalent experience Graduate-level Degree or higher in related disciplines is a plusProject Management Professional (PMP) or other related certification is preferred Experience working in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or related industry Significant project or program management experience with responsibilities for cross-functional problem-solving and driving change through to successful implementationSignificant experience working with business stakeholders, running business stakeholders/users/customers meetings and proactively developing recommendationsExperience managing and working with external vendorsExperience in leading and managing training programs strongly preferred. Abilities:Proven track record of meeting or exceeding objectives and goalsOutstanding attention to detailUnderstands and navigate through organizational dynamics, particularly as they relate to quality and complianceUnderstands life sciences regulatory and compliance landscapesImpeccable work ethic and commitment to integrity and qualityAbility to work independently and with minimal supervisionAbility to handle complex business situations and obstacles in a systematic and/or creative manner that produces useful alternatives and solutions.Excellent interpersonal and partnering skills; ability to work collaboratively/effectively with internal & external partners/stakeholders and cross-functional teamsStrong organizational and prioritization skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects of different levels of complexityStrong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skillsExcellent project management skills; proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and goals to ensure timely completion within allotted timelines/deadlines, and without compromise to quality of work output Independent judgment and discretion to evaluate and interpret “gray areas” and matters of significance and make appropriate recommendations on course of actionStrong understanding of multiple customer needs and capable of creating focused responsesStrong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skills, and excellent decision making skillsStrong interpersonal and influencing skills: can effectively and quickly establish rapport with all key internal/external customers, partners and other stakeholders. Can influence without authorityExcellent partnering skills: works well within teams and is effective in collaborating with others internally and externallyStrong customer orientation/focusWorking knowledge of Genentech’s core business practices, principles, procedures, processes and primary business tools Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong technical writing skills. Can provide information through various communication channels meeting the needs of colleagues up to and including SVP level leadersStrong business presentation skills: is comfortable and effective when presenting to others at varying levelsAdvanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint; ability to create slides to visually represent data
											
										
									
								
							
	Bachelors Degree (business administration, computer/management information systems, computer science or other related discipline) or equivalent experience Graduate-level Degree or higher in related disciplines is a plus
	Project Management Professional (PMP) or other related certification is preferred Experience working in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or related industry Significant project or program management experience with responsibilities for cross-functional problem-solving and driving change through to successful implementation
	Significant experience working with business stakeholders, running business stakeholders/users/customers meetings and proactively developing recommendations
	Experience managing and working with external vendors
	Experience in leading and managing training programs strongly preferred. 
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding objectives and goals
	Outstanding attention to detail
	Understands and navigate through organizational dynamics, particularly as they relate to quality and compliance
	Understands life sciences regulatory and compliance landscapes
	Impeccable work ethic and commitment to integrity and quality
	Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision
	Ability to handle complex business situations and obstacles in a systematic and/or creative manner that produces useful alternatives and solutions.
	Excellent interpersonal and partnering skills; ability to work collaboratively/effectively with internal & external partners/stakeholders and cross-functional teams
	Strong organizational and prioritization skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects of different levels of complexity
	Strong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skills
	Excellent project management skills; proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and goals to ensure timely completion within allotted timelines/deadlines, and without compromise to quality of work output 
	Independent judgment and discretion to evaluate and interpret “gray areas” and matters of significance and make appropriate recommendations on course of action
	Strong understanding of multiple customer needs and capable of creating focused responses
	Strong investigational, analytical and complex problem-solving skills, and excellent decision making skills
	Strong interpersonal and influencing skills: can effectively and quickly establish rapport with all key internal/external customers, partners and other stakeholders. Can influence without authority
	Excellent partnering skills: works well within teams and is effective in collaborating with others internally and externally
	Strong customer orientation/focus
	Working knowledge of Genentech’s core business practices, principles, procedures, processes and primary business tools Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong technical writing skills. Can provide information through various communication channels meeting the needs of colleagues up to and including SVP level leaders
	Strong business presentation skills: is comfortable and effective when presenting to others at varying levels
	Advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint; ability to create slides to visually represent data
	
								
									Who we are
									
										
											A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you have a disability and need an accommodation in connection with the on-line application process, please email us at US.Accommodation@roche.com.

								Job facts
							
	Deploying Bina’s product on customer sites or on the cloud (AWS).
	Manage all managed services, things like managing github, amazon, building stuff around it that makes it more consistent and less manual – more automated.
	Building monitoring tools for things we use internally or are putting out in the field.
	Monitor performance characteristics on a regular basis and implement configuration change that provides consistent performance with an eye for scale.
	Developing deployment and monitoring tools to improve the product maintainability and reliability.
	Escalating customer’s technical product issues to the engineering team for troubleshooting and resolution.
	Participating in product design and development, customer training, support, and sales activities as needed.
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field
1-6+ years in Systems Engineering/DevOps roleExperience:
Are you a Generalist to an extreme? Yes? This is ideal.
Is this personal to you? Because you will need passion to learn fast and embrace the opportunity to build superb software products for genome and cancer analysis.
You will need to understand programming and be able to think like a developer.  WWADD? (what would a developer do?) ...At the same time you will need to do a fair amount of what is generally considered to be IT and SysAdmin, debug network issues, storage issues, operating systems – and be moderately advanced across all three systems.
Fluency at system-level with mainstream Linux distributions (Debian or Ubuntu preferred).
Ability to script in your sleep in at least one scripting/software language (Bash, Python, perl, Java).
Solid understanding of networking fundamentals gained through hands management of network, server, storage and operating systems.
Veteran level expertise with Amazon cloud (AWS) environment, utilities, and tools.
Solid experience working with complex software products like databases, application servers, distributed systems, etc., with the ability to read logs and troubleshoot issues.
Highly motivated with the ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Software Development: This role includes some hands-on software development to write high quality software that will perform at scale, be supportable, and be extensible.
	
Process & Operations: Lead the team to deliver on their commitments, ensuring the design and planning is accurate and work is delivered on time with quality; ensure the software stack integrates with our existing CI pipeline and lead improvement in the DevOps toolset.

		Working at Roche
	
	
								Job facts
							
	Portfolio Analysts support targeted, effective, and efficient business planning processes by synthesizing and summarizing key portfolio analytics to enable informed decisions for ever-improving business resultss
	Support continuous improvement and best practices for portfolio analytics, insights and reporting.
	Plays a key role in identifying any data gaps and ways to leverage existing data for maximum business use, value and impact.
	Provide insights on the project portfolio and proposals to improve the overall portfolio outlook both from a profitability and growth perspective.
	Create and improve portfolio review processes including budgeting, project go/no go, portfolio balancing, 10Y sales & OP projections, and capacity management. 
	Portfolio analysis and R&D progress and performance reports; including data extraction from SQL databases, data blending with Alteryx,data visualization using tableau reports, and business presentations (budget dashboards, capacity analysis, and project and portfolio reports).
	Contributes to the Business Plan Process through use of analytical and financial data, models and other techniques to derive insights. Includes conducting ad hoc analyses as requested. 
	Supports Life Cycle Teams, Finance and other stakeholders with analytics and reporting to facilitate monthly, quarterly and annual spend forecasting. This includes conducting monthly and ad hoc snapshots.
	Presents data and insights both verbally and in writing. Where applicable, involves external vendors supporting portfolio analytics and insights reporting. 
	Works with manager and other internal partners/stakeholders to establish and implement standardised rules, methodologies and processes to manage portfolio analytics from creation through retirement. 
	Provide training and support to LCLs, IBLs, PMs and Finance on new tools and processes.
	System administration and training support for portfolio tools (ex. SPMT).
	Ad-hoc projects / initiatives in R&D related to portfolio management.     
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.Minimum Qualifications:
 
Bachelors degree in business, finance, life sciences or related discipline.
3 year in product development, project management, and/or portfolio analytics. 
Preferred Qualifications: 
Master’s degree in business, finance, life sciences, or equivalent combination of education and work-related experience.     
4+ years experience within the medical device industry or high technology environment.        
Other Qualifications:
 
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including speaking in front of small and large groups  Medical Device industry specific knowledge including current feature/functionality and technology trends. Good knowledge and use Excel, Think Cell, Power Point, MS Windows, MS Office, and MS Visio, (MS Project desirable). Proficiency in Tableau, data visualization techniques, and data exploratory analysis a must.
											
										
									
								
							
	Bachelors degree in business, finance, life sciences or related discipline.

	Master’s degree in business, finance, life sciences, or equivalent combination of education and work-related experience.

								Job facts
							
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.• High School Diploma or equivalent with at least 2 years previous administrative experience or Associates Degree with 1 year administrative experience. 
• Proven ability to make quick and effective decisions.
• Ability to handle multiple functions at one time. 
• Efficient and effective oral and written communication skills. 
• Intermediate computer skills including the ability to do some advanced functions within various software packages. 
• Ability to work with confidential information.
											
										
									
								
							
	
								
									Who we are
									
										
											As a global leader in healthcare, Roche Diagnostics offers a broad portfolio of products, tools and services that help in the prevention, diagnosis and management of diseases like HPV, HIV, hepatitis and diabetes as well as other medical conditions,such as fertility and blood coagulation. 								Job facts
							
	
Maintain the compliance database(s) by entering data.
	
Extract, analyze and interpret compliance data and present findings to internal and external stakeholders.
	
Design and develop data analysis tools to facilitate GMP compliance data trending.
	
Perform advanced tasks and work independently to achieve company goals and organizational objectives.
	
Follow company policies and procedures.
	
Set personal performance goals and provide input to departmental objectives.
	
Establish work priorities to meet targets and timelines.
	
Manage competing priorities and allocate, adjust, and optimize assigned department resources.
	
Participate in efforts to develop strategies to meet needs of the business.
	
Review and respond to problem reports, monitor issues and initiate resolution and/or discrepancies.
	
Provide queries and ad-hoc reports as needed for Inspections/Audits and business purposes.
	
Participate in the development of queries and ad-hoc reports as needed.
	
Provide general end-user support; perform maintenance on new and existing Quality Computer Systems (ie; QPP).
	
Applies company knowledge and intermediate technical expertise to complete complex assignments within defined parameters.
	
Exercise good judgment when making decisions. Make complex decisions in collaboration with key stakeholders. Review decisions with direct Supervisor/Manager.
	
Participate in efforts for the evaluation of business use of the software and training materials to ensure alignment according to intended use.
	
Train personnel including internal and external customers on relevant business processes.
	
Notify Management of potential quality or regulatory issues that may affect regulatory compliance of our systems or processes.
	
Be accountable for behaviors as described in Genentech's Core, Common, and Critical Competencies.
	
Perform any other tasks as requested by Management to support Quality oversight activities.
	
Lead or participate in User Group Forums both locally and across regions. Take information from forums and disseminate globally.
	
Participate in internal and external GMP audits as required, to gain a deeper understanding of the audit data & business process.
	
Attends meetings, conferences and workshops benchmarking industry activities.
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.Qualifications: Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills:
(Minimum requirements)

Strong knowledge of computer systems and other relevant compendia. Able to interpret and apply to operations with minimal supervision.

Ability to interpret and relate Quality standards for implementation and review.

Ability to make sound decisions and manage priorities with minimal input from supervisor.

Demonstrates high personal and professional ethical standards.

Ability to communicate clearly and professionally both in writing and verbally.

Flexibility in problem solving to meet business objectives.

Interacts primarily with co-workers, supervisor, internal and external stakeholders and management. May begin leading interactions with internal and external customers and leading teams cross-functionally.

Bachelors or Masters Degree, preferably in a scientific discipline and/or equivalent work experience.

7+ years working in a regulated GMP environment.

		Working at Roche
	
	
								Job facts
							
	 Completes drug safety monitoring and tracking in a timely, thorough and accurate manner in accordance with pharmacovigilance (PV) and related standards, regulations and Genentech/Roche Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) (~60% and as per business needs)
	
Reviews, evaluates and verifies potential AE information to determine required action per internal policies and procedures
	
Provides medical assessment on all cases for seriousness / validity / causality and conducts quality review of all cases (as applicable) including medical review of information entered in the safety database for completeness and coherency
	
Performs follow up (e.g. Drug specific questionnaires / Pregnancy reports etc.) for all reported cases (as applicable) based on their assessment (i.e. Medically significant, non-serious, invalid etc.) to capture complete medical picture of an ICSR
	
Medically reviews ancillary documentation accompanying Individual Case Safety Reports (ICSRs) and identifies medically relevant safety information for incorporation into the Global Safety Database
	
Demonstrates understanding of appropriate labeling documents for Genentech/ Roche molecules and products and performs labelling assessment for AE(s) received using clinical knowledge
	
Identifies and collaborate with external stakeholders for Antibody testing requests
	
Responsible for identifying ICSRs requiring expedited safety reporting to Health Authorities. (~5%)
	
Responsible for review and implementation of internal Manuals, global / local safety SOPs / Work Instructions (applicable to USDS). Identify the need for creating additional or updating existing local Guidance Documents including but not limited to training matrix and identify appropriate target audience for training assignment. (~3%)
	
Demonstrates a general understanding of protocol management in accordance with PV related standards, regulations and Genentech/Roche Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to support the protocol review process for supported/funded studies (~10%)
	
Perform Post Authorization Safety Assessment (PASS) classification for all Genentech /Roche supported studies based on medical knowledge and European Union (EU) regulations
	
Assists in reviewing Safety Data Exchange Agreements (as applicable)
	
Participates and supports the Supported Research Team (as applicable)
	
Assists in AE reconciliation and/or Case Transmission Verification (CTV) activities (as applicable)
	
Acts as single point of contact for safety related issues
	
Acts as Safety Liaison between Safety Science and Supported Research Team
	
Oversees Safety related activities for assigned Genentech/ Roche Product(s) managed by US Medical Affairs to include (~10%)
	
Demonstrates advanced knowledge of the safety profile to include comprehensive working knowledge of appropriate labeling documents for assigned Genentech/ Roche Product(s)
	
Communicates and updates Team of any process related issues/ concerns
	
Acts as single point of contact for safety related concerns
	
Acts as Safety Liaison between Safety Science, Supported Research Teams (SRT) and Medical Team
	
Responsible for medical review and updating of safety sections for documents e.g. pregnancy letters and notify appropriate stakeholders of any changes in executive summary of aggregate reports
	
Assist in implementation of Risk Management Plans (RMP) / Risk Minimization activities or Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies (REMS) for assigned molecules / products
	
Assists in projects under the direction of US Drug Safety management or project lead (~10%)
	
Contribute to the preparation and development of Drug Safety presentations for internal/external stakeholders as applicable (~2%)
	
Liaise with Compliance and Training (CAT) / Business Operations Analytics and Market Research and Patient Support (BAM) teams within USDS to ensure all processes are implemented

Supports the onboarding and training of new personnel

Provides support during audits and inspections

Acts as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for safety related activities within Global Safety Database per Genentech/Roche SOPs
	
Supports the onboarding and training of new personnel
	
Provides support during audits and inspections
	
Acts as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for safety related activities within Global Safety Database per Genentech/Roche SOPs
	
Demonstrates capability to comprehend medical information
	
Works effectively, independently and collaboratively
	
Strong organizational skills, detail oriented and adapts in a fast paced, changing environment
	
Demonstrates ownership, initiative and accountability
	
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
	
Ability to prioritize tasks in a timely manner
	
Ability to interact effectively in a multifunctional, multidisciplinary team setting
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.Education, Experience, and Other Requirements:
 

Health Care Professional degree (e.g. RN/BSN/MSN, NP, PA, RPh/ PharmD/ B.Pharm or MD) (Required)

Minimum 1 to 2 years of clinical or Safety related experience (Preferred)

Writing experience; science/medical writing (Preferred)

Computer proficiency (Required) 

Able to travel as per business needs
										
									
								
							
	
Health Care Professional degree (e.g. RN/BSN/MSN, NP, PA, RPh/ PharmD/ B.Pharm or MD) (Required)
	
Minimum 1 to 2 years of clinical or Safety related experience (Preferred)
	
Writing experience; science/medical writing (Preferred)
	
Computer proficiency (Required) 
	
Able to travel as per business needs

	Architect/develop/evaluate deep learning models.

	Collaborate with bioinformatics, software engineering, and data science teams
	
								
									Who you are
									
										
											
												You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. 
Minimum Qualifications and Skills:
PhD (with 0 to 2 years of related experience) or Master's degree (with 3 to 5 years of related experience) in Computer Science, Information Theory, Physics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
Strong foundation in Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, with demonstrated experience, either professional or academic.
Solid software engineering skills and fluency with modern software engineering practices (version control, code reviewing, etc.)
Good communication skills; team player 
 
Desired Qualifications:  
Knowledge of neural networks, especially RNNs
Experience with DL frameworks: TensorFlow, Caffe, Torch, Theano
Experience with Cloud Computing (AWS or gcloud)
Backend software engineering experience with C++ or Java
Experience with signal processing; speech or acoustic modeling a big plus
Experience or interest in genomics and bioinformatics
GPU programming experience
